Review_Date: Fabio C wrote a review Mar 22
Review_Title: Great Marrakech experience in a cozy riad with extraordinary gentle staff
Review_Text: Very nice and cozy riad. Gentle staff nice room great service. Convenient location in the old city centre near to all major touristic spots but out of the chaotic very central area. We arrived late on a Monday morning after a rather tiring trip and they were so kind to offer a free breakfast!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is the most amazing place. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. Marrakech is a busy city but as soon as you walk though the door here you feel at ease and completely calm. The Riad is amazing for art deco lovers. The rooms are beautiful and so is the rest of the Riad. There is a spa a pool and a jacuzzi on the rooftop. The breakfast and restaurant are very good and high quality. I would definitely recommend staying here if you have the chance. I will be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lesley B wrote a review Mar 9
Review_Text: We stayed at the Makassar hotel for a week and from the moment we walked through the door felt at ease as though we had stepped into another world from the busy streets of the city. Privileged to be staying in an original design art deco riad. The room and bathroom were really special made out throughout to an art deco design. We were charmed by the house buntings hopping in the interior courtyard while we enjoyed a leisurely breakfast where we were offered a selection of cakes and refreshing fruit salads and yoghurts and copious amounts of coffee. All the reception and restaurant staff were friendly and helpful. Trips and transport seamlessly arranged. A good location within easy walking distance of the main square and the Bahia Palace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful with really thoughtful art deco design in a very grand building. The staff are incredible particularly the new manager Samira who helped with making a restaurant booking for us and organising treatments and taxis.    The roof terrace was lovely and the weather warm considering the time of year. The top pool and jacuzzi were not in use but that didn't matter we used the jacuzzi in the spa.    The rooms are lovely and well equipped - we stayed in a junior suite - boutet de monvel. It's a nicely decorated dark room situated on the first floor with the courtyard below and benches outside. The shower is very modern with a radio and cool lighting.    Breakfast there is really good especially the fresh orange juice and cake each morning.    We had dinner in the restaurant one night and it was nice. You can buy wine with your meal or the mint tea is good.    The hammam and treatments were very relaxing ... would recommend.    The hotel is located in the old town and we felt very comfortable walking through the souks to the main square for haggling with the very friendly sellers. We bought lots of little trinkets to bring back.    A lovely experience overall in Morocco and cannot wait to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard R wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Fabulous hotel where nothing was too much trouble!!
Review_Text: Everyone at Villa Makassar made our stay special the rooms were superb fabulous roof terrace lovely restaurant for breakfast and dinner all in the old Kasbah in Marrakesh. Everyone in the team were so kind nothing was too much trouble we’ll definitely be back! Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Saul P wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: We enjoyed an excellent stay at Villa Makassar for 5 nights in late Jan.    Visual:  Taste may be subjective however I loved the stylish art deco decor. Everything was clean and housekeeping ensured our room was kept tidy throughout.    Atmosphere:  Perfect if you're looking for a quiet relaxed stay. With a relatively small number of rooms it's an escape from the madness of Marrakech. It gives the hotel a very personal feel with staff trying their best to accommodate you (personal thanks to Samira). The rooftop was ideal for chilling out in the sun too.    Experience:  Overall it was a great place to unwind. Not too far from the centre of the medina (about a 15min walk) so it was easy to explore the city on foot. Loved the hammam in the downstairs spa - just need to book it and use of the jacuzzi in advance. Only criticism would be the WiFi was a bit patchy but more of an excuse to enjoy your surroundings!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jo C wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We stayed at Villa Makassar for 5 nights in November and had the best time! Villa Makassar is so nice! You walk in through a modest entrance where you wouldn’t even really notice there’s a hotel from the outside. Then you step inside to an oasis… calming music gorgeous designs soothing scents and fresh mint tea and cookies are there to welcome you upon arrival.    The room was spacious comfortable and clean. Large bed and every day they would clean the room and light fresh incense so it smelt amazing. The Art Deco style all around the hotel is beautiful and gives it a unique feeling.    The staff are amazing and will go above and beyond to make sure you have a good stay. They also helped book excursions and brought out cake on my birthday to make it extra special. The spa was soooo nice and relaxing and we had great massages.    We had a 3 course dinner at the hotel on the first night- delicious! Every morning for breakfast they brought out different treats and were happy to cater to special food requests any time of day.    Honestly can’t recommend this hotel enough and would definitely stay again next time we’re in Marrakech.    Thank you so much to all the staff for making our stay so lovely!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Theboss w wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A JEWEL in an amazing city. Villa Makassar comes highly recommended. Thank you for looking after us.
Review_Text: WOW! What an amzing find. Such a stunning hotel; beautifully decorated and very clean and comfortable. The bed and pillows were super comfy.  More important ALL of the staff really looked after us they could not do enough for us. Jamelia was gorgeous to us.  We used the SPA and had a hammam and a massage  Amazing!!  The hotel is in a really great area super safe. This place comes highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a few days shy of two weeks in Marrakesh sometime in mid-August this year.    Our trip was filled with wonder and adventure. The area in the Old Town in which Villa Makassar stands in was ideal for us - the hotel’s immediate surroundings are calm yet well-connected and the hotel is just down the road to an array of vibrant local shops businesses and squares.    Luckily for us we travelled during a relatively calmer time of the year - there weren’t many tourists. The staff at the Villa Makassar were extremely accommodating and proved themselves to be excellent hosts like none other.    We stayed in the Junior Suite which offered us everything we needed. The breakfasts were an absolute delight we still dream of them to this day. The lunch and dinner services are just as excellent.    The spa services were relaxing and helped us regenerate before our day trips that the hotel helped us organise. We recommend the trip to the Atlas Mountains!    We cannot express how grateful we are to all the staff at the Villa Makassar from the cooks to the cleaners from the reception staff to the spa specialists and finally the administration. We will definitely make our way back and we’ll definitely be staying with you again!    Special thanks to Salma Abdel Youssef Jamila Ali and Ibrahim.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: George W wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The most amazing experience from start to finish we would definitely recommend and return here in the future. The staff were all so friendly and attentive the hotel was beautiful cool stylish relaxing.  No time limits with food you could eat drink or snack when ever you want.  It was quiet and peaceful a good distance away from the busy markets. I recomend you eat breakfast downstairs in the courtyard and dinner and drinks on the rooftop terrace. I don't usually leave reviews but I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Thank you to everyone at Villa makassar for making mine and my wife's anniversary that bit more special
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a stunning property and the perfect place to stay in Marrakech if you need tranquility and relaxation.    Fouad Salma and the team go above and beyond to ensure the stay is as comfortable and tailored to your needs as possible.    Couldn’t recommend highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Victoria W wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Coming back to the Villa Makassar felt like coming back home the wonderful staff made an absolute fuss of us and I have to say our rooms were spacious and stunning with beautiful Art Deco objets .  With all the Covid issues we weren’t able to travel for a long time  so I can’t tell you enough how great it was to come back and be spoilt this way !  We each had an hour massage in their spa  the masseuse used this delicious verveine oil  a fantastic way to start our holiday in Marrakech.  We decided to have our aperitif drinks every evening our their stunning roof top  watching the sunset  what a sight !!!  All in all had a fabulous week in a magical place  thank you Villa Makassar  we shall définition come back .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Myself and my Fiance spent 5 nights at the fantastic Villa Makassar in May 2022 and honestly we wish we could have stayed longer! The hotel itself is so beautiful and interesting- the stunnng pool and roof terrece are just what you need after a busy morning exploring Marrakesh. We stayed in the superior suite which was beautiful! What really stands out though is the staff- they make the place. They are incredibly friendly and always go out of their way to help you and make your day. The food is also delicious- there's always a different breakfast which is a fun surprise each morning! The location is also great as it's about a half hour walk into the medina which means you're at a perfect distance from the hustle and bustle and can have some calm. We can't wait to return!

Review_Date: Pauline G wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Went to Marrakech for business offsite !  Had the chance to go to their Riad in Atlas Mountain as well as their Riad in the city centre ! staff is adorable and welcoming ! The food is awesome and both venues are magical !  We ve done a cooking class with mountain view ! It was memorable ! Salma has helped us so much with organising ! She knows what she is doing and is a plus for your trip organisation ! On top of all Memories will stay for ever ! They deserve a big SHOUT OUT !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: William M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: I need to write 5 reviews!!! Fantastic place, fantastic people.
Review_Text: This is the most personable hotel I have ever been to and I have stayed in some nice hotels. They will greet you with a warm welcome. On occasion I sat down and talked with several of the people while there. They were encouraging and helpful.    The airline destroyed my suitcase - Tumi. Zipper mangled and unusable - large number of teeth gone. They sent it out and had a new zipper in 1 day. Cost was about $15. They personally walked us to a store we needed to go to. Wasn't far but not readily identifiable. My special thanks to Brahim. I would like to mention everyone but he really helped.    It is a beautiful historic hotel/house. Very spacious and comfortable. When you enter you are in a comfort zone which is a nice contrast to the streets of Marrakesh. There is a small pool area and a spacious rooftop area. It feels like you are in a very nice home. The art deco touches were done long ago.    Easy walk to get to some places like Bahia Palace and Djemaa El Fna.

Review_Date: yassine zaimi wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: The coolest lobby in Marrakech….  As you'll learn if you visit the Villa Makassar - Art Deco Hotel & Spa is a truly impressive architectural. It's a great spot to relax. I would argue that the location architecture SPA and service make this the best place to stay in Marrakech.    My wife and I checked in at Villa Makassar - Art Deco Hotel & Spa on 05/23/2022. Registration was very easy and every staff member I encountered from the check- in to the cleaning staff were delightful and eager to help. the restaurant food was THE BEST EVER. The manager was very friendly. we then went to our room. we found food ready in the table as requested with a Moroccan Mint tea. The fridge was very cleaned and filled with soft drinks.    We had a great massage by one of the staff that I really forgot her name she was very knowledgeable and friendly (I recommend everyone to ask about this lady I believe her name is Kamar). The swimming pool SPA was very clean and warm.    We loved the roof top specially for breakfast. I Highly recommend it!    we will definitely come again…….

Review_Date: Max Davey wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Beautiful Art Deco Riad in Kasbah, Marrakech
Review_Text: We had an incredible 5 night stay at the Villa Makassar in Marrakech. All the staff were friendly attentive and helpful and our hostess was brilliant. She very kindly upgraded us on the first night!    The Suite Deluxe was very luxurious and spacious. All the facilities in the room were brilliant and we slept well. Everything was perfect.    We had a fantastic time exploring the culture in the city and when it got too hot/we needed some downtime we spent it either on the roof of the Riad next to the cool jacuzzi or taking a dip in their non-heated pool (which was much needed in the 37-degree heat!) The pool was a highlight - felt like a hidden/private spot for us to cool down.    The restaurant was brilliant - the quality of the food was incredible. It was heavenly to have a quiet spot to eat and relax away from the busyness of the city.    This was the holiday of our dreams and Villa Makassar was a huge part of that. Thank you for helping us create unforgettable memories. Couldn't recommend it enough to anyone staying in Marrakech.

Beautiful Art Deco hotel in Marrakech!  Interior beauty topped only by the staff who are more than accommodating with the answer to everything being “as you like”.  Reception was elegant and very welcoming.  Breakfast served everyday in our choice of setting… restaurant in our suite and the stunning terrace. Service was impeccable.  Our room was extra fabulous and the spa services were the best experienced in all of Morocco  There are many luxury options in Marrakech. We visited and dined at some of them but would undoubtedly choose Villa Marrakech for a number of reasons….  1. The staff!!! Professional accommodating welcoming and wanting you to have the best experience possible. I cannot thank them enough.  2. This is a small boutique hotel only 10 rooms allowing the staff to provide personalized service.  3. The terrace. We had visited other hotel terraces in Marrakech and the steady stream of tourists made me very happy to return to the privacy and beauty of ours.  4. The location in the Kasbah allowed us to experience the authenticity of a true Marrakech area.  5. By far the best dining experience in all of or 3+ week stay in Morocco. One of the very best in all of my travels. Youssef took personal care to prepare a visually stunning table and this was accompanied with a playlist of our favourite music. Their talented chef prepared a 5* dinner. Every detail was meticulous.    We will most definitely return  ❤️❤️
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stylish Art Deco Riad In Marrakech
Review_Text: A wonderful place to stay in Marrakech it really lives up to its art deco billing. Lovely authentic interior combined with charming & attentive staff. Trip to their "Domain" (country villa) in the Atlas mountains was also very good.    Fascinating architecture complemented by period art and sculpture.    We stayed in Rousseau Suite which was large and comfortable with small balcony and view over the courtyard.    This riad is very central to the old parts of town - within the walls. A great location if you want to walk explore soaking up the traditional feel of Marrakech.

Stayed for 1 night in Villa Makassar.  Very nice and friendly place. Beautiful terras and quiet.    Great service from the staff.  Manager FatimeZhara was very helpful and very communicative.    I was looking for a peaceful and relaxing place and Villa Makassar gave me what I needed. I´ll definitely be coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Feel transported back in time in this luxurious 1920’s inspired Riad. Delicious breakfasts nice size rooms fun décor and a restful top floor patio. Khadija made sure that everything was taken care of and gave great tips on the local area and restaurants.

Everything was perfect.  The staff is incredible.Always present with great suggestions and couldn't have been more nice and useful.  Special thanks to madame Kadija and Abdul..  We will defenitly be back.

The location was perfect not too far from the main square.    Would definitely stay at the Villa on another visit to Marakesh.

Review_Text: My husband and I really enjoyed the hospitality and great customer service! They went above and beyond and even allowed for a late check out since our flight was later in the day. Beautiful property with an upscale vibe.

Review_Date: Alex S wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Villa Makassar really was an amazing place and surpassed all expectations. The staff were incredible and could not have done more for us; Khadija in particular was fantastic. She was very friendly helpful and nothing was too much of an ask. The rooms were well put-together and spacious. The lobby and terrace areas were extremely relaxing and comfortable. The location is also very good; about a 15-20 minute walk to the main square in the Medina positioned on a relatively quiet (well quiet for Marrakech at least) side street. From start to finish we could not have asked for more and Villa Makassar really made our stay in Morocco. It was so great to be able to return to this oasis of calm after a day out in the Medina or in the desert. Would highly recommend.

Review_Date: Thomas K wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: If you like elegance exclusivity and fabulous taste this boutique Hotel is for you. The rooms are pure art deco the stylish restaurant and lounge make you feel like your home away from home. Bravo to the owners to have created such a dream.

Review_Title: Nice Base to Explore the Medina
Review_Text: Art Deco throughout -some slightly strange themes (we had a bust of Lenin in our room).  Nicely equipped large Riad.Service can be a little slow but is always cheerful.Great position on the edge of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeff Z wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: The building was very lovely and the staff were all perfect. I was comfortable and everyone was friendly and went over and above the expectations.    The shower was a bit weak not working properly and the TV a bit strange but overall everything was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Olivia T wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: we stayed first 2 and last 2 nights of our week in Morocco at this lovely hotel very well positioned in a quiet street in the old part of Marrakech. Really friendly and helpful staff nice rooms and really lovely roof terrace with jacuzzi and sun beds great for lunch in the sunshine.

Review_Date: Rick M wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: After a slight frustration with getting responses on offered room upgrades and airport collection we arrived and were bowled over by the hotel and staff.    Literally nothing was too much trouble for the team. They were not just polite and helpful but gave the impression that making your stay wonderful was a pleasure for them. They give you space to enjoy the facilities but are responsive and helpful at any time. Wonderful.    The hotel and rooms are spacious elegant and both beautiful and comfortable. The pool and roof terrace are often able to be enjoyed alone like you have your own private space.    Location wise the place is GREAT. Based in the Kasbah area there is a vibrant energy right outside (although you do not hear this from within) - and the markets and main square are a short (10 - 20 minutes depending on how much you amble) walk away.    Highly recommended. An amazing experience. I'll definitely be back.

Review_Date: Patricia F wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel inside the Medina. with only 10 rooms there’s a lot of attention to details. The staff is particularly kind and attentive to your every need. Karima was extremely efficient and helpful with all matters including what was not part of the hotel packages. The tour organized by the hotel is really wonderful with lunch at the Domaine Makassar outside the city is a real piece of paradise! It made for a very special stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The place was very nicecalm and clean. Loved the birds in the morning.the facilities were awesome. The staff were very helpful and also very accommodating with our request.room cleaning on daily basis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at
Review_Text: We stayed at the Villa Makassar in February 2018 a little off season so it felt as though we had the place to ourselves.    The inner Riad courtyard is the perfect relaxing antidote to the hive of activity outside the hotel at the end of a day at the Medina. The art deco interior is to die for - I could spend hours on end sat relaxing at one of the many cosy and quiet spots with a mint tea or a whisky. The staff were so attentive and friendly that my only dilemma during the stay at the hotel was choosing which of the many serene corners to sit at.    The meals were excellent and the place had a real rhythm to it as day turns into night and back again something which is perhaps harder to master at a modern hotel. The hotel provided transfers to and from the airport and a selection of day excursions from Marrakech we chose Essaouira.    The location was ideal on a quieter street but still only a short walk to the heart of the action.

We stayed in Villa Makassar several days and we enjoyed our stay very much there. Staff there especially Rashid was very helpful. Food is great rooms are clean beds are comfortable. Location is in the middle of Medina of Marakkesh where you can walk to spice market or square. Even though the area hotel is located is a little back street of Medina it was safe and hotel was your safe heaven. We do recommend everyone this hotel to people who are looking for a nice hotel inside old Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maria Camille H wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Title: Hip and peaceful Riad inside Marrakech Medina
Review_Text: This was the starting point for our trip to Morocco with 6 and 8 year old kids. It was well-appointed with all high-end amenities and the service was excellent. As with other Riads it is completely inconspicuous on the outside and then you step in to peace beauty and tranquility on the inside. Would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Karima was an attentive host and paid attention to the details. The Riad is tucked away on a quiet side street but still close to the action in the Kasbah. Breakfast was tasty and filling - eggs made to order upon request. Upon late morning checkout we were given two takeaway sandwiches for our trip home which we never even requested - so thoughtful and appreciated.    Wish we could have stayed longer to use the spa facilities.    Shower taps are a bit funky and need a bit of TLC.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Beautiful riad with exceptional staff. This place is quiet perfectly located the restaurant is delicious the staff incredibly attentive and the room lovely. Don't stay any place else in Marrakech! Be sure to visit the spa . . . twice! Also see if they will do a cooking class. It was super fun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 days. Beautiful hotel with lovely rooms but the staff of the hotel are the stars of the show.  The restaurant was wonderful. We took a cooking class which was instructional and food was delicious. The chefs were stand outs.  Front office staff was helpful in all ways.  The spa services were relaxing. The staff there was professional.  The rooms were well taken care of each day.  Would recommend this hotel. Easy location to walk around the Medina also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Perfect place if you are looking for a quite place elegant but not posh! I felt immediately at home. It is clean...staff is very helpful... nice and not intrusive. Excellent breakfast as well as dinner. A special mention to the spa. If again in Marrakesh that’s will be my place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Samy Louna wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We had the chance to stay a night in this beautiful hotel and we had a very pleasant stay. It's close enough to the busy and hectic streets of the medina but far enough to be in a very quiet and relaxing atmosphere. The rooms are very comfortable and the staff is extremely helpful and nice. You have to check out the pool which is a gem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michele B wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: I only stayed one night as I needed to check out of the private home I was staying at for a group trip as another group came in. It was the best night of my whole trip! Food was great as was the spa and pool. Dinner in the open atrium was fabulous. I would come back and stay here again for a longer trip in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We stayed for3 nights at this Riad. Our experience was mixed. Our emails for an airport pick up went unanswered so we had to call and do the needful. The check in was good and car and driver sent for pickup was waiting for us. The location of the hotel is 10 minutes walk to Jemaa el Fnaa and Most sights like Badian Palace and Saadian tombs are a short walk away. The room however was a tad disappointing as was small and so was the bathroom. The bed was very comfy and seemed to be queen sized. The breakfast was included and was very good. The dinner recommendation for a fine dining restaurant was not too good as the place was extremely expensive and the food and service just ok.  The girls st the reception were however very helpful in arranging a driver and car for a day to see sights around the newer parts of the city like Jardin Majorelle.  All in all it was a good stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Such a beautiful and well kept hotel with loads of character and charm.
Review_Text: A gem. Not what you would expect in the Kasbah but it is a haven of tranquility. The staff are all really friendly helpful and attentive. Each room has a slightly different feel but the overall Art Deco style is tasteful and stylish. We loved it. Thank you to all who worked in the background to make our stay relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Virginia O wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: beautiful hotel extremely helpful. I have travelled to many places but have never had the experience Ive had in Marrakesh thanks to Widad and the entire Staff!  For the 5 days we decided to spend in Marrakesh they made us feel like it was our home and were always a helping hand at all times!    The riad is perfectly located. Mohammed drove us everywhere and made our rides filled with laughters and great conversations. Widad organized everything for us as we arrived without having organized anything ahead of time.    It was the perfect vacation! I have nothing to criticize except for the fact that we should've prolonged our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kris V wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: A beautiful boutique hotel tucked away in a corner street in Kasbah Marrakech. We were there celebrating our wedding anniversary and we had such great time. The staff of the hotel were extremely friendly and pleasant. Madame Ouidad at the front desk always with a smile looked after needs and ensured our stay was very nice. Definitely a place to come back to again. Than you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Had a wonderful stay at Villa Makassar made all the more enjoyable with the professional service provided by Ouidat and Mohammed our driver.    Ouidat went out of her way to help us make reservations and arrange transport from wherever we were which was above and beyond. The service was exceptional.    Ouidat made our holiday really enjoyable and hastle free.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Winter Sun in the heart of the Marrakech medina.
Review_Text: We enjoyed a week here in February when the weather was snowing in Britain. Our Riad the Villa Makassar gave us a wonderful welcome of mint tea and cakes and advice on what to do in Marrakech fior the rest of the week. Our first thing was to enjoy the traditional hamman and massage. The spa here is excellent and you can relax in the indoor pool afterwards. I would like to thank the ladies in the hamman and Ouidad on the reception who always helped us when we had been out exploring the city. We took a private drive with the hotel chauffeur Mohammed to the Atlas Mountains and we thoroughly enjoyed visiting the olive oil factory and our selfies with the camel. The decor here is very tasteful dark colours to bring out the Art Deco theme. Our daily breakfast was always a surprise with the selection of Morrocain cakes and choice of eggs. The hotel is situated within a 15 minute walk to the big square and transfers for visiting the Majorelle gardens are easily arranged by the reception. The roof terrace is very comfortable too. Thankyou to everyone at Villa Makassar!

Review_Date: Stephen C wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Perfect place to stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: We took a family trip to Marrakesh and were fortunate enough to stay at Villa Makassar. We loved everything about it. The rooms and public areas were beautiful (the owner collects art and objects from around the world and has a great eye) the food was excellent the staff gracious and the location perfect. Someone from the hotel met us at the airport and when we arrived the owner himself gave us a tour of the Villa and very helpful guidance about how to see the city. During our stay the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. They suggested places for dinner all of which were excellent and made reservations for us. When our daughter had to leave the hotel at 4am for the airport they provided transportation and even prepared breakfast for her before she left. Those little touches were very special. We will certainly return to Villa Makassar on our next trip to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: after many years still to be on the top
Review_Text: what a pleasure to rediscover this beautiful Riad  in Marrakech it s like main city in europe every months new places open at the beginning all is perfect and with the time all become less and less attentive  at Villa Makassar it is opposite  all is better end better really high level of services buildings are so well maintenied you can feel that the owner and his team are proud and in love with their home  it was my third stay and it was  as usual a pure happiness moment  thanks to them
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great experience!!! Super service !! Perfect location!
Review_Text: I stood at villa Makassar for several days and we had a great time  everything is really clean the service is super detailed and makes you feel like each client is unique .Perfect location  walking distance to everything. Great restaurant  we loved the roof top to have a nice breakfast. I definitely recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I'm very astonished about the decorations my first stay at that pearl inside the old Medina Marrakech. The hospitality by a very kind girl front desk  who welcomed us as kings offering a mint tea which belongs to Moroccan hospitality as she said with sweet pastries. a big thank you for her (Ouidad) sorry if i spelled it wrongly. I would highly recommand this place .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Delightful stay. Felt like we were just at home. All the staff were very polite and helpful. Special mention for Bellinda who gave us the best of welcomes. Would defiant recommend to all. Different from the usual modern luxury hotel experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Habiba Lakhi wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: A cosy welcoming villa..... very much enjoyed our stay...!  In the medina so cudnt tell its a villa from the outside. But once you enter its like you're somewhere different.  The advantage was we experienced seeing the medina side but at the same time enjoyed a lucurious villa.  Very private felt like we had the villa to ourselves. Staff were very very friendly and helpful.  We used the spa both days.  If you're looking for a hammaam or a massage session for only you and your partner this is the perfect spa!  Was very romantic  Definitely recommend this villa and i would love to visit it again.  Thank you for making our stay an enjoyable and memorable one xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel, Excellent Staff, Great Location
Review_Text: We stayed in Villa Makassar for 4 nights in November and we very much enjoyed our stay. The location of the hotel is quite good - it is about a fifteen minute walk into central town but through a very smoggy area and so recommend learning the back routes! The service at the hotel was very good and the staff could not be politer. The food is a mixed affair - some stuff was excellent and others not so good but on the whole a very safe haven and a nice place to eat - if a little expensive. The room was ok but incredibly dark and no morning light comes in. The other rooms look beautiful though and the shared areas are beautiful so I think we just got a bit unlucky. Overall a 4 star stay - enjoyable and mostly very comfortable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Aamazing place to stay with the beautiful people
Review_Text: Made to feel very comfortable by the beautiful girl wided.from my welcome to my departure  The place was excellent and made us feel at home.and the breakfast dinner was really good.  The rooftop and the restaurant was so beautiful  thanks thanks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best part of the stay was the staff! So nice and fun! I can’t say enough good things about Belinda! The Villa was amazing so beautiful and the ‘art deco’ is unique and you will not find another hotel like it in Marrakech. When I come back I will definitely stay here again. The entire staff was so friendly and fun! Thank you so much Belinda for making it special!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: I can’t recommend the Villa Makassar enough.  Belinda and there staff can’t do enough for you.. sorting day trips tour guide etc  I arranged this visit for my wife’s 50th birthday.  On our arrival to our room the staff where awaiting inside with a birthday cake along with a song of happy birthday.    The place was spotless throughout.    I was more than happy to leave the staff a tip on our departure.    Thanks again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 5 nights in this amazing place...relax peace and luxury are the main key-words the follow the customers starting from the arrival till the departour. Belinda (front-end madame) was really a perfect landlady. Anything you need (escoursions restaurants place to visit transfer) she can support and help you. High suggested!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 6 nights in Villa Makassar and has a fantastic experience with the hospitality. All the staff were very helpful especially Belinda who helped us with various transfer arrangements and lots of recommendations for the beautiful city. The spa was excellent as well. We would recommend to anyone who visits Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really loved being at the villa! It surpassed our expectations with such lovely people! Belinda Rashid Hind and Ali! The food is soo refreshing and made to order! The drinks are squeezed from fresh fruit! The sweetest peaches EVER! Belinda is an attraction on her own! The most helpful soul! Our trip wouldn’t have been the same had we not met Belinda! She was amazing! You need to book the Villa because Belinda is sooo genuine and there are no safer hands than hers! And you need to try Rashid’s mojito! Definitely coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Bennett C wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: An incredible place to stay right in the Medina that allows a very comfortable yet cultural experience. Rooftop sunsets and amazing detail in every part of the hotel. The staff is also very accomadating and helps to give advice and arrange wherever you need to go. Everyone there was extremely nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We visited Villa Makassar twice this September 2019 stayed two different suites the Rousseau and the Rulhman. Both suites are extremely spacious and wonderfully decorated with bespoke art Déco pieces. Being an art déco aficionado myself I could really appreciate the details of the suites.  The hotel staff made us feel at home and we particularly appreciated the great assistance of their front desk managers especially Ms Belinda who helped us pick restaurants and places to visit during the stay. The car services and drivers they picked were always professional and friendly. I appreciated especially the roof top restaurant for the cool breakfast and beautiful sunset sessions.  We will definitely be back in Villa Makassar thank you for making our first visit in Morroco such a delight!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jim B wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here (2 couples) in the last week. Very comfortable and superb service - staff will do anything to make your stay comfortable. Reasonable price and good value.  Location is handy - 10 minute walk to some of the major attractions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vania T wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: We came across this place by chance walked in and received a very warm welcome from the director Belinda. We loved the place but had already paid for our accommodation but we came back over and over again for massages pool jaccuzi. Service is fantastic and food was excellent. They really know how to make you feel welcome. Highly recommended. But the real gem here is Belinda beautiful and sweet professional and knowledgeable she made us feel so very welcome. Amazing experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I arrived at Marrakesh on the 10th August with a friend my mum(81) and my Auntie (79). We found this amazing place and Belinda the director greeted us with a beautiful smile and friendly attitude. She made us feel so welcome beyond words. Belinda and all the hotel staff are so friendly that you don’t feel like leaving the hotel. The food is amazing and the hotel facilitiessuch as the Marrocos pool and the spa terrace is divine. I love it so much and the most amazing thing is that I acquire an amazing friend like Belinda. Highly recommend!!!! Once again thank you Belinda for making my stay in Marrakesh so memorable.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis in the middle of medina
Review_Text: The villa Makassar is truly an oasis in the crazy loud hot Medina of Marrakech. The interior is amazing! We stayed in a suite and the attention to detail when it comes to design is incredible.  The food in the restaurant is wonderful and the staff is extremely friendly. Especially Belinda went out of her way to help us in any way possible and make our stay special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Decorated with true passion and knowledge of Art Deco this place is absolutely fantastic! Stayed in the Rodchenko room filled with the photography and graphic art of this historically significant artist of the 1920s. Staff is welcoming and warm lovely Belindas arrangements runs like the best clockwork of Africa and the hammam and massages in the spa are intoxicating. Did I mention the breakfast in the moring sun on the rooftop terrace with lovely homemade moroccoan pastry? I'll be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jake T wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here 1 night in the room with a jacuzzi and it was perfect after a long trip to the desert. Belinda and her staff were very friendly and accommodating to our every need. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A letter to our dear friends
Review_Text: So our short 6 day trip turned out to be amazing all thanks to the amazing attentive staff at Villa Makassar. The owner of the hotel also ensured we were catered for such as allowing us to enjoy extra amenities of the hotel. We would like to thank them very much and if in Marrakech we will be staying here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: John J wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: My girlfriend and I took a quick weekend trip to Marrakech this past weekend. It was pretty whirlwind and we selected Villa Makassar pretty much at random using credit cars rewards points.    We couldn't have been happier with our experience. This is a beautiful riad with incredibly helpful and friendly staff. We were upgraded to a bigger room upon arrival at no extra charge and Khadija the front office manager was always around to offer advice offer recommendations and make bookings. For two people who had never been to Morocco it was invaluable.    The hotel itself has a beautiful roof terrace where we enjoyed some drinks at sunset and had complimentary breakfast in the morning. The room was clean nicely decorated and A/C hot water etc were all in tip-top shape. It's located a short walk to the Saadian tombs the Baadi Palace and the Medina making for a very convenient location.    I highly recommend a stay at Villa Makassar especially if it's your first time in the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a wonderful few days of peace luxury and fun. From the moment we arrived Belinda was the perfect hostess. Greeting us with mint tea and sweet treats helping us organize a lovely excursion to Ouzataze and helping us navigate our time in a crazy city. We had two romantic meals. The staff were so kind and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely come again. I recommend the massage 100%. it was very close to all the action.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous art deco restaurant in a beautiful riad in the Kasbah
Review_Text: We had the sea bass and lamb shanks both wonderful. The restaurant is beautifully decorated in art deco style. The service is excellent. Belinda the director made us feel right at home. She is great. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Villa Makassar is an oasis within the Medina - this is where you must stay - hands down - do not look anywhere else
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and the staff resourceful. The location is impeccable - everything is accessible and in walking distance. Belinda the front desk staff is remarkable - she is frank and direct about where to eat shop and what sights to see. She goes above and beyond to explain the ins and outs of Morocco. Khadija also at the front desk is responsive attentive patient and resourceful. Rachid is kind extremely polite helpful and responsive. Mohamed is also awesome - he had been working a month - and gave us recommendations of restaurants that locals go to - what a fantastic suggestion - he will make an excellent guide. The staff who clean the bedrooms are also excellent Nejat Hakeem and Tariq - wow incredible - they spent an hour looking for my lost earring and helped us move our stuff from one room to another and I came to my room to find all my things fully organized in the closet. If you'd like an oasis in the middle of the Medina in the middle of it all come to VILLA MAKASSAR for a unìque experience in a historical landmark (a house formerly part of the palace)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: John B wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: The Riad is a beautiful and peaceful place.I had a hammam with a massage and felt clean and relaxed for the rest of the day.    The Art Deco style is amazing we we're lucky to have meet the owner and could tell this was a work of love for him.    Belinda was kind enough to give me some medicine for free when I had some stomach trouble overall the staff could not be faulted.    I wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying here to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A wonderful boutique Hotel in a great location for all the sights of Marrakesh.  The staff were fabulous especially Belinda who went out of her way to ensure we ensure we enjoyed our stay. So much so she even delivered flowers to my partner in the morning as she knew it was her birthday (see attached photo).  We would highly recommend this Hotel to others and shall be back again for a longer stay next time.    Chris & Judy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After extensive research I found and booked the Villa Makassar. This larger riad is exceptional.    Art Deco in style original furnishings sculpture and artwork.    In the centre of the kasbah 20 mins walk from the main square and thé winding craziness of the souks.    The riad has a dining room external terraces to eat at ground floor level a large roof top area with sun loungers tables and chairs a bar and a jacuzzi. Downstairs you will find a small pool.    There is a beautiful spa and hammam with amazing treatments to indulge yourself after haggling in the souks.    The ambience is perfect from the moment you step inside the door leaving the dirty chaos of the kasbah behind you.    The first thing that will strike you is the entrance hall (pictured) it’s gorgeous.    Then the next thing that will strike you is the service. From Belinda at the front desk to the other staff. Friendly smiley - nothing a problem. They were all so nice they made the difference from this being a good to a great break.    We had time to do a cooking class in the kitchen and it was really a great activity - fun and tasty!    The only complaint was that it was difficult to get email response to questions before hand from Juliette and when we met her she was the only staff member who seemed to be less customer oriented that the rest of the team.    We would definitely come back and would advise anyone coming to Marrakech to choose the Villa Makassar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ahmad U wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: I would highly recommend staying here when visiting Marrakech. Mickey is an outstanding host to his guests he makes you feel at home! When being in or near the Medina it is hard to find a well kept Hotel or Riad in the middle of all the action. This property is very clean updated well decorated and the amenities are fantastic. Furthermore Jemah Al Fnaa is only a 10 to 15 minute walk from this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thanks for a wonderful stay in this gogeous art deco hotel.  The restaurant food and complimentary breakfast was particularly impressive and surprising given the small kitchen.  Belinda was a delight and bent over backwards to help in every way. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Natasha V wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: If you are a lover of art especially art deco and looking for a chilled spot in Marrakech filled with class and style this is it!!    Thanks to the amazing staff and Belinda who went over and above arranging transport meals spa experiences and was just simply fantastic. I wish I could stay longer!!!    Belinda gave me a map and explained what to to and where to go. Her manager even helped me book transport for the next leg of my trip.    Location is great - near to souqs but not noisy. Rooms are amazing and clean! It's like being in another world... A better one xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: David H wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here in April 2018. Amazingly decorated in the Art Deco style throughout. Rooms are each unique and based on a different painter - we stayed in the Mondrian room. Within walking distance of a lot of interesting sites and sights. Food was good. The roof terrace could hold 50+ people which is strange given the limited number of rooms. Perhaps they hold events? It's on the Southern edge of the Medina so it seems an unlikely venue for that.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It’s amazing how beautiful and zen the riad is when it’s so dusty and messy outside the building. It’s like a magic door opened to another world. The room is special and decoration is tasty. There are only 10 rooms in total. It feels like a villa in Bali to me.

Review_Date: Jayne T wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I stayed for 4 nights in early March with my mum we had changed the booking last minute as i was due to go with a friend. The hotel were fantastic and changed our room to a twin with no trouble.  The staff are incredible at Villa Makassar and couldn't do enough to help us. The owner met us on arrival and we were served peppermint tea and some pastries whilst he explained where to visit and how to get around the city which was super helpful as it was our first time.  The hotel itself is stunning and one of the nicest hotels i have ever stayed in the roof terrace was perfect spot for breakfast and catching some sun in the afternoons and relaxing in the hot tub.  The only negatives are that the weather had been cold so the main pool was out of use which was a shame on the warmer days. The rooms did not have tea or coffee making facilities although we were provided with a kettle for free when we asked which was perfect for us. Our room did not have a full length mirror but these were all minor things that did not impact out stay.  Having read previous reviews stating breakfast was "basic" i wasn't expecting much. We were pleasantly surprised breakfast was like a 3 course meal! Fruit or yoghurts then a platter of pastries cakes (the savoury pastries were my favourite) and bread. Then you had an option for cooked eggs - sadly these didnt come withtoast so a bowl on scrambled eggs on day one was a biy strange but we had omlettes after that which were lovely.  We only ate at the Villa once and it was lovely but a little more expensive than other places around the Medina.  The walk from villa to the main square is about 20 mins we did feel slightly intimidated in the smaller streets of the Kasbah but the hotel staff always reassured us we were safe.  Just dont let the "helpful young boys" give you directions or help you get around as they will expect money after. Anyone who has done any research about Marrakech will already know this.  All in all i couldn't recommend the hotel enough. The staff make this place incredible and certainly were the highlight of our trip.  Thank you Villa Makassar!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I and my family totalling 6 members including my father who is disabled booked a 5 day holiday to Marrakech 10th-14th Feb 2018. We booked through Expedia researching throughly Villa Makassar was the hotel we choose because the website showed it having 4.5 stars the reviews were great and the photographs looked amazing.    Having arrived at Villa Makassar on 10th Feb 2018 at approximately 12.30pm we were shown in by the reception manager and then left to wait around for over an hour whilst she booked us in considering the hotel has only 10 rooms and there were no other guests to be seen I couldn’t believe it took that long even then only 2 rooms were ready which we accepted and deposited our luggage within (Juliette the manager emailed me a few days before asking what time we would be arriving so she knew our eta.). Once the third room was ready around 3 hours of our arrival we were shown it the bed was a mattress on a plank of wood attach to the wall and the room only had a filthy a jacuzzi there was no shower.....how do you expect people to shower in a jacuzzi?? Not happy with this we asked for another room this room boasted a non working air conditioning unit (the temperature was around 6 degrees at the time) and it smelt damp once the reception manager said the AC was fixed it and was switched on it was blowing out air that smelt of sewage. The final room shown had to be accepted as it was getting late and we were all tired from waking up at 3am to travel this room again had only a bath no showering facilities no towels and was cold.    We stayed positive and wanted to begin our holiday so had lunch it took 30 minutes for a waitress to appear and take our order then another hour before it arrived arrived. We asked for some drinks which arrived another 30 minutes after our lunch had.    Later in the evening we asked for heaters and more blankets as the rooms were cold these took many vists to reception by us to be delivered to our rooms.    In the morning the included breakfast consisted of small muffins burnt toast and burnt omelettes again these took over an hour to arrive whist we waited sat in the cold dinning room wearing out coats.    We decided to leave the hotel and book Hotel Movenpick as my father who is 70 years suffers from diabetes was constantly shivering and needs to eat in a timely fashion in order to take his medication Villa Makassar were not accommodating to his need whatsoever ever which angered us immensely!    The reception manager did not seem concerned that we left the hotel after less than 24hours even though we had booked to stay until 14th Feb and paid fully no apologies or offers of reimbursement as no doubt our 3 rooms were resold and the hotel has profited.    Do not recommend this hotel whatsoever and would not even rate it 1 star if I had the option to!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Gary C wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: A beautifu, tranquill oasis in the Kasbah
Review_Text: We spent four nights in this magnificently renovated art deco hotel. Couldn't have asked for a more perfect stay. Wonderful room good food and facilities and incredible attentive staff. It was a 20 minute walk to the Jemma el Fna and the souks and directions were easy to follow.  Everything from enjoying a glass of wine in front of the fireplace in our room to the very good massage made our stay in Marrakesh as pleasant as possible.  We can enthusiastically recommend this property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Katie H wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Wonderful weekend away at Villa Makassar
Review_Text: We had a fabulous long weekend in Villa Makassar in December 2017. Thank you so much to all of the staff for making it so special. From the moment we arrived greeted with fresh tea and pastries we absolutely loved it! The hotel is beautiful inside a complete oasis from the hectic-ness of Marrakech. Breakfast was simple but tasty and we had dinner in the hotel one evening which was delicious. The staff were attentive friendly and kind and the room was an exceptional standard. We were very grateful and lucky to have received an upgrade when we arrived. We would recommend Villa Makassar to anyone visiting Marrakech - an accessible location beautiful interior and and an unforgettable experience. We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best comfortable riad in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Comfortable quiet with top level service and unusual Art Deco' furniture and paintings. Entering in this riad was like to leave the mess and entering the silence and kindness. We stayed here at beginning and at the end of our short trip in Morocco for our anniversary. Located inside the Kasbah you can easily reach by walk any place inside the medina including the Jamal el Fna. Beside the position and the internal structure and rooms I need to underline the true kindness and efficiency of the Khadija the Front Office Manager. She suggested helped and solved practically everything we asked her to clarify us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect start to our Moroccan adventure
Review_Text: We had 3 wonderful nights at Villa Makassar in November 2017. We had a bit of trouble trying to find our transfer at the airport (arranged by VM) but Juliet was incredibly helpful over the phone and even tried to call once we were in the car to check we were on our way.    From the moment we entered the riad we felt completely relaxed - from the tea and treats awaiting us in one of the cool lounges to the completely hassle free check-in. Our room (the Mondrian room) was a little small but had all the amenities we needed and suited us perfectly! We found the staff incredibly helpful and friendly with Yosef being our favourite face around the riad!    We ate breakfast on the terrace each morning and found it to be simple (which most Moroccan breakfasts are) but delicious - we stayed in a few other riads / hotels in Morocco and this was our best breakfast by far! We had dinner at the Villa once it was a little expensive but incredible. My boyfriend reckons it was the best lamb he’s ever had!!    We treated ourselves to a Hammam Duo treatment which included a Hammam scrub and wash. It was a bit cramped for my boyfriend (he’s 6ft5) and we found it a bit odd having only one lady looking after both of us but we left feeling very refreshed!    By far our favourite place to stay in Morocco thank you team VM for a wonderful start to our trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at Villa Makassar for a week and the experience was delightful. The art deco architecture and artwork were beautiful the central courtyard with birds flitting around was peaceful and the staff knowledgeable and attentive. My room was comfortable and clean and the breakfasts were delicious. The hotel has a lovely rooftop pool area which I didn't use as I was there in December and is a short walk from the main sights. I especially appreciated Yousef Yousef B and Alabir who answered my many questions and made the Villa Makassar feel like a home away from home in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A six day stay in the city. Villa Makassar - an attractive 'art deco' boutique hotel/'Riad' to the south of the centre. Easy access to the airport and the Souks etc. Intermittent building work nearby - not too much of a distraction and nothing that the VM could do about that. Friendly accommodating staff and a pleasant ambiance with the Cinnamon/Orange incense burner a nice touch. Spacious clean rooms lots of marble used. Perhaps breakfast could have been just a little more adventurous?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We recently stayed at the Villa Makassar and had a fabulous experience. The staff were kind informed and extremely helpful. Upon arrival we were fortunate to meet with the owner who took the time to personally welcome us share some wonderful mint tea and treats with us and provide us with a tour of the hotel. The hotel is exquisite with each piece of art and furniture carefully selected and purchased from all over the world. Our room was very large very comfortable and absolutely beautiful!Should my future travels take me to Marrakech I would absolutely stay at the Villa Makassar!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A splendid stay in an absolutely amazingly gorgeous hotel.
Review_Text: A hidden gem if you haven't discovered this hotel already!! A great location walking distance to the market Jemaa el-Fnna and the Souks in Kasbha amongst the hustle and the bustle yet tucked away so you can feel completely at peace once inside the Hotel. Villa Makassar is beautifully presented and every corner of the hotel is adorned with amazing art pieces and work that one feels obliged to discover and take in. The rooms are stunning and the interiors of each room is beautifully thought out and presented. We were a group of 4 my brother who has disabilities was catered for as we emailed the hotel before hand and they were very efficient in calling us and adhering to his needs. My sister (who is expecting) and her husband were upgraded to a stunning room they were very surprised and delighted at the thoughtfulness of the lovely Khadhija the front office manager. The staff were beyond nice respectful and very very helpful. Khadhija is at the front office and dealt with all our queries so well and ensured we were thoroughly informed in all our request and problems we kept running to her with.  Breakfast can be a little slow after you order but when you are waiting in the beautiful roof terrace you hardly notice the slight delay. We also had lunch at the hotel a few times and the food at all times was lovely. I would definitely recommend their lunch menu especially the burger which actually comes as 3 small burgers absolutely delicious!  As we stayed 7 nights we had 30min Hammam 30min Jacuzzi and 30min full body massage included  which was fantastic and great to do especially the massage after a long day climbing the Atlas Mountain.  In all a fabulous hotel with fabulous staff and we got to meet the brains behind the concept of this hotel Mr Fouad Graidia. A very pleasant and humble gentleman who spent hours talking to us and making us feel at home especially my brother. I would highly recommend Villa Makassar to anyone going to Marrakesh and have already told all my family and friends of this little gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Alex N wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: All in all we had a great stay at Villa Makassar. We don’t usually stay in 5 star hotels so for us it felt like a real treat but others who are used to staying in luxury could be disappointed if they had similar problems to what we did during our stay. The hotel could be amazing if they work out a few of the issues that we’ve listed below.    Hotel - Beautiful interiors great welcome with mint tea and Moroccan biscuits almost all of the staff were lovely and very helpful during our stay. Great roof terrace views of atlas mountains in distance. Pool was freezing cold so we were unable to use during our stay hot tub on roof terrace was also quite cold both us and other guests didn’t seem to be able to get it to heat up any more.    Spa - A great plus to have. As we stayed 7 nights we had a 30 min hammam 30 min jacuzzi and 30 min full body massage included. The massages were fantastic. The hammam was DIY and no one had explained what you had to do or what anything was in the room so me and my husband had to work it out ourselves which was a little disappointing. The first time we booked to use the jacuzzi a couple of days in advance but it was cold so we had to rebook for another day which was disappointing but the jacuzzi was lovely once it was the right temperature and very relaxing with the coloured lights and music.    Location - Great to be in amongst the hustle and bustle of the Kasbah. Fairly easy 20 minute walk to Jemaa el-Fnaa and the souks. 2 great restaurants on the same road as the hotel (Clock Cafe a minute walk and Jardin at the hotel next door). There were building works directly next to the hotel going on during our stay wasn’t a huge disturbance for us luckily but something to consider and definitely something the hotel should make guests aware of before booking.    Food - breakfast lunch and dinner were all excellent at the hotel. We ate there 5 out of the 7 nights during our stay because the food and service was so good. I have food allergies and the kitchen and staff went above and beyond to make sure I was well catered for.    Room - We booked a suite no 11 lovely and big with a nice rainfall shower and big bath in the ensuite. Had a nice feel to the room although was quite dark but that didn’t bother us. The mattress was very hard which wasn’t a big problem for us but worth noting for anyone sensitive to this. We had a continuous problem with the air conditioning in our room as it gave out a very nasty smell the two times we tried to use it in the middle of the night when waking up too hot. I’m not sure what the smell was but it made us both feel quite unwell especially my husband who felt unwell for most of the next day. After the first time we were told it was fixed but we then had the same problem. When we let them know about the second time we never heard whether it had been fixed or not and because it was so unpleasant we were too scared to try it again so we just opened the windows instead (luckily it was cool in the evenings when we were there this would have been a huge issue if we had stayed during the hotter months). We also had problems with the TV and DVD player in our room. After 2 different staff members trying to help it seemed you had to unplug the satellite to be able to use the dvd and vice versa. It took us several days to figure it out with the help of confused staff who didn’t seem to understand the set up either we ended up barely using it as it was too complicated. We also found the DVDs provided didn't work in the dvd player other than one.    Despite the few issues we had we really did enjoy our trip and the hotel it was just a shame that we had these problems and hopefully the hotel with fix these for future guests if they do this would be an amazing hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My first visit to this part of the world. Met with friendly staff and very efficient environment. Well organised surroundings that make any clients so welcoming. The food is of very high quality  Will recommend to any travellers to this place with my blessings  Richard
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Naomi H wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: A wonderful stay at Villa Makassar - Tranquil well run and perfect assistance at all levels! Superb Hamam treatment and massage! Lovely furnishings and Art Deco touches around the hotel. Great location ! Definitely recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we booked the hotel through Expedia we received a welcoming email informing us of airport pickups if needed and the delights of the SPA. I replied back informing them we where on a late flight so would be arriving late. From the moment you push open the Riad door you step into tranquility. On arrival they showed us to our room and delivered refreshing mint tea along with pastry's. They even kept the restaurant staff on to accommodate us for a meal.    The Riad/Villa is quite beautiful and has a lovely terrace with umbrellas creating shade. There is a large hot tub on the terrace which my husband and I enjoyed (it had a cool setting). There are only 10 rooms so expect personal service we could not have asked for more. The location was great for us we have visited Marrakech many times and enjoy the Kasbah area it's only a ten minute walk to the main square and souks and there are several highly rated restaurants and Spa's close by. The restaurant at the Hotel is super and rates highly for Fine Dining at reasonable prices too. As we had booked for seven nights we were upgraded to a Suite on the last night they may have wanted our room but it was a nice gesture to give us. There is local building going on close to the Villa but this did not impact on our stay.    To summarise if you want luxury a high level of personal service in a unique beautiful Art Deco building in the Medina this is for you we would certainly revisit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: A beautiful Art Deco Riad with the most helpful and obliging staff. Well furnished rooms with outstanding bathrooms but... the hotel only has 10 rooms and the restaurant and roof terrace are too large for the amount of custom they attract. Food however is really excellent -our traditional welcome meal was outstanding. The roof terrace lacked shade which was important in temperatures of 30+. The swimming pool on a different floor also lacked shade and seating. The hotel is also quite a hike from the Medina centre. However the unique ambience of the hotel and beautiful Art Deco artwork and statuary provided a moving and luxury experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosanna K wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Loved this boutique hotel & the owner was very friendly & personable... he told us that the hotel used to be owned by the old kings brother who lived there before he bought it & renovated it into a hotel. They accommodated everything we needed from dry cleaning laundry & even a fan. Breakfast was included every morning and they also have a restaurant. The pool is refreshing & the roof top is beautiful & relaxing. We also really enjoyed the hammam spa very authentic & the massage afterwards was great I fell asleep! The front desk did everything for us from calling a taxi cab to making dinner reservations. Overall a great experience especially if you want to be in the mix of it all inside the medina.

Review_Date: Joanna J wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Villa Makassar was an experience everyone should have. From the moment we stepped through the huge wooden door we new we were in safe hands. We stepped into an Oasis of calm. We were met by the hotel owner Mr Froud who gave us a tour of his beautiful Art Deco hotel which he had lovingly created with furniture and inspiration from all over the world.    We were offered an upgrade and our room was perfect. The staff were amazing and there for our every need. Red Ones Gins were second to none!    Thank you we will definitely return.    Jo and Kevin
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Damian D wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: very nice art deco style spa hotel!
Review_Text: The hotel and staff were very nice! really like the art deco design and nice courtyard as the centre piece of the hotel. We also had the hammam/massage too which was very good. The location was fine but a little bit further away from the centre than we thought.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Melanie V wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: What an amazing experience! The staff is very friendly they make you feel at home. The riad is much more relaxing than staying in one of those big spa hotels. Every room has it's own name and art deco interior. The food is delicious especially when it's accompanied by one of the Moroccan wines. I would go back immediately!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My friend and I picked this hotel after a lot of research and we were incredibly happy with our decision. From the time we arrived the staff was wonderful brining us tea and cookies. We were given a tour of the facilities and helped with our bags to the room. The room was beautifully decorated and very clean. We had a small issue with the air conditioner and were given an upgraded room which was a very kind gesture. We used the pool once after a day of walking in the heat and although small was a nice relaxing and refreshing experience. We also used the spa which was lovely. Breakfast was included and we loved the tasty coffee and cheese bread in the courtyard. The manager was kind enough to give us late check out and we had an evening flight. This was truly appreciated. I would highly recommend this Riad! The staff and facility was wonderful . It was slightly out of the busy area but a short walk to all the sights. The clock cafe down the street was also a great place for lunch and dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, Lovely Area, Great service. Disappointing ending
Review_Text: Walking through Villa Makassar's entrance hall you're offered a complete escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. It's grand entrance hall infused with smells of orange and cinnamon create a warm welcome. The Riads are beautiful the pool refreshing and the staff are so helpful.    BEDROOMS  Our room was okay. The bathroom was perfect but our bedroom did not look like any of the pictures viewed. Clean and well presented but for the price point the walls needed painting and the seating chairs at the end of our bed felt like they were straight out of a skip. The bedroom did not have the Moroccan charm that is so evident in the rest of the hotel. The bedroom felt a bit more premier inn than 5 star hotel.    BREAKFAST  Was a collection of cakes eggs and bread. Although very tasty and all are homemade I would recommend a menu and choice here.    SERVICE  The service was great. The reception team are really helpful talk you through the history of the Riad and create a welcoming calming and relaxing atmosphere. They made everything feel easy.    DISPUTE  Throughout our stay we enjoyed items from the minibar and were happy to pay for these. On the morning of our departure we were presented with a bill for items that we were told were separate to the minibar. When we mentioned this to the staff they informed us that this was no longer the case but they were happy to pass us on to the owner to raise the complaint further.    What resulted was an incredibly deflating end to a lovely trip. The owner became aggressive and lost his temper on the phone. He kept speaking over us and I had to rationalise and calm his fury. Not the customer service you expect from a 5 Star Hotel and when you have spent over £500 at the business.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited back in February for my birthday and found that Villa Makassar really made our stay. The staff are attentive and extremely friendly and helpful. The Villa itself is beautiful and was so nice to come back to after a hectic day within the city. The time of year we went it was very quiet and sometimes it did feel a little abandoned. For example the roof terrace was used in the mornings but it wasn't ever set up as like in the photos despite the weather being great. It seemed they might be doing some renovations to part of it though. Just an observation and not a complaint! We enquired about the use of the spa facilities and booked a slot. The facilities were great but we were sad that this didn't include the free massage that we got booking through Prestige. Nonetheless the Spa Therapist was very helpful and friendly and we enjoyed our relax in the pool and steam room. We were impressed with the breakfast and the choice we were given. We were always offered eggs and had a selection of pastries cakes crepes tortillas homemade yoghurt smoothies and fruit salad as well as fresh orange and coffee. We never needed lunch we stocked up so well at breakfast! Julia and her team are wonderful and we would definitely recommend to others and stay again when the time comes. They also served the best pastries we had the whole time we were there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The photos don't do this place any justice you must visit and see for yourself how amazing this place is. Lovely boutique hotel. Lovely rooms very quiet environment.  Fabulous staff. The spa downstairs is wonderful too. The Hammam is amazing full body massage facial Jacuzzi ...I loved every minute. The food was good also.  The staff provided a birthday cake which was a lovely surprise. Thank you would love to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We carefully weighed all our options for Marrakech and chose this riad for the reviews ambiance location price and parking. Villa Makassar did not disappoint. The photos and the description are accurate but they do not fully convey the beauty of the space the size the mood the people. Everyone was super accommodating the total experience was relaxing enjoyable comfortable. As with another riad that we stayed in there is a majestic open air courtyard/restaurant area which is very relaxing and invigorating. The other half of the restaurant enclosed with the bar is where we ate a wonderful dinner and it has a very chilled out lush atmosphere. Nice room comfortable luxurious bed awesome shower too. My only issue was a perfume scent in the room. I thought this was unnecessary and I am allergic to perfumes so took the little pot with the essential oils or perfume out of the room and gave it to the staff after which I was fine. Everyone was super helpful with parking bags etc. Wish we had more time. I would definitely stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lindsay M wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I were really looking for a location that allowed us to both explore the local area but also to have a break and relax. This did exactly that! The Riad itself was beautiful. Stunning decor calm and our suite was perfect. It's our first day back in London today and we have both said we are missing our peaceful and delicious breakfast already.  As we were there a week we were lucky enough to try most aspects the hotel offered. The spa was lovely an amazing relaxing massage jacuzzi and steam room. We also had a beautiful 3 course traditional meal one evening. The lamb was the best I've ever tasted! Lunch and snacks through the day that were available were always really nice too.
