As the breakfast was so substantial we often only had 2 meals a day - and we found that a good place outside of the Riad was at the Clock Cafe down the street. An amazing little place and twice we joined them for their buffet when they broke their Ramadan fast. The food was amazing as was the atmosphere :)  We booked one of the excursions the Riad offered and spent a day up in the Atlas mountains. If you get a chance to do this I would really recommend slightly cooler temperature than the city so hiking was ok and the tour guide and local Berbers were so friendly. A 3 course lunch was included in a guest house in the mountains - again - after a few hours of walking this was amazing. Make sure you ask to see the waterfall on your walk - perfect to paddle and cool down and great for photos.  The facilities in the Riad were always quite quiet which was perfect for us. The pool was lovely I think only once did we have to share it with anyone else due to the times when everyone was exploring. Also the rooftop bar was amazing in the evening.  The final and most important point of the stay - the staff were great. They couldn't do enough for us and they we so friendly and accommodating. Every day there were fresh juices or smoothies to help yourselves to in the heat - and often they would bring these to your room unannounced as a lovely (and welcome) afternoon treat in the heat.  I can't thank them all enough for the stay we had a great time didn't want to come home! We would definitely return although I might try in peak season next time just to see the difference.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Such a peaceful escape in the heart of the Marrakech. Amazing curated collection of antique art deco furniture which is worth a visit of its own. Room was what we expected well appointed. The bed was a bit too hard to my liking however.  All staff members were kind pleasant and always helpful.    Recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom M wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: An amazing stay in every way!
Review_Text: Where to start  the entire team was world class my upgrade was magical ( thanks Jessica and Candzee) The restaurant was wonderful  with such attention to details and making you feel part of the family.  Location is excellent  suggest getting help first day to discover the area.    WE cannot wait to book our return  Cheers    Tom
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: This is a very nice boutique hotel to stay at. About a 20 minute walk from the main souks but pretty interesting wandering along a road with little traffic and interesting local shops and people. Very safe we had no problem walking to and from the souks at all times of day and night.    Zainab the manager greeted us on arrival with mint tea and showed us a very large room with a king size bed overlooking the court yard. We did not eat at the restaurant as it was not very busy so we felt woul;d lack atmosphere. Unfortunately in April the rooftop lounge area was also closed so we could not use or review that.    The staff were very good and nothing was too much trouble. They arranged taxis to other restaurants (and recommended some) and to various tourist attractions.    Overall a very nice place to stay in the Kasbar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick T wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: An oasis in a great city
Review_Text: The hotel was relatively quiet as rising temperatures meant it was no longer peak season. However even at 40c the AC and natural cooling of the inner courtyards worked well and meant we felt very comfortable in this Oasis. The location in the Kasbah district meant it was a lot quieter than the Medina and could also be accessed by car.  The team at the Villa could not have been more helpful and made our stay a joy. Breakfast was far removed from the large buffets often found in hotels; having a more intimate personal feel with eggs local breads jams fruit yoghurt etc. The room was relaxing cool quiet and with a large bathroom area so all in all very comfortable and clean  We used the restaurant one night but the fact the hotel was quiet meant it lacked atmosphere plus it impacted on the menu so we preferred the other meals we had in Marrakesh. Lunch however was simple and very enjoyable.  We used the spa one afternoon and would recommend it highly prices are fair and the experience was memorable  All in all I would very happily go back although it does look like building work will soon commence next door which may disrupt the wonderful tranquility of the Villa for a period.  Marrakesh it self exceeded our expectations so all in all a great time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis in the middle of the Kaspar
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights in May and couldn't have picked a better place in my opinion. Other reviewers have said the staff couldn't do enough and that's 100% true. Zainab the manager was outstanding as was all the other staff. We went on a trip to the souk and randomly saw one of the kitchen staff who made sure that we visited the right shops and that we didn't over pay for taxi's before riding off on his bike home just because he recognised us. The villa was beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean. On arrival you are greeted by the intoxicating smell of orange-cinnamon oil. It was so lovely I had to buy some!    The rooms are thoughtfully decorated with someone that clearly has good taste. Also never too hot which I did worry about. Food was lovely - I recommend the French toast at breakfast and lamb shank for dinner.    Absolutely recommend I will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dave R wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We highly recommend this beautiful getaway in Marrakech. From the minute we were greeted with the traditional mint tea until our departure we were treated to impeccable service. Our room was perfect and very comfortable. We enjoyed our stay very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helle T wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Stayed for 3 nights on second floor in a very large twin room. As I love the Art Deco period the hotel had small touches everywhere including the names of the rooms. The rooftop patio was amazing for breakfast. Service was excellent just needed to ask. We missed a reservation at Nomad restaurant which had been hard to get and the concierge was able to secure us an excellent table on another night. The staff is very friendly helpful met our every need. Excellent food (dinner) was served in the high atrium central atrium it is calm quiet after the chaos of the medina. The young barman mad awesome gin and tonics and mojitos with fresh mint served with a selection of olives nuts and other local goodies on the rooftop while the sunset. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Oasis of calm in hectic Marrakech!
Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights probably in the smallest room (No3) but it was adequate for our needs only there to sleep! It is situated about a 20 minute walk from all the main attractions but plenty to see and experience on the way. Staff at the riad were exceptional very friendly & welcoming we had dinner first night which was a bit disappointing we both had the tagine which was quite dry other items may have been better. Breakfast the 1st morning was the best went a bit downhill after that. Home made yoghurt selection of buns/cakes etc followed by eggs anyway you like them. After that it was a hit or miss if you got fresh fruit salad always received buns/cakes but no more eggs :-(  I experienced the hamam clay scrub and hour massage & highly reccomned it!  Overall I would definitley recommend the riad to anyone visiting Marrakech even if breakfast wasa hit or miss!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katie A wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Perfect secluded getaway nestled 10-15 min away walk from the Medina. As you walk in into the secret doorway you are cooled off from the Moroccan sun. Each little part of this art deco paradise is filled with creativity. You can sit by the pool or enjoy the sunshine on the roof. We traveled here as a couple and the service was impeccable. The staff was so considerate and provided many tips for an unforgettable stay. Highly recommend! .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We could not have asked for a more delightful Riad. As another reviewer mentioned nothing was too much for the welcoming staff...we felt like honored guests. The facility was filled with art and each area unique serene and beautiful. Stay in for dinner...it was delicious! Our Initial room was rather small and we were pleased to be moved to a comfortable larger room. It was a real treat to stay at Villa Makassar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steven T wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We stayed one day came in late and departed early the next day so we were not able to utilize all of the services available at this riad. However we were very impressed with the level of service we received upon arriving at the hotel and the restaurant food and staff were superb! We did stay in one of the suites and truly enjoyed the spacious room and the beautiful décor. Though I have to admit that we were not particularly fond of the window in the toilet room that had no curtain and a clear view to the rooftop next door; we felt the need to bathroom with the door closed and the lights off. As I shared we had to leave early the next morning and unfortunately there was a miscommunication with the night staff so a prearranged breakfast was not available at our departure. Considering the price we paid for the room (breakfast included) we were a bit disappointed that we had to eat at the airport. Thus the 4 out of 5 rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely art filled riad with excellent restaurant and fine service. Safe clean quiet neighborhood. Try the cinnamon puffed pastry for breakfast..heavenly! Outdoor pool fluffy down filled comforter CNN!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeremy H wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Exceptional in every way - Highly recommended!
Review_Text: We stayed in Villa Makassar for 4 nights and were really very impressed with the entire experience! I've stayed in a few places in Marrakesh over the years and like anywhere there is good and bad. Villa Makassar is at the very top end of 'good'. It has 10 rooms so is very 'boutique' in style so the staff can afford to invest a lot of time with each guest ensuring that they feel well looked-after. The property itself is lovely - Very well appointed full of 'Riad' character and has a luxurious feel. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff - They will literally bend over backwards to accommodate any request. I was particularly impressed with the condition of the rooms and the attention to detail so far as maintenance is concerned. Keeping a hotel 'ship-shape' is a challenge to many hotels but not this one! Everything is well maintained and everything works!  Highly recommended and yes I will return!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thibaut L wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: If you would have to think about the ideal place to stay
Review_Text: Quite difficult to discribe the perfectly balanced but nonetheless astonishing environment and service of the villa Makassar. If I would have to imagine the ideal place to stay and rest I'll still be miles away from the quality of this place.  The art deco architecture and furnitures are the perfect balance between a clean modernism and a rich Art Deco style.  The service is perfect nice polite and efficient without ever being overwhelming.  I've stay here 2 times already those past years.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sara B wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Spent a wonderful and relaxing week at Villa Makassar with my sister. We were looking for a quiet place to unwind and we did! It was an oasis of calm hidden in the narrow streets of the busy and noisy Medina. Villa Makassar is very well located: close to the airport and walking distance to places to visit (20-30 mn to Jma el Fna square - if you find your way). The art deco design and furniture are beautiful and zen. At our arrival we were given the choice between two Junior Suites. Both of them were inviting and one had a private Jacuzzi but we decided to stay in the Junior Suite on the ground floor which was more spacious. There was always a nice fragrance of orange and cinnamon in the room and it was very clean. The welcome and service was excellent everyone was very friendly and most helpful. At the reception we were also helped with very good recommendations of places to visit and eat.    The spa with its traditional Hammam was a unique experience (get prepared to leave with brand new skin...) followed by a great massage.    The food at the restaurant was delicious and the breakfast varied and generous and it was still served quite late too which was an advantage. It was excellent to have breakfast on the beautiful roof terrace which became our favorite place. From there you can admire the view to the roofs and snowy mountains soak the sun or read in the shade. We had 25-30 Celsius in March...    We can only recommend this place!    Thank you to all for such good welcome and service.

Review_Date: Julia L wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: 5 stars for staff and the service!!!!!
Review_Text: We booked 5 nights at Villa Makassar through Prestigia a website that offers luxurios hotels for good deals. I will start with the only downside I can find because the rest of the stay was lovely. Villa Makassar advertises to be a five star boutique hotel. That is not 100% percent accurate. While there are some rooms that surely meet the expectations of a five star stay our first room did not. It was a small room that did not have enough storage space for two people which lead us to have cosmetics on the floor the installations were beautifully designed but they need some renovation.  Now to the good part:First off when we expressed that we were disapointed in our room Julie the manager did everything to change our room and even upgraded us. Although we could not upgrade us the same day she offered us a suite for the next day which was very nice! Suites are lovely at Villa Makassar you will enjoy it a lot. This leads me to the staff at Villa Makassar: The people working here are amazing! I was stung by a bee and my face was swelling over night. I went to see the night manager because I needed Ibuprofen to stop imflamation. He asked an employee to bring one from home which was so helpful. Thank you so much!!!!!! Also when we went on day trips to the souks or to Ouzoud Waterfalls they were waiting for us with refreshments the instant we came back. (I still don t know how they did it!) Our room was cleaned twice a day! Fruit was waiting for us on our first night when we arrived late. Everyone in the hotel was super friendly helpful and funny! If you need any information and recommendation be sure to ask! If you are a design lover you will love this place it is full of 1920s sculptures and furniture! We didn t manage to eat there but heard that the dinner is very good! The hotel also offered free airport transport which was extremly helpful given we arrived so late.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nicholas B wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Just back from a 4 night stay at Villa Makassar. We were impressed before we arrived to be offered a complimentary transfer from the airport by email and that level of service continued throughout our stay. The Riad really is an oasis of calm - it is set around a 20 minute walk from Jma el Fna square which means it is away from all the noise and pesky tat-sellers. In fact the walk back from the square in an evening or even in the early morning gives you a great insight into local Marrakech life - within a few minutes there is an egg seller (with caged chicken laying eggs) a butcher (we saw a local pick a live chicken which was then butchered) and a fuel seller (with a great pile of coal and lots of gas canisters to match!)    Anyway I digress!    Villa Makassar is art deco in style and as mentioned in some previous reviews the rooms can be a little dark however this did not bother us. We had the Grande Suite - extremely spacious with it's own balcony looking over the central courtyard. There is a large bath and shower (which wasn't too powerful but was adequate). The air conditioning did a great job keeping us cool in the 32 degree heat.    Room service left a jasmine oil (we think) burner in the room after leaving and this meant that you came back to a really refreshing scent - lovely touch.    Breakfast is Moroccan/Continental style and we took to having it on the rooftop in the morning when it was still quite cool.    The riad has a Hammam and I had a body scrub which was a refreshing (though rough) experience!    During our stay we had an issue with an external hotel where they were hounding us for money they thought we owed them - the villa staff were very helpful in this regard and we could not have managed the situation without them - again great service from Villa Makassar!    Would definitely stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing customer service especially from the receptionist ( even though she had a sore throat and all but lost her voice) plus the two main waiters these guys could teach the big boy chain hotels a thing or two on service...nothing short of perfection without being intrusive.  We did find the rooms we stayed in a bit too dark for my liking but then it is a Art Deco Riad which we were aware of when we booked. The roof terrace is beautiful ( shame the swimming pool was down stairs and not on the roof) well equipped with lots of single and double sun beds plus dining areas which was great for breakfast and dinner or some where to chill with a glass of wine. We were served complimentary Virgin Mojitos a couple of times whilst sun bathing which was a lovely surprise. We ate dinner twice here and the food was excellent as was the presentation.  There isn't any real negatives to the Villa perhaps a coffee machine in the rooms would be a bonus though having said that we booked a hot air balloon ride and had to be up at 5.30 they had coffee and a light breakfast waiting for us before we left.  So summing it all up a great place to stay in a crazy and mad Kasbah!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is an oasis in the middle of Marrakech. Wonderful interiors in Art Deco- style lovely rooms good food - not to mention the service-minded and friendly staff. We spent four nights there and highly recommend the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were greeted with sweet Moroccan mint tea and a selection of tea biscuits as we were checked in and our bags taken up to our room. The quiet efficiency and friendliness of the staff (especially the ever smiling Aziz) continued throughout our stay. Getting advice on trips in and out of the city were well handled.  The food at the restaurant was top class. The chateaubriand is not to be missed.  The location just beyond the Southern end of the Rue de la Kasbah was very convenient and put us right inside the Medina. My ONLY minor gripe was that the water pressure was low but as the room was fantastic and the staff brilliant that really did not take the shine off our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Art Deco jewel in the Kasbah
Review_Text: We are halfway through our midweek stay and so far certainly not disappointed.    In line with many of my previous reviews it is the service which makes this place stand out.    Starts with airport pick up (included) where because of an easy jet c##k up our arrival was one hour later as they had not added summertime plus the 1 hour queue on morrocan immigrations (do prepare for this) and our lift just waited till we were there... also no atms in the airport- beware.    Check in was a relaxed atmosphere and despite being 10.30 we got the full Makassar experience- minted green tea pastries and some time to take in the villa - it is stunning a Art Deco jewel and generally well presented.    Next to that they kept the chef in in case we wanted dinner (we did) and it was lovely- freshly cooked to order- steak ( medium rare for me 9/10) and tangine for my wife 7/10 after trying some others excellent product quality which you won t get in town but the day long smouldering in a wood fire is missing if you have it in a restaurant....  Desserts were well presented but sweeeeeet something we would learn "normal" in a country where they put sugar on their savoury pies...  All day breakfast served wherever you might want it- great! Service a bit slower than in Europe but you are on holiday...    Next morning the lady on reception was very helpful showing us were we were on the map the main sights made dinner recommendations and gave me some helpful advice regarding my restaurant ideas- no attempts on any upsell again full marks    The villa is in the Kasbah quarter and as others said in a perfect position close to the manic centre but away from it enough.... few taxi drivers know it but as they seem to struggle with other addresses too it might be a professional rather than property issue.    The building is a maze and you walk from one stunning antique furnished room to the next numerous courtyards with water features make outdoor space for warmer days  We mainly enjoyed the roof terrace from which the Atlas Mountains can be seen a green oasis of calm    We had booked a junior suite (room 5) which was tastefully decorated but perhaps a bit dark for my taste ( I accept this fits with the Art Deco theme) but I would prefer brighter rooms this would also make them look bigger (the room was quite narrow and long) overall Sam and storage more than sufficient  Please note that the furnishings are genuine antiques and therefore not spec' d to current norms and our bed was a bit wobbly (as long as you just sleep in it....)  Stylish bathroom with some water pressure and temperature issues at time - here perhaps less techs oversized rainfall heads with something more apt to the local supplies might be better - this not to be critical but as I gave five stars I need to put in perspective.    Would I return? I d extend to start with had I got time....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 5 nights in a junior suite. It was a clean comfortable and stylish room with a sunken jacuzzi style bathtub in the middle of the floor. Whilst it was wonderful for a relaxing soak in the evening it wasn't entirely practical for a quick shower before heading out in the morning.    The location is on the outskirts of the medina which we really liked as it was far enough away from the craziness of the souks but still within walking distance.    We had a wonderful breakfast every morning in the rooftop bar area. Each day was a little different with breads fruits eggs Moroccan tea. The homemade yogurt was amazing.    The staff are wonderful genuinely friendly and can't do enough to help you. They helped us to arrange a wonderful anniversary dinner arranged us a driver on a number of occasions and do so without being intrusive.    The spa was also nice and we treated ourselves to a hammam.    The hotel was fairly quiet during our stay which made it feel like a real oasis. I would recommend other couples to visit at this time of year.    On the whole it was a great trip and much more reasonably priced than some of the nearby riads. We would definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen J wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: The staff are very helpful. When we arrived we were told that there was a problem with our room so we spent the first night at a neighbouring hotel. We were given a very nice room (the one in the T.A. image) next day and a free massage each so that made up for the minor inconvenience. If you want a real treat for dinner ask at reception if you can book for La Sultana then make sure you get good directions. It’s not on the same street as the riyadh (as they told me) but on the adjoining street and close to the place where the weird transformer characters are outside. It’s just a sign above an archway so easily missed but once inside it’s stunning though pricey.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Theodora a wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: This place is a total slice of heaven. Visually wonderful stylish elegant. Warm yet unobtrusive staff. It's that home away from home that you want yet with so many extras - the spa; wow! Enjoy- I'm planning a return trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Marcelo R wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Pretty good room, breakfast, restaurant and spa.
Review_Text: The hotel is amazinng. Pretty good room breakfast restaurant and spa. The crew was very attentious and helpful during my entire staying. I would certainly stay at Villa Makassar again in my next trip to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Labatut S wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Villa Makassar has been an oasis of calm and relaxation. From the moment we arrived until the check out all the staff has been so nice and helpful.  The first evening as we were quite tired we had dinner in the hotel. Lovely food and great service!  The breakfast is copious and is served until quite late (compared to the usual 10am finish in many hotels!) which is very nice when you are having a lazy holiday!  We had jacuzzi and massages included in our reservation super easy to book and honestly one of the best full massage I have ever had. We got out of there super relaxed!  They recommended and booked for us 2 restaurants for dinner and both places were incredible!  The roof top is great to chill in the afternoon but you can also get breakfast or a glass of wine up there!  The room was beautifully decorated the bathroom very spacious with an amazing stand alone bathtub!  The neighbourhood is great very central but much quieter than the center of the medina. You can walk pretty much to any landmarks and museum which was great!    Highly recommended!  Thank you Villa Makassar for a beautiful stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We absolutely loved this Riad and its location. We loved being in the Kasbah area of the medina. It was within walking distance of the palace and souks street bars and cafes and quite safe. Villa Makassar provided a perfect retreat. It is quite beautiful inside with a wonderful courtyard and terrace. It is also incredibly peaceful. The staff were superb. We were greeted on arrival with tea and delicacies. That warm welcome set the tone for the whole stay. The staff could not have been more attentive helpful or kind. First class service. Cannot recommend it highly enough. We also sampled the delights of the hammam and spa!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed 5 nights at the Villa Makassar and we can honestly say it was the best experience we have ever had in a hotel. Definetly the highlight of our 5 days in Morocco and here is why :    1 - The hotel itself is absolutely stunning : the decor is tastefully done and you can tell that it is well maintained and cleaned. Every where you look nothing is out of place. The atmosphere is relaxing and you can hear the birds sing in the morning. Fluffy day beds are waiting for you on the roof terrace as well as fresh towels.    2- We were upgraded into the most beautiful suite of the hotel because the heating wasnt working in our room : the suite was gorgeous and possibly the size of our 2 Bedroom flat in London !! :) Had a huuudge bathtub made in traditional stone which could host my boyfriend and I at the same time easily !! True relaxation. Again nothing out of place or "dirty" or broken. The room was cleaned every day and incent was burning when we came back : divine !    3- YOU HAVE TO TRY THE SPA !!! We booked a pack that included hammam scrub mask and massage and it was the BEST spa experience of my life ! I consider myself extremely difficult to please on that matter and this one did not disappoint. The only downer was my massage I did not enjoy it my masseuse was not very experienced. But my boyfriend LOVED his so he had better luck that me. The star of the show if definetely the hammam/scrub/body mask part. Heavenly and thouroughly executed by our therapist.    4- The are not enough words to thank the staff of the Villa : from the day we got there to the day we left we were treated like royalty. A few examples : our suitcases were carried for us in our room mint tea and pastries were served while we were checking in the concierge offered to post our post cards for us as we could not find stamps on a Sunday we were upgraded instantly to the best room they could offer the lovely cleaning ladies were always smiling the restaurant manager noticed I liked a certain pancake so the next day he had some made for me I didnt even ask ! Everyone was lovely caring and discreet. We really felt at home.    5- The location of course is great located in the Kasbah (old jewish district) it is 5-15 min away from the main attractions. It is in a local area so not touristy at all. Locals generally mind their own business and pay no attention to you. Beware of the motorcycles !! They are everywhere !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a boutique hotel located in the Kasba area of the medina. Location is great as it is out of the main touristic area but you can walk to the main square and some of the attractions in 10 to 15 minutes. This is an important point as Marrakech Medina is notorious for people getting lost in.  Villa Makassar is an Art Deco themed hotel with many antique furniture. The design is of great taste evocative of the 1920's and 1930's style. Every room is unique with a link to the period. As we came from Shanghai we were upgraded to the Sassoon suite (picture enclosed).  Service in Villa Makassar is the highest level and very attentive. They also have a restaurant that served us the best tajin we had in Morocco. This is highly recommended for Art Deco fans or anybody looking for a great hotel to enjoy Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely Riad in a quiet location
Review_Text: Located in a quiet street within walkable distance of the Palace and the Souks but situated a little further out than anticipated. Wonderful Art Deco interior with excellent attention to detail. Lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Great great great ! The place to stay
Review_Text: We booked via a package and had a wonderful surprised ! The location is in a quiet street near the king palace so quiet but still in the medina so we can find some small shops nearby. The place Jemaa El Fna and the souks are reachable by feet. The hotel have a wonderful decoration from 1920-30s and each room is differently decorated. Wonderful ! The staff is professional nice and very helpful. We enjoy the spa where the hammam and massage are with a good quality. A relaxing moment. The restaurant is good and we really appreciated the all day breakfast... perfect for long-sleepers. I would definitely highly recommended and return again !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Nice Riad. We stayed in one of the suites. They are very nice indeed if quite pricey. I didn't see the standard rooms but the decoration of the Riad is particularly stylish. More so than any other we've stayed at in Marrakesh.    The location is pretty good. It's set to the south of the city but you can walk to the souks in 10-15 mins.    There was some building work going on next door which was a little unfortunate as we ended up going out to avoid the noise so check with the owner before booking.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yaoxian C wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Don't let the construction next door fool you - beyond the door lies a deceptively modern grand and serene oasis. Comfortable quiet spacious rooms with modern bath facilities a roof with an incredible view and amenities galore left us very satisfied and happy. Hotel staff was incredibly helpful and very polite at all parts of our stay - especially the lady at the front desk (I'm sorry I forgot your name!). 5 stars!    We did the hammam downstairs (for a fairly reasonable price) and that's a special treat too.    While a little bit of a walk from the main square/attractions it's nothing unreasonable and the proximity to Clock Cafe (a must go) is fantastic!    Dinner at the hotel restaurant was a little pricey relative to other options in the medina but overall really well done. Plenty of other places to eat as well if that's not your game.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a wonderful stay. Lovely hotel. Peaceful. Clean. Friendly. Away from the bustle of the outside! Great food too. Good service. And make sure you try the hamman! The spa is just so relaxing. The decor is so 1920s and very atmospheric. Siham was our lady in charge and she was amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sophia Wright wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Mini honeymoon break at the Villa Makassar
Review_Text: We stayed at the Villa Makassar for our mini honeymoon break a week after we got married.  We had booked this Riad based on the great reviews we had seen on trip advisor  previously and it most definitely lived up to the reviews.  Firstly when we arrived at the airport we were greeted by a complimentary private taxi to the Riad which was a great touch.  When we arrived at the Riad the staff were very welcoming and even upgraded us to a suite as we had just got married.  The Riad was clean and had some great Art Deco decor once you stepped out of the villa you are in the heart of the old town which is a culture shock but you really get to experience 'real' Marrakesh.  The complimentary breakfast was great and was a mixture of western and moroccan breakfast was served wherever and when we wanted before 11am. This was a great option as one day we had to wake up early to go on an excursion and they arranged the breakfast to be served in our suite.  Overall our stay at the Villa Makassar was great the location is perfect for exploring the old town but once you step into this beautiful Riad you are in your own oasis away from all the hassle and bustle of the town. We would definitely stay here again only criticism was the occasional drain smell in our room. This did not last long and would not put us off staying here again.  Special thanks to Juliette for welcoming us so warmly and making our stay really special and memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Niranjali A wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We had a business dinner at Villa Macassar with about 50 people and it was lovely. Beautiful venue convenient location very friendly staff and really wonderful food. Loved it so much that I took friends back when we were sight seeing later. Definitely recommend for both professional and personal occasions!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Charlene Watson... W wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: We hosted a drinks reception and working dinner at Villa Makassar for 50 people and Siham and colleagues were incredibly helpful and accommodating helping us to make it a great success.    The location is easy to access and on entering it is grand and exciting - the decor is beautiful and the food was good. I hope next time I come I can stay in one of the amazing suites!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We stayed at this riad in Oct 2016. I have nothing negative to say about this road. It is filled with Art Deco. It is medium size airy  spotlessly clean and beautiful . The staff are superb! We had two meals in eveing plus three breakfast there. All the food was very good. The roof top terrace is our favorite of all riads in Morocco we stayed in. Highly recommend !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This place is amazing. We were greeted with delicious mint tea and the warm radiant smile of Siham the manager who offered our choice of three different rooms. The villa has been carefully designed with much attention to detail to create an ambiance of comfort and luxury. The staff were consistently attentive but never overbearing and we felt perfectly welcome throughout our stay.    We also had a spa treatment during our time there which was a good experience. Our only suggestion would be to have a male available as well for the massage part (though we did book this service last minute so it might be available normally). The masseuse did her job well but we both are pretty strong guys and it would take a quite a lot more muscle to work the tension out of our backs. The hammam experience was wonderful!    We had high expectations for a getaway in Marrakech and Villa Makassar exceed them. We recommend it without reservaton to anyone looking for a place of beauty and rest in a fascinating and bustling city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An absolutely stunning villa that looks exactly like the pictures. We got upgraded to the honeymoon suite which was amazing. The room was well designed and was absolutely stunning. We also had the spa which was good. The breakfast service and service in general is top notch. Have really no complaints. It was an amazing experience for both of us!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mor G wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful and clean, the best service!
Review_Text: We spent 4 nights in the beautiful villa. It was the best place we were hosted during our 2 weeks trip in Morocco.    The rooms are big special-designed and clean.    The hotel is just about 15 minutes walking (inside the Medina) from Jamma el Fna. We felt very safe to walk alone in the streets.    The stuff and specialy Cloudin the manager were very kind and helpful. We asked for changing room because we didn't want jacuzzi and they transferred our baggage and everything while we were out traveling.    Two of us didn't feel well 'cause of a bad orange juice in Jamma el Fna so the stuff were considerate and heedful and treat us very good. They made us food even it was before breakfast or after dinner time.    The breakfast is varied and is different from one day to another.    We met the owner as well who was very kind and welcoming.    Warmly recommended!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful stay in every way
Review_Text: Eight of us stayed for 3 nights at Villa Makassar to celebrate my friend's 40th birthday and we could not have asked for a more outstanding personalised and attentive experience. Having all travelled extensively and experienced top hotels in the past the bespoke service provided at Villa Makassar rivalled that of previous experiences.    All staff were committed to making our stay as special as possible. Particular examples of this were the initial welcome and discussion over our plans with the owner offering to confirm reservations and arrange transport a surprise birthday tea including cake for the birthday girl and even a surprise visit from the manager who came to the restaurant that we were dining at especially to wish us goodbye personally.    Meal timings are flexible and the answer to many of our questions were "as you wish." This really summed up the experience. All staff were happy to make us happy and if that meant breakfast at 3pm then so be it!    The spa treatment (we all chose the wellbeing package) was wonderful and by far the most special treatment I have experienced.    I would highly recommend this accommodation for groups or couples wanting a relaxed bespoke beautiful experience in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: From start to finish our experience at this riad was fantastic. Fabulous staff who go the extra mile to make your trip special. Thank you all for that and the birthday cake was a lovely surprise. I would recommend this special place wholeheartedly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: In startling contrast to the chaos of the streets of Marrakesh you walk through the arched polished entrance and you are immediately transported into another place and time. You have seen the pictures you know that it’s an Art Deco riad – but what is staggering is the attention to detail. Round every corner is something beautiful and unique from the roof terrace with bespoke furniture to the accoutrements that decorate every facet of the building.    We had the Rodchenko room and as far as Russian Constructivism goes it's probably not the most adaptable of art movements in terms of interior design but the prints were cool and the room was neat and had a sense of whimsy that I love.    This isn’t the luxury of say Royal Mansour it isn’t the price tag either – but this is the luxury of pure fantasy. Where the ambient jazz floats through the courtyard and you can sit in the reading room and imagine the ghosts of artists and writers sipping from highball glasses. The staff were also very friendly and so helpful from reception to housekeeping. We were bought cold drinks when sat by the pool and some snacks while we enjoying the evening on the roof terrace. They even brought over the biggest club sandwich known to the human race one evening nice touch. I only wish I could have taken a tour round the whole building to enjoy every bit.    The world is a big place and I’m not sure I will be going to Marrakesh again but if I did would I go back to Villa Makassar? Absolument!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ghizala S wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: I booked this riad after reading the reviews on here. The villa is located in the Kasaba area of Marrakech it's not too far from the hussle and bustle of Jemil al Efna square.    We arrived at 11 in the morning as we had a very early flight from Gatwick the hotel staff were so lovely and welcoming. We were offered breakfast whilst our room was being prepared this was such a lovely gesture as we had arrived earlier than the check in time.  The Riad is very deceiving from the outside but inside it is very spacious and light we ended up changing rooms as we wanted a room that had a shower. The manager was very gracious and allowed us to pick the room we wanted from the ones that were available. All the staff in the hotel were lovely and were always more than happy to help. Mr Mahmood and Mr Yousif couldn't do enough to help us and we're always on hand if we needed anything. The rooms were cleaned everyday sometimes even twice a day. The moment you enter through the doors your senses are greeted by lovely music and the smell of orange blossom. The breakfast area is beautiful and the breakfast is delicious we were served traditional breakfast every day and we enjoyed it.  I really can't fault this place it is ideal if you are looking for a peaceful quite place that offers you personal care and service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cecile M wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a truly magical place. It wraps it's arms around you from the moment you walk through the huge door - a true contrast to what lies outside!  The beauty of this place lies in the warmth and welcome of the staff the calm atmosphere attention to detail and almost above all the discretion of the whole place and the people that work in it.  They don't enforce themselves on you - no rigid dining times no fuss out of sight but always available if you need anything and only too keen to help.  The hotel itself is even more than the pictures. You have to be in it to appreciate the detail and thought that went into lovingly recreate this art deco era.  We discovered other restaurants that belonged to highly regarded hotels and Impressive as they were every night we came back to our amazing suite (a courtesy and most unexpected upgrade) We were so grateful that we had found this place.  Can't wait to return!  Merci To Claudine and her most chaleruex team !    Cecile & Stefan
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not a 5* in the slightest - needs an overhaul
Review_Text: I booked this hotel as a surprise to my husband for our wedding anniversary after reading the reviews. We arrived late in the evening and were upgraded to a large suite which was very nice of them. We were shown to our room and it was boiling and had a sewage smell which we told the porter. The air-conditioning did not work and after over an hour of trying to sleep in the room we had to move to another room- this time one with two single beds - hardly ideal for a couple there to celebrate their anniversary. We appreciate that things can go wrong but I was shocked the next day when despite calling the manager and asking her to sort it out she sent up a guy that wasn't an engineer (he pressed the same button we pressed all night and admitted it wasn't workingeven though I asked to speak to her and for her to come up she didn't. Eventually that day we were moved to a third room - by this point we didn't care that it was dark we were just glad the air-conditioning was working. I think the hotel air conditioning just doesn't run well as we also had a fan on every day.    The rooms were clean and nicely decorated although the shower didnt work properly and I was shocked that the duvet was not changed daily. I noticed on one evening that the duvet cover that was changed had blood on it - not very nice and so we didn't use a duvet all night and left it on the floor. The next day the duvet was picked up with the same cover and put on our bed. That was horrible and my husband went to reception to ask for a change which I am glad they did quickly.    There was a gentleman there that was lovely! He arranged our breakfast every morning and was incredibly helpful. He has the true makings of a good manager and I am sad to say was more helpful and attentive than the manger herself. He arranged a cake for us on our actual anniversary which was lovely and was so helpful trying to find a memory card and suggesting things we could do. He truly made us feel welcome and nothing we asked him was a problem for him - he is the reason we have given an extra star to what we would have. He truly is an asset to the place.    I also have to say that the restaurant was not open on the days we were there- we were told that there would be room service but of the 3 times I asked on the day I was told either that there was no food or that the kitchen was closed. I have never been to a 5* place that has no food. The saddest thing was on the day we asked it was our anniversary so we were looking forward to a romantic anniversary dinner - in the end we went to La Mamounia (which I have reviewed) and on the first day we asked about food we were referred to the hotel next-door which was lovely (again reviewed separately the les Jardins de le medina). To make it worse on our return to the hotel the owner was having a feast with his family - that is pretty shocking.    Personally I do not think this is by any means a 5* hotel - 4 at best and a good 3*. If they open the restaurant adjust the air-conditioning and make it a little more lively I think this could be a good place but until then I would not personally recommend staying here. It is hard to find (almost every cab driver struggled to know where it was) and the local area isn't amazing. Lastly I think that the manager needs to step up and act like one. On one occasion my husband walked into the reception to find her asleep on the sofa - talk about unprofessional. She expects her team to do everything whereas she should take it upon herself to help guests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I’d seen Villa Makassar featured in a recent Telegraph article of the ‘ Top 10: best riad hotels in Marrakech’ so it was great when i discovered they had (affordable) availability for a trip to celebrate my 40th Birthday!    It’s in a great location - in the Kasbah quarter within the walls of the medina - near the Saadian Tombs and the royal palaces (not that you can see much of that besides the outer walls) which allowed us a more authentic experience of Marrakech rather than being stuck on the outskirts of the city in a ‘tourist compound’ and having to be shuttled in/out of the city. When we first arrived we were slightly concerned if we’d ever find our way back to its front door through the winding local streets but the local Kasbah mosque was a useful local landmark and Jemaa el Fna square is a 15-20 minute walk away - whilst trying to avoid the local scooters!    During our stay there was only 1 other couple there (maybe as it was Ramadan) and we were kindly offered a free room upgrade. We also had free wifi in the room and our first access to the downstairs Hammam and Jacuzzi were included in our stay - though i’d recommend trying the Hammam Ritual Makassar experience along with a ‘refreshing’ dip in the courtyard pool.    The hotel has a really nice relaxed vibe and is gorgeous aesthetically - with quirky art deco furnishings and architectural details mixed with luxurious modern comforts. The staff were very accommodating (even making me a surprise birthday cake) and also arranged our airport transfers and a driver for when we wanted to sample some local restaurants that were further away - i’d recommend Comptoir Darna La Maison Arabe and Dar Cherifa. We didnt eat in the hotel restaurant but (as well as my tasty cake) we enjoyed the daily breakfasts which you can wherever you wish - your room courtyard restaurant or up on the sun soaked roof terrace.    A recommended and unique experience and we hope to visit again some day!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Behind those wooden doors is an oasis of calm and tranquility. Beautiful touches of 'Art Deco' styling which is a welcome change from the contemporary look that my partner and I are used to. The junior suite was clean spacious and very comfortable. We had a wonderful time relaxing on the roof terrace and in the spa. The staff made our stay extra special with their warmth and attentiveness. On the morning of my partners birthday they presented him with a delicious heart shaped chocolate cake. Big thanks to all at Villa Makassar for making our stay an enjoyable one. We would definitely stay with you again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick D wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: Calm and quiet oasis in the Kasbah
Review_Text: We stayed 7 nights in this impeccably clean and beautifully decorated Riad where we felt as though it was our own private residence with ample staff. From arrival to departure we were always treated with exquisitely attentive yet discreet care. I'm an avid swimmer and each day I had the pool to myself followed by late afternoons or early evenings on the roof top deck with a glass of Moroccan rose and olives. After a full day of activities either sight seeing in the Medina or day trips to the Atlas Mountains or beach it was always a pleasure to return to this property. We were upgraded to the lovely Chambre Rousseau at no extra charge which came with a balcony overlooking the interior court yard. Breakfasts were always well thought out and varied with ample freshly squeezed orange juice coffee yogurt and a variety of sweet cakes crepes and Moroccan bread with butter and preserves. As other reviewers have indicated the property is conveniently situated to important tourist sites and reasonable walking distance to the central square. We arranged for a trip to the Ourika Valley in the Atlas Mountains and to the coastal town of Essaouira through the Villa Makassar and were pleased with the price quality of the driver vehicle and guides. We dined our first night at the property but also enjoyed dinner at the Jardins de Medina right next door and the funky Cafe Clock a few doors down.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hnedel M wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Really like this place. It is located in an area called the Kasbah. It's a bit more updated and the décor might be described as Morrocan art deco. We got upgraded to the jacuzzi suite. While it was a very nice sentiment it didn't work out well for us because it had no shower. I'm 6'3 there are not many "comfortable" tubs out there for people my height. Besides the awkward showers/bath experience we loved this place. Youssef (Maître D') had all the answers and took great care of us every morning making sure we had what we needed for our day out. Thank you    My only minor complaint is the lack of espresso they only offer coffee. Given that Morrocan's primarily drink tea we were not terribly surprised. We would gladly go back but we'll stick with a room with a shower instead of a tub.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ashid S wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: This boutique Art Deco style hotel is in the old town about 20 minute walk to the main square and the souks. It's ideally placed for exploring the old narrow streets. If you get lost (like we did) look out for cafe clock. It is just down the same street from there.    We loved the fact that the raids are located on unassuming little streets which hide expansive little gems like this hotel behind a large door that opens out directly on to the street.    The hotel has around 11 rooms all decorated in a unique style. We stayed in room 4 which was narrow but long and had a nice large bathroom. The room was generally comfortable but we found the bed a little too firm (I guess we were being a little too picky). The hotel arranged for some extra layers of mattress toppers to make the bed more comfortable which did the job.    The breakfast is traditional Moroccan and there is no choice offered on what you are given in terms of breads and pastries. You do however get a choice of eggs and coffee or teas. Yousef is an absolute star and always has a smile and a welcoming words to start your morning.    The restaurant Le Makkasar was listed on the best restaurant guide we were given on check-in but the restaurant was mostly empty. We tried it for dinner one night. Being vegetarian the check prepared 3 exceptional courses that were not listed on the menu. These paired with an excelled selection of wine. Of course the restaurant is not as cheap as eating out in other restaurants in Marrakech but we thoroughly enjoyed it. Well done chef.    Whilst we had dinner the talented in house musician/ maitre d'hotel Ismail sung a number of songs in English making the experience special.    The pool area is small and enclosed by high wall which offers privacy but restricts sunshine. The water was quite cold but we enjoyed the swim in the heat.    Our package included a 30 minute hammam (steam room) and jacuzzi visit. The hammam traditionally includes a scrub however we were told the free access was self service only which was mildly disappointing. We were not offered an option to upgrade for the scrub. My wife also had a pedicure (paid for) at the spa which was average (she found it all little unhygienic compared to what she was used to as the implements such as the foot file had been used previously and didn't look very clean). This may be something for the spa to reconsider and is the only reason for the 4* rating I have given for an otherwise excellent hotel.    Overall it was a lovely 4 night stay in a great location. If you get a chance try the cafe clock. This is a community cafe which has regular evening local performances and events. It's nice to get a glimpse of local culture and hang out with the locals.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Beth C wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: It doesn't look much from the outside but inside it is a total oasis of calm tranquility and total utter luxury. The rooms are beautiful shaded and very quiet whilst the roof top sun terrace is the perfect space for a lazy afternoon with a book and a long tall drink. The pool whilst chilly is brilliant for cooling off and the food is just incredible.  The service is excellent and attentive without being intrusive and truly nothing is too much trouble. The only slight criticism I could level is that the hotel is very quiet and therefore doesn't have the most "atmosphere" especially in the evening when it feels a little "ghost-town" but you don't have to venture far to be in the hustle and bustle of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at Villa Makassar for four nights. The hotel is small but stunning a beautifully-decorated oasis of tranquility. The staff were attentive and helpful and assisted with restaurant bookings and advice on where to explore. It was about a 20 min walk from the hotel to the main square so we didn't need to rely on any transport to get around.    The hotel breakfasts were incredible - fresh breads delicious yoghurt and cheese with homemade fig preserves.    I used the hotel's hammam and my treatment was very relaxing.    I would definitely recommend staying here - we loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Top end riad in great location
Review_Text: I have been to Marrakech on 3 previous ocassions. This riad is situated on one of the larger streets about a 15 minute stroll from the main square. A great option if you have never been to Marrakech before. The building is spacious and very well appointed throughout. The staff are pleasant and helpful. The food is excellent and they have a very good wine list. It is more expensive than other options but you get what you pay for. The wifi is generally good beds are comfortable bathrooms are unusual. We stayed on the top floor it was quiet and chic. My only criticism is the lighting is minimal or low level which is lovely at night but a bit annoying in the day. We didn't use the pool but did use the roof terrace. The sun beds are super comfy! It's a lovely space. We used the spa and had the most amazing massage at a great price! I didn't like the little boxed fish tanks in the ceiling it was upsetting for me to see these lonely goldfish without any plants or other stimulation. I believe they should be living together a large tank somewhere else in the building and some pretty aquatic plants put in their place. Other than that I would highly recommend the villa and the spa!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: You walk up to this huge unsuspecting door and you wonder where on earth has the taxi guy taken us! But open the doors to a little gem of a hotel... luxurious sophisticated stylish tranquil. perfect for little romantic getaway or just to be close to the city centre for some site seeing. Everything is walking distance or a really short cab ride from here get lost in the maze of souks in Jemaa el Fna and the billions of stalls the colourful YSL Jardin Majorelle El Badi Palace and Koutoubia Mosque or just take in the history and architecture in the medina.    Our room was on the second floor looking into the little riad. Throughout the day it had a flock of sparrows fly in and out of the branches of the trees really enchanting. Room was clean cool our bed was massive and comfy it was beautifully decorated but bit dark. Quiet at night. Roof garden is cute and tranquil had comfy loungers and gets some great sun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: a f wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: An amazing place with brilliant staff.
Review_Text: My wife and i stayed at Villa Makassar for 3 nights and really didnt want to leave. It was a special weekend away as was my wifes 40th birthday so we wanted a perfect weekend. We read the reviews but didnt expect the reviews to be exceeded. I cannot recommend this place enough. A very nice driver collected us from the airport and took us to the door where we were greeted by such a nice man (we were in awe of the place so forgot his name!). The room was amazing we were offered a choice of 2. We wanted to make the most of our stay so had advised Juliette in advance and she advised us on a city guide and a guided tour of the atlas mountains. Our guide of the city was called Abdul and he was a complete gentleman who educated us on marrakesh and the history of morocco as well as an insight into the people and places it really was not what we were expecting and was a fantastic way of spending a few hours; we learnt a lot. We were wary of wandering around marrakesh on our own as we had listened to too many people our experience was that the people are lovely but it can be intimidating late at night but what city isnt. We arranged for a guide to take us to the atlas mountains his name was Idris and was such a lovely man it felt like a friend had taken us out for the day. He showed us places that tourists wouldnt usually visit and gave yet another insight into this amazing place i fully recommend a guided tour from Idris. The staff at the hotel were amazing very relaxed but catered to every need without any fuss. Yusef the waiter always had a smile on his face and was so welcoming in everything we asked for. The hamman spa experience is not to be missed! We are going to try and recreate this at home. Our only regret is that we should have stayed longer but that will happen next time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent 3 nights at villa Makkassar. Unfortunately the weather didn't serve us well so luckily our hotel was so wonderful we didn't mind being stuck! Yousef was really sweet room was beautiful.... Only wish they had hand wash. The food was lovely (small portions master chef type presentation!). Location was great the taxi company they provide/recommend was great Ismail looked after us during our stay. For two girls on their own I felt very safe the staff couldn't do anymore. You must do the jacuzzi & spa!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jo B wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Pros:  Beautiful communal areas sophisticated and chic;  Lovely roof terrace with sun beds to lounge around on;  Staff amazing so friendly and helpful;  Good location just south of the medina but within reach of all the main central areas;  Food in the restaurant very good and breakfast was simple Moroccan style but always very tasty;  Free wifi    Cons:  Rooms were small (we had a prestige room) and dark;  The layout of the rooms could've been better - eg no plug near mirror to use hair dryer lacked storage space;  Rooms were very noisy and not sound proofed enough so we were woken several times during the night and early morning by birds or people moving round the villa;  Pool was lovely but surrounded by high walls so the sun couldn't reach it when we were there so not warm enough for a swim - probably fine in high summer;  Service was very slow eg on the roof terrace there was a bar that was supposed to be open all day from 10am but there was never anyone there to take orders and consequently you had to go down to reception to ask for someone to take an order for lunch or drinks and would have to wait 30-40minutes for someone to arrive - this is a shame as the staff were all so lovely and helpful when they did arrive so can only assume that there weren't enough staff ?    That said we had a really good time and would recommend this villa despite the points raised above. It was also pretty well priced for what you got. If they can address some of the cons then it really could be the perfect place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: AMAZING ART DECO GEM IN THE KASBAH
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed five nights in this amazing hideaway in the heart of the Kasbah. Everything about Villa Makassar if first rate. The place itself is brilliantly designed and perfectly furnished. Everything is spectacular original Art Deco. Our deluxe suite was a massive room off an open-air courtyard. We had our own terrace and a giant bath. The room was filled with fine art and furniture. The staff provided personal caring service. They went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect. Thank you Claudine Josef and Rabi. Highlights were breakfasts and dinners in the Riad's restaurant a deluxe Hammam in the spa and quiet moments on the rooftop terrace. Also the location is excellent. Just a short walk to Marrakech's main square through ancient streets and alleys brimming with local life and colour. If you like old-style service and comfort in an artistic setting you will truly enjoy this gem in the heart of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I would move here tomorrow (if it weren't for the rest of Marrakech)
Review_Text: This is one of the most meticulously curated hotels I have ever been in. There are no corners cut anywhere. The design is beautiful the decor superb the customer service over the top. After a long day fighting your way through the souk this place feels like paradise. But even if it were in Paris it would still feel like paradise. I cannot recommend it highly enough. The only thing that was not perfect was the WiFi but truth be told I was happy to have a break and enjoy the many spaces to discover without my phone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beyond 5 Stars.... Best Hotel I've ever stayed at.
Review_Text: There is so much to share about this well hidden jewel under the African sun. I have stayed in some spectacular and unique hotels all around the world but this is something even more memorable.    So I invite you to sit back dear reader to relax and perhaps pour yourself a glass of wine and allow me to indulge you with the tale the Villa Makassar from the perspective of a couple of English travellers.    Your experience of the hotel starts long before you start packing as they mail you to enquire if they can assist you in arranging airport transfers and confirming your travel details. Not an automated spreadsheet no sir a warm and personally typed note from the owner.    When one arrives at Marrakesh from London becomes acutely aware that the world looks somewhat different one drives down large avenues lined with gardens and palm trees then with hardly a warning the car veers off into a tiny gateway in the sandy covered wall signalling that you have entered the 1000 year old Medina. After driving past King Mohammed VI's humble abode the car squeezes into a tiny lane and abruptly stops outside a large and ornate door.    With some trepidation you crack open the door and something remarkable happens your eyes struggle to adapt to the dimmed lighting in the gorgeous entrance hallway. You are ushered into the sumptuous lounge sink into the feature sofas and check in commences.    The staff look after every detail and immediatley start to "fix" things excursions reservations transfers. Nothing is too much. We were most privileged to have an opportunity to discuss our trip intentions with the owner over Arabic Pastries and a glass or two of Mint Tea. A more kind informative and warm person you will not meet. He took time to answer our every question to alert us to the latest street scams (there are many in the Kasbah and in the main square) and to help us to understand the correct costs of standard things like taxi fares etc.    You are then given a tour of the entire walled hotel (essentially 2 x quadrangles a huge roof terrace and bar a small plunge pool and the restaurant and kitchens). The spa is under the main quadrangle and is worth a look just to feast your eyes on a stunning example of interior design. Another interesting feature is the "fish tank" kitchen. There is no part of the spotlessly clean kitchen or any food preparation that cannot be witnessed from the square.    There are 2 classes of room each individual in every respect and following a tour of the entire hotel you are shown your room and briefed on its features.    The decor is magical with subdued lighting stunning furniture delightful art deco design features and object d'art cleverly arranged to magnify the experience. The bathroom is gorgeous with a huge feature shower and in our case the most stunning towel rail (it was elliptical shaped and stored the towels as well as warming them) as well as a heated floor. Naturally there is WIFI throughout which enabled us to be able to have a video call with our children from the Kasbah!    A lovely nights sleep is followed by a relaxed breakfast with the warmest and most considerate service. We had local Breads/Pastries/yoghurt with fresh orange juice and tea.    Now my dear friends some of you are a little more focussed on the self indulgent practices than I am but with some gentle coercing I was convinced to try the spa package at the hotel. I was washed steamed scrubbed (and I mean every inch of my hide!) oiled rinsed and then massaged. We had the spa package as a couple and it was such a treat. The hotel had arranged a BIG day for us with a day long excursion into the mountains (a "must see" dear friends) followed by a spa treatment then a dinner at the hotels excellent restaurant (more of that later). The spa is sumptuously arranged and the tepidorium has a remarkable feature of ceiling fish tanks....    After a brief interlude to put on some fresh clothes we descended to the restaurant for dinner and were treated to the best of Morocco and washed down with a surprisingly good local drop of vino. The food and service were Michelin star standard and to be frank it was like finding a discrete dining room being run by the staff from the Savoy grill.    If you have any doubt of the ability or intent of the staff let me assure you that they are totally focussed on making your stay something magical. As we went to depart our local tour company messed up our airport transfer we had limited currency left and our stress levels were rising like a Russian space rocket. Claudine the manager quickly arranged a cab paid on account and took payment from me via card. We arrived on time and with a sensation that we had never really been in any jeopardy.    When you think about it that is the most precious feeling a hotel can impart to a guest.    To the Owner and staff Sam and I would like to express our sincere thanks you made a long weekend into the trip of a lifetime I even heard the phrase "This has been the best day of my entire life" from my partner after the day that the hotel arranged for us. We cannot express more heartfelt admiration.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jessica M wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: A peaceful retreat in beautiful Marrakech
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here in February 2016 for three nights and absolutely loved our stay. It was our first trip to Marrakech and we wanted to experience the hustle and bustle of the Medina whilst having a little piece of calmness to return to each day.    The Riad is on a quiet street and very well located to the main square in the medina (10-12 minutes walk) inside it is spacious and calm. The art deco style is lovely and offers something different. You can see how much time and effort has been spent furnishing the hotel/riad to absolute perfection.    The bedrooms are lovely although a little on the dark side. There is a wonderful roof terrace and spa.    The service we received was absolutely fantastic. Everyone was so friendly we booked 2 guides through the front desk - one to take us through the medina and souks and another to take us to the Atlas Mountains both guides were wonderful and very well chosen by the hotel.    We only ate breakfast at the hotel and all other meals we had out although had we have stayed for more than three nights we certainly would have eaten in one night. The breakfast was lovely; you don't order anything instead they'll bring you a section of fruits local delicacies breads pancakes etc. and freshly squeezed juices. The restaurant manager remembered what drinks we asked for on our first morning (breakfast tea and fresh fruit smoothie) and always made sure they were ready for us each morning at breakfast.    I have removed a star for two reasons; firstly as already mentioned the room was too dark - understandably the style of lamps chosen were reflective of the art deco style but it would have been useful if they'd included more of them as the low lighting made it difficult to read (and apply make up with confidence) :-)    Secondly; wifi was an issue - it only works in the restaurant lounge area and lobby it does't work in any of the bedrooms. For three nights it was actually rather refreshing not getting caught up in the digital world when we were in our bedroom but because it was our first time in Marrakech we needed to come down to the lounge area quite often to check locations of restaurants reviews local maps etc.    All in all it was a truly wonderful experience and we absolutely loved Marrakech. We will definitely be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: What a fabulous week and in a vibrant and cultural city!
Review_Text: As soon as we arrived at the airport and were met by our transfer we knew we were in for a good week so headed to the hotel with positive vibes! On arrival we were welcomed with traditional Moroccan tea and told about excursions available before given a tour of the hotel and finally being shown to our room - what a fantastic start!    Our room was compact but had everything we needed for a four night stay including a large shower and bath robes both of which are a thumbs up from me.    The hotel staff could not have been friendlier and were so attentive to your every need nothing was too much. They arranged all our tours and the providers were all great.    We tested out the Hammam/Sauna and the Jacuzzi plus I had a facial and a massage in the spa which were both lovely.    We'd love to return to Villa Makassar in the summer months when we can make more use of the roof terrace and sun beds!    One last thing - a BIG thank you to all at Villa Makassar who made our stay superb :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Most beautiful hotel I have been to!
Review_Text: This hotel is truly amazing. Stunning rooms: loved the jacuzzi in the floor of our first room then we were upgraded to another very large room with a beautiful four poster bed. Breakfasts on the rooftop in the lovely December sun. Was lovely and peaceful going at off peak times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Villa Makassar for 6 days and had an excellent experience. Everyone was very kind and professional: the staff was great and Claudine directed us to the right people in Marrakech helping us make the stay in Marrakech even more pleasant. The spa was relaxing (recommend the hammam) and the restaurant's menu was highly appreciated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lorna A wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: The hotel that dreams are made of. One for the bucket list.
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped foot in villa makassar we were treated like princesses. The most friendly warm and caring staff we have ever encountered at a hotel stay.  The food was excellent breakfast to be served whenever you chose and the decor was to die for.  A beautiful environment which ensured for the most perfect stay.    We would recommend it to the queen.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nadjib S wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Excellent experience in a surprising Art Deco magnificent Riad in the old city of Marrakech
Review_Text: Very professional and friendly staff. Excellent service. Unique and surprising experience of a superb Art Deco Riad in one of the oldest part of the Medina of Marrakech. Could also be an interesting option for business meetings or (small) gatherings and events.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: C.G.W. S wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Distinctive in style and perfect as a retreat
Review_Text: Definitely one of the most distinctive houses we´d been to recently. If you are into style and architecture of the Wiener Werkstätten and the Bauhaus you will find an amazing riad not only in references in its style but also in a grand collection of ´little masterpieces´. Reminds of a sophisticated home. Taken into account that this kind of atmosphere needs some space it is preferable to take on of the suites. The normal rooms seem to be a bit small for living in there. Cosmopolitan owner and very polite and helpful staff. Very good breakfast. Prolongated our stay there
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Morihiko Y wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We actually ended up staying here by accident (original place we booked was full for the first night) but were very pleased with the excellent service. We were offered a welcome drink and pastries upon arrival and given a thorough introduction to Marrakech on a map before being shown to our rooms. We stayed in room 7 on the top floor and aside from the TV only working for French channels for some strange reason it was very clean spacious and comfortable. Wouldn't have minded staying here for the entirety of our stay in Marrakech but unfortunately they were booked from the second night onwards so we had to go back to the place we originally booked. Would definitely recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Prescott P wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: The decoration of this hotel is really beautiful. We were constantly noticing new details and luxurious objects. The design of the hotel coupled with a fabulous service made our stay very special. The cuisine is delectable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ivor N wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: I was blind but now I can see!
Review_Text: Lots of art deco design layers in this hotel - probably too many for someone other than a connoisseur to notice. The owner has spent many years collecting the right furniture and remodelling the hotel features to produce a cult art deco attraction. Everywhere one notices the thought that has gone into the fine detailing. Service was brilliant and the Hammam jaccuzzi was provided free although due to the heat I nearly passed out after only 10 minutes because my heart was racing dangerously and I felt very faint.
