One good tip for this Riad(this is what they are called in Marrakech) is the Clock cafe a few doors up which serves some of the best food and entertainment this far out of town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ricky C wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad - Best service received in Morocco by far
Review_Text: This is our second trip to Morocco and this is by far The best Riad we have stayed in so far. We were picked up from the airport and from the husle of a typical Marrakesh narrow street where donkey carts motorcycle and people are flying pass we entered into the tranquil Villa Makassar.    We were greeted by Selma and offered Tea and located pastries whilst we complete the check in process. Selma was extrmely helpful offering lots of local advise and places to see. The room was great food was fantastic facilities (pool jacuzzi spa and roof terrace) was exceptional    Morocco can come across very impersonal at times ( those who have been will know) but Selma Nabil Youseff (and every other staff i came across) was absolutely fabulous .    We will be back very soon!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris M wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Amazing service and attention to detail with a willing smile
Review_Text: It was my wife's 50th birthday and she wanted to go to Marrakesh and I wanted it to be special. I did all the booking in secret and got an immediate and helpful response to my online booking.  When we arrived it was the smell that first lifted our mood - orange blossom fragrances throughout the hotel. Our luggage was dealt with we were given a tray of exquisite biscuits and mint tea to acclimatise after the journey. Then Ishmael gave us a tour of the hotel's layout and features.  Many of the rooms are themed on great artists and we initially got the Mondrian room which was moody and colourful.  We ate in the hotel that evening and the food was of a very high standard indeed and with a great choice of wines to match (try the Cuvee Presidente red!).  For the next few days Selma and the team ensured that we knew about the main sights looked after our needs and jumped on any problems like a blown light bulb with startling and un-intrusive efficiency.  Breakfast on the roof terrace got us attuned to the day very quickly - shaded against the heat and bright sunshine on the well-designed art deco space. Every breakfast contained fresh and ever-changing local pastries and was delivered with smiles and care.  On the final day we tried the hotel spa. We had no idea what to expect but the well-bring package exceeded anything we could have imagined. It was four hours of total head to toe pampering scrubbing oiling washing and massaging. It was the ideal conclusion to a perfect week in this hot and bustling city.  I cannot praise this hotel and its attentive staff highly enough. It was the little touches the pre-emptive nature of the way we were looked after - you felt akin to royalty for the entire time.  You simply could not imagine a more wonderful way to be looked after in this often daunting and chaotic city. It felt like an oasis and the staff felt like friends.  If we come back to Marrakesh then I would not hesitate to book here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent hotel with pleasant helpful staff and the best spa we have had to date A++++
Review_Text: My wife and I ventured to Marrakesh despite all the negative reviews from both colleagues and the internet. We booked our flight and the Villa Makassar separately and were both more than a little apprehensive following the recent events in Tunisia. Not much choice on carrier so it was a Ryan Air flight. To all those negative reviewers on Marrakesh "Is there only one Marrakesh?" The one we went to was welcoming offered adventure and a step out of the box holiday wise. Firstly we were offered free transfer from the airport by the hotel delivered safely to the oasis that is Villa Makassar. We were given tea and local pastries and then a tour of the hotel and all its facilities by the receptionist before being shown to our room. The room more than exceeded our expectations it was beautiful. We ate in the hotel on the first night as we were travel weary. Excellent food excellent staff and impeccably clean. On the first venture out it is easy to get lost as all the streets look the same and you do get people directing you in the wrong direction however get clear directions from the hotel and stick to them you soon get used to the way. We ate out every night and never once had any stomach issues again wet wipes give you an added sense of security. All the food we had was piping hot beers were cold and the street sellers not too imposing although it can be fun if you engage in some bartering. DO NOT TAKE TRAVELLERS CHEQUES! You cannot change them in any of the banks or hotels despite The Post Office in UK recommending them. We had to rely on out bank cards and cash because of it!  On the 2nd day we decided to experience the Spa and went for the steam room and mud treatment face and body massage. It has to be the best we have ever had to date - Thank you to all the spa staff at Villa Makassar you were excellent!!  We can only highly praise and recommend the Villa Makassar Hotel to anyone visiting Marrakesh it is an oasis of calm and tranquility away from the hustle and bustle. So it is a massive 5 stars for us to both Villa Makassar its staff and Marrakesh we will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Location was perfect for a quiet stay if you are not worried about walking through the local area. It is about a 10-15 minute walk to the main square/souk area. Food and spa in the hotel were both great breakfast was especially good! And nothing too much for the waiter. The roof terrace of the hotel was amazing! absolutely gorgeous and a real sun trap. My only slight complaint was the room was very small and very dark. No main light only lamps and i had to use the torch on my phone to see things in the wardrobe. The room was also very hot overnight. We had to open both windows which only led onto the balcony corridor so did not let much air in these were also close everyday by cleaning staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: S C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Amazing calming relaxing place to stay in a quiet part of busy Marrakech. The spa is a must and the rooms are stunning. The rooftop and pool sets this place aside.  Salma the rest of the staff are friendly and only too happy to help
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just the place to relax and put your feet up away from the noise of Marrakech. Stayed with my wife and found the rooms spacious and comfortable with first class service. Enjoyed the restaurant on both evenings we stayed and the terrace on the roof is great for relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked for a week's stay at this Riad near the Royal Palace in the southern Casbah area of town. As with other Riads this small hotel entered through an inconspicuous door was very spacious inside with two large 'atriums' complete with water fountain and large olive trees swimming pool Spar and restaurant. The place is decorated/furnished in Art Deco style with beautiful artefacts from across the world. In keeping with this style the rooms are a bit dark though amply lit. The bathroom fittings are modern; in some cases a bit too modern i.e. more form/beauty than function/practicality. The beds are comfortable if tightly fitted into the space; we competed to see who could scramble into bed (from the bottom) first !    The restaurant menu was short and unchanged during the 7 days of our stay; Thereby encouraging us to eat-out more often. A trendy local 'cafe' called 'Clock' was a handy first-day visit; the owner even lending us local cash to tide us over till the next day...an indication of the kindness and welcoming nature of the Moroccan people!!  The lunch/dinner food is beautifully prepared & presented. The breakfasts are joyful; with fresh fruit-juices eggs how-you-like endless tea and coffee AND the most exquisite breads pastries and cakes you could wish-for.....all graciously served by Youssef.    The big plus-point here is the staff: the whole place is run by just a handful of well-trained and dedicated people for whom nothing is too much trouble. We also availed of the Spa facilities especially the Hammam & Scrub Jacuzzi and body massage...all accompanied by the mandatory 'mint tea' and delivered by the friendly and efficient Fatima and Latima.    It is a short taxi ride to the main area of activity: the huge square at Jamaal-El-Fna and the surrounding maze of Souks. The square itself was Eastern magic during the day; with snake charmers (sic) oil&perfume stalls juice-stalls and several cafes...then in the evening turning into a mass of 'fast-food' stalls each hawking their pretty-same Moroccan food of salads grilled meats & fish couscous and tagine.    We availed of the hotel's touring packages each with nice car&driverNooritel : the City Tour which takes-in the original walled Medina and the New Town called just 'Europe'; then a trip into the Atlas mountains including a visit to a genuine Berber village/house and and climb up to waterfalls.    All in all this was just the calm relaxing - but also exciting - break with warmth & sunshine all through that we were looking for. Thank you Selma Ismail housekeeping staff and especially Madam Chef and Youssef for making it so wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andreas J wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: The best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: This is a luxury boutique hotel with only a few rooms in the old town of Marrakech. Every room is different and with original Art Deco furniture. Sometime you think you are in a museum. Everything is clean and quiet. Do not miss a treatment in the hotel´s hammam - ist a lifetime experience !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My sister and I stayed at the Villa Makasar in October and can't recommend it enough. The hotel and staff were truly wonderful and couldn't do enough for us while we were there. The hotel is so calm and you'd never know you were in the Medina. Everything from the room to the rooftop area spa and salon were perfection. We had the best spa treatment ever here. The entire trip was so relaxing and nothing was too much for the staff. If you want a boutique hotel with comfort delicious food and welcoming staff then Villa Makasar is the place for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Comfort and excellent addition to the fun atmosphere and high-end service and privacy. Also note that did not stop me from visiting my favorite places in this region famos resort as I like to call the psychological comfort of knowing that he increases your sense of sophistication in the Moroccan Aledq
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Such a lovely riad in a quiet corner of the Medina. Great location friendly staff and delicious food. Hotel is amazingly decorated each room has its own individual style with furniture that the manager has collected on his travels (he is lovely and made us feel very welcome). The tajin we had for supper here on our first night was the best on our trip - and we went to some fairly high end restaurants.  The only negatives: as it wasn't peak season the bar on the roof was closed so getting an afternoon drink could be a challenge so we often went to the next door hotel to have a pre supper/afternoon drink. Also the pool area is fairly small which means that if another couple are in there it does feel like your intruding by going for a swim.  A great
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My brother and I stayed at Villa Makassar in September and it was the highlight of our time in Marrakech! From the moment we set foot inside the walls of this lovely riad we knew we needed to extend our stay - and extend our stay we did! The villa is decorated with beautiful art deco pieces the owner has collected on his travels around the world - and we were lucky enough to chat with him throughout our stay! Each room has its own aesthetic and the vibe throughout the property is peaceful luxury. The villa's location in the Kasbah was close to but a pleasant distance from the craziness of the souks. I was so happy to retreat to our little paradise at the end of each day! The staff was warm caring friendly and professional. We truly felt like we were among family as we ate breakfast on the gorgeous roof terrace or listened to Ismail play the guitar in the evenings. I was sick after our trip to the Sahara and Marion went out of her way to get tea honey and lemon for me. Just what a sore throat needs! We took advantage of the pool and the hammam (the steam room was amazing and everything was spotless!) and felt so lucky to have both within our hotel. Best of all we got upgraded part way through our stay. Thank you Villa Makassar for spoiling us! You're our hands down recommendation for Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: ivy C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful hidden gem hotel with fantastic friendly staff
Review_Text: I stayed at Villa Makkasar with a friend of mine during August. And I would like to say the staffs were absolutely fantastic and friendly. There is not one bad thing I can say about the hotel.    It was so calm and peaceful and if you would like a hideaway from the hustle and bustle this is definitely the place for you. We literally had the terrace to ourselves to freely absorb the sun.    It is still very convenient to get around to places and staffs have always been helpful to arrange taxi on our behalf and provided restaurants and activities recommendations.    Inside the hotel beautiful decor and Art Deco furnitures are found everywhere. Intricate details of our room has really impressed us. If you are a fan of Art Deco interiors be prepare to be taken back of how beautiful everything really is inside the hotel!!    We have also tried the Hammam spa inside the hotel and it was just so relaxing and guest can enjoy the access with privacy which is what I love about the spa.    Overall I would highly recommend this hotel and I would personally stay there again next time I'm in Marakkesh !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Julie C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Customer service at Villa Makassar is exceptional with every member of the staff team going out of their way to engage with guests to ensure their stay is great. They are warm friendly courteous and always smiling; nothing is ever too much.    The premises are beautifully decorated clean comfortable and inviting thereby creating a relaxing stay. Traditional food is well presented and sumptuous.    Personalised tours can be provided to give you an insight into the local area whilst providing history & culture and we found this excellent. In addition the team accommodated a personal request to provide an evening tour.    The spa adds another dimension making the holiday a relaxing break.    Anyone staying here will not be disappointed and if we ever return to Marrakech we wouldn't think twice about where to stay.    Thanks to all the staff at Villa Makassar for making our holiday so great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good hotel in a great location
Review_Text: Villa Makassar is something you wouldn't give a second look at if you just saw the exterior but the interior is top class with all that you can ask from a good hotel. The rooms and stay are fine. It is very close to some of the major tourist attractions. My only grouse is that they were giving exorbitant rates for days trips and we had to rely on an external transporter who gave trips at half the price. Otherwise the stay was well worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Allison M wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: We are not long back from a brilliant one week honeymoon at Villa Makassar. We were very impressed with the hotel. We have stayed in many 5 star rated hotels however none as good as this - this truelly is a 5 star hotel. The staff were superb nothing was a hassle and they were all so very helpful and friendly. Our room was incredible as were all the public areas. We were very impressed with the food - without a doubt some of the best food we have ever had.  We enjoyed some treatments in the hotel spa - again the staff were brilliant and we really enjoyed having a relaxing day.  All in all a wonderful stay at an excellent luxury boutique hotel. Should we ever return to Marrakech this would be our first choice of hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: M J wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: My Daughter and I took a trip to recouperate relax and enjoy a few days away from the normal Moroccan retreats.    The pictures do not do this luxurious fabulous oasis in the hub of the medina justice as it's is simple amazing.  So much care time and effort has been put into its inner core structure customer care/experience that it's a rarety these days! The uniquness of this cannot be simplifyed the art deco is out of this world and the owner and staff were on hand to cater for our every need. My love and thanks to you all !    Our room was upgraded part way through our stay at no extra cost. Our complex dietary requirements were catered for daily and amazingly so. Thank you again.  We took the guided tour to Essaouira and this was also fantastic.    I cant wait until I can't wait to visit again as this felt like we were staying with family as were treated like royalty throughout it was hard to drag ourselves back to reality!  The spa pool and facilities are immaculate and the villa's cleanliness is second to none.  The hamman and scrub was so needed and so well done loved every minute of it    A must for anyone seeking solitude luxury and total pampering    Thank you Villa Makassar  You have achieved what has become the impossible in this fast paced mass hotel holiday market! An oasis in the desert !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Belisario M wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: Awsome boutique hotel. Excellent art deco room.
Review_Text: Stayed for 2 night in August 2015. The hotel is very nice clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The breakfast it very good and complete. The hotel is in a great location it's walking distance to the touristic spots. Its worth trying it out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kati L wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: One of the kind Art Deco style luxury villa!
Review_Text: In the middle of the Marrakech hassle and crazyness u can find such a blissful and luxury place as it is Villa Makassar - the super-friendly desinger and owner of the place has really thought about every little detail in this villa:) More than a comfortable place with a good location - walking distance to the main attractions it is like an eye opening and amazing tour around the world with its unique art pieces and details brought from different places. Loved it!  As well as the delicious food and great service in the restaurant Le Makassar - definitely worth trying it out.

Review_Date: Hannah W wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: We've recently come back from a fantastic stay at the Villa Makassar from the second we arrived to our departure we were looked after and enjoyed every moment. The hotel is beautiful it's clean and the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is in a great location it's walking distance to all the tourist spots and it's also a great retreat from a busy day out in the Medina. The hotel organised an amazing trip to the Atlas mountains definitely worth a visit. If you have booked to go to this hotel you will not be disappointed! It's fabulous!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Awesome stay at the Art Deco style Riad!
Review_Text: We stayed a week in October 2014 in this really fancy Art Deco Riad in the heart of the Kasba.  Although the rooms are rather dark we really liked all the tiny details which make this Riad itself a piece of art.  All staff were super friendly and did an awesome job to make us feel comfortable; they helped us a lot organizing day-trips and Hamam package (you definitely should also try the Hamam directly at the Riad it's wounderful and also here the staff is great!).  The breakfast changed every day and included always fresh cooked traditional Marrocan delights.  We enjoyed the stay a lot!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in! Beautiful calm oasis with the most friendly and helpful staff. The only small tiny grumble would be we would have liked a couple of sun loungers by the pool. Other than that it fabulous from start to finish!

In between a particularly stressful set of business meetings I needed a place to unwind and do nothing at all. Getting to Marrakech from Europe was a snap. And the V.M. fit the bill. I took the Makassar suite with its splendid set of Art Deco furniture decoration and an over-the-top mosaic bath tub. I have a very large Art Deco half-round desk in Makassar ebony so I really enjoyed he furniture and its exquisite detail. The restaurant for lunch and dinner was blissfully quiet and the offerings were delicious and fabulously presented. Fouad and the entire staff were professional and personable at the same time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Stayed for the weekend with one of my friends who was a bit apprehensive about a trip to Moroc now because of this Riad she can't wait to return. Staff were fantastic breakfast served on the roof terrace had a surprise every morning ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was excellent. Decor is amazing pool area awesome room luxurious. Hope you get my drift treat yourself and stay at Villa Makassar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Giulia G wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: We stayed as a couple for 10 nights and we really enjoyed it: villa makassar is an amazing place! Located at the heart of the medina but just 10 mins away walking from the new town (where most clubs cocktail bars and restaurants are);  Clean and well-mantained with a nice interior design (the rooms are very nice they also upgraded us to a suite which was perfect);  Amazing restaurant (we had the best prawn tajine ever here);  It has a spacious balcony to relax and get tanned a pretty big swimming pool (definitely bigger than in other riads) and an amazing spa with a hammam and a jacuzzi (they offered us free access to those on the first day of our stay);  Very nice tours organized (we highly reccomend the one to Essaouira: the driver was very nice and spoke perfect english also showing us argan trees and factories on the way to our final destination);  The staff is simply amazing: they make you feel like you're part of a family and are always extremely helpful. Thanks to the villa makassar staff for an amazing experience in marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic stay I this beautiful hotel
Review_Text: Nothing but good things to say about this place. We would certainly go back and stay here.    On arrival we were greater with a warm welcome mint tea and sweet cakes. We're were upgraded to the top room. It was amazing!    The attention to detail in the interiors was very good and what drew us to the hotel in the first place. We were not disappointed and kept discovering features.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ruth L wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: Hidden within the crazy streets of Marrakech is this tranquil and beautiful hotel. From the moment we arrived everything we could have wanted or needed was catered for. The hotel looks beautiful and staff are extremely friendly and attentive. The facilities are fantastic and the trip they arranged for us was amazing. Couldn't have asked for more in anyway. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful and calming riad with Exceptional service
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights in June. From the moment we arrived the staff were exceptional making you feel at home giving you recommendations and more than happy to make reservations for you and always with a smile. The riad itself is so calm and beautiful despite being only a short 10/15 minute walk from the main square and set in amidst the winding streets of the medina. The bedroom was lovely - we managed to get upgraded since it was my partner's birthday and the communal areas of the hotel were perfect for relaxing after a day in the souks. We spent most evenings before dinner up on the roof terrace enjoying some late afternoon sun! Would definitely recommend staying here for those travelling to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is probably one of the nicest you will have the opportunity to ever stay in. The location is perfect - easy walking distance to everything and I felt secure here every night. We stayed for 3 nights and really appreciate the hospitality demonstrated. I had a minor issue on the final night there and the owner resolved it in an exceedingly fair manner. At night when I came in I would chat about some of my experiences with the guy at the desk (can't remember his name - great guy with a beard) and he would give me ideas on what to do next. I really could not have asked for more from the staff.    Spend some quality time on the rooftop terrace. Fantastic.    Although this Riad is where you should stay I wouldn't recommend it for the hammam (it was alright - not fantastic - I wanted the black soap used and she didn't - there are others that are closer and cheaper). Also - a hammam should be a social experience and this was really really private so perhaps only if you are really shy.    Regarding the restaurant - first night we stayed here the food was fantastic. The last night there the food was mediocre and expensive compared to what is in town. Spend the time and go look for food down the side streets - get recommendations from bearded front desk guy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for two nights as part of an Expedia package and had a fantastic time.The hotel is gorgeous a real oasis of calm only a few minutes walk from the busiest parts of the old city. Lovely Art Deco styling great rooms and excellent service. Bar breakfast and spa were all fantastic too. we can't recommend this place highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Evelien H wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful and tranquil riad with outstanding service
Review_Text: My partner and I were lucky enough to stay in the Grand Luxury Suite at Villa Makassar for 4 nights in May. We were made to feel very welcome from the moment we arrived and throughout our stay. Our suite was absolutely beautiful and a very calm serene place to come back after a busy day's sightseeing. You simply wouldn't know that you were in the middle of a bustling  noisy city. There were plenty of other areas to relax in too including a chill out room with a fireplace a roof terrace and a spa.  We ate 3 main meals in the hotel during our stay and very much enjoyed both Morrocan and International food. There was also a good selection of wines. There was a choice of eating in the dining area or on the roof terrace. Both were very pleasant experiences and was accompanied by one of the staff playing guitar. Breakfast was also delicious with local pastries orange juice fresh yogurt and fruits and a choice of eggs. The great thing was that you could ask for breakfast at any time of the day and wherever you wanted to eat it!  We also indulged in a hamman which was excellent and we would have liked to have used the enormous jacuzzi but we ran out of time.  The thing that really stood out for us at this riad was the impeccable service. Everyone was so lovely and courteous but without being overbearing. Nothing was too much trouble and we were always received with a smile.The owners of the riad took a genuine interest in making sure that we were happy and well looked after.  I would recommend this place to anyone who asked me for advice on a place to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best Riad I know in Marrakech
Review_Text: It's a perfect place in the medina where the Art Deco style will suprise you. The villa is an amaizing place with a very good team taking care of you in a kindly mood. The food is nice also and your breakfirst is a new creation each day based on fresh goods. The swiming pool is a good place to take a breath.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ty M wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Had the opporutnity to stay at Villa Makassar with
Review_Text: We celebrated my mom's 70th birthday in Marrakech. We had a wonderful time including our stay at Villa Makassar. The manager Juliette and her team were awesome. Even before we arrived no email or question was too complicated or too small for Juliette to respond to. She helped us organize 4 rooms and a host of other details. Once there she and her team helped with transportation restaurant recommendations and even finding a credit card left at a restaurant. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are large and comfortable and her team helped with every request from a late night bottle of champagne on the roof to special breakfast requests. They also always served us complimentary nibbles when we had cocktails and all the food was delicious. I highly recommend Villa Makassar for oyur stay in Marrekech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: First time visit - brilliant service, amazing Riad
Review_Text: We stayed at Villa Makassar for 2 nights in May. The Riad has been designed beautifully very clean and has everything you need (room service iron transport etc).    The place has a real welcoming and professional feel to it and the hospitality is first class. this is a perfect hideaway for couples and just a 15 minute walk to the main square markets palace(s) etc. also just a 10 minute drive from the airport    We received a 5 star service everyone and everything about Villa Makassar is great. This exceptional service has prompted me (after 8 holidays) to write my first review.    I mean they were so great they even gave us a complimentary room upgrade!! All of the rooms are high quality and the design throughout Villa Makassar is beautiful.    Staff and the owner make an effort to meet you and ensure your personal needs and requirements are met at all times.    It's a gem tucked away in a great location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helen G wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Four girls on a short break of two nights in this beautifully appointed hotel with great attention to detail including roses and a welcoming mint tea and pastries on arrival.The staff were incredibly helpful and obliging.Superb location.We felt like we were the only ones there as there are many places to hang out.The rooftop bar and sun terrace are fantastic to chill out after a hot afternoon in the souks.Taxis were arranged quickly and efficiently when required.I would highly recommend this hotel.There was nothing we could fault.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Alison B wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Had a wonderful stay. It's small & personal with very kind helpful staff. Large room with balcony overlooking courtyard. Brilliant location - close enough to walk everywhere but away from the bustle. We went to Atlas Mountains organised by hotel with an excellent guide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just a lovely place to stay in a manic city. From the minute you walk in the staff are wonderful and the Riad is beautiful calm stylish and very clean. We visited the renown 5 star hotel The Mamounia for the day and experienced very rude staff and could not wait to return to Villa Makassar. Thank you for making our stay wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This hotel is well located clean and nicely appointed. The service level is OUTSTANDING. Wonderful friendly staff make it a true gem. Breakfast is great and enjoyed dinner as well. Spa was ok but there are better ones in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jonathan r wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: It really is an oasis in the city
Review_Text: We stayed for a 3 day break to celebrate a special wedding anniversary and birthday. From arrival to the time we left we were really well looked after by all the staff. Arrived late afternoon and were picked up from the airport (arranged before we arrived) and taken into the centre of the city and a door in the wall. Once you get through the door you are transformed into an art deco world of luxury style and comfort.    The whole place was beautifully finished and very stylish. With a lovely roof garden and external courtyards. Our room was cool and beautifully furnished with a lovely ensuite shower room. They had even decorated the room with roses to welcome us.    We ate in the restaurant on the first night and enjoyed a beautifully presented meal which was extremely tasty and well cooked.    We had a hot few days and tried to make use of the pool which was extremely cold and in shade for most of the day. The roof terrace though provided an oasis of tropical heat and calm with showers to cool us off and attentive bar staff when needed.    Great breakfasts which were different on each day and could be taken wherever you wanted it.    On our last day we had the wellness package and massage in the Hammam which was indulgent and really well done. Nearly 2 hours of pampering which helped to further relax us from the hectic life outside the walls of this superb hotel.    would highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marina T wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a great hotel I would recommend to anyone going to Marrakech. The interior is stunning and beautifully furnished around the two inner courtyards. The room was good modern and very clean. The staff are delightful always very helpful and nothing was too much trouble including breakfast on the roof terrace which is very elegantly furnished with day beds and plenty of shade. The hammam was also a great experience and I just wish we had had more time to use the spa. Villa Makassar is in a quiet street but only 10 - 15 mins walk from the souk so a really great location and it was always such a delight to return to the hotel for a bit of r and r at the end of the afternoon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Beautiful villa offering the best of both worlds - very stylish and clean minimalist décor whilst ideally placed in the heart of the historical Kasbah. Loved sipping cool drinks ion the roof terrace
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When my wife and I stayed at Villa Makassar for a short Easter break we felt very well looked after throughout. The room was well designed and spacious food at breakfast and dinner in the evening was both well presented and of good quality. The well being massage treatment is worth booking in advance as we did given that the whole experience was private and lasted for well over two hours; my skin still feels the benefit a fortnight later! Best of all the staff are all welcoming helpful and gave us the feeling that we really mattered - for that alone we were very grateful. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The riad was like an oasis in the chaos of Marrakesh. It is in the Kasbah and the Medina and thus very close to most attractions in the city. The staff could not have done any more for us and I can thoroughly recommmend the Hamman and spa.  The only downside I had with the riad was as aging travellers the decor in our room and the foyer was very dark and we found it difficult to see with the limited lighting in the foyer. The restaurant was brilliant - all meals and the setting were first rate.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jade P wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Villa Makassar. From the friendly staff to the beautiful surroundings... it was a perfect base to explore Marrakech.    We received a very warm welcome (both from our driver at the airport and from the staff at Villa Makassar). On arrival at the Riad we were offered Moroccan tea and pastries which we had in one of the lovely reading rooms / lounge areas. Whilst we had our tea and pastries our bags were taken to our room. Salma (who was exceptionally helpful) gave us a tour of the hotel and showed us to our room (one of the junior suites)which was very comfortable.    We had breakfast on the terrace every morning which was beautiful and we had an evening meal which was also lovely.    Staff in the spa were very friendly and the spa itself was very relaxing.    Overall the atmosphere at Villa Makassar is tranquil and relaxing and you are encouraged to treat it as if it is your home. I would definitely stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad is truly a gem in Medina and definitely worth the experience. I stayed here in March 2015. The staff are professional friendly and welcoming thank you to Noura Jawad Yousef and all that work there for letting us be a part of the Makassar family. The Jacuzzi and Hammam when booked are solely for your own use which is a treat after wandering the busy streets of Marakkech. The courtyard is stunning as is the roof terrace. Location is ideal within walking distance from the major sites. I shall definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Carina L wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Fantastic riad in Marrakech old medina. Art deco at it best! The Owner is a true fantast and has created a warm friendly and very trendy art deco riad. He have not saved anything. Everything from the handels on the door to furnitures and details is 100% art deco. Rooms are big with everything you need for a nice stay. I went to the New spa in the basement and got the best massage ever. The riad has a nice restaurant as well good food for resonable prices. It is a little bit difficult for taxis to come close to the hotel due to small narrow road.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Simon N wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Not a 5 star hotel by any of the myriad of rating systems but certainly a 5 star experience. From the calm interior courtyard individually designed bedrooms to the open roof terrace and traditional hammam....all together a total treat to the discerning traveler.  All the staff are a delight and seem genuinely pleased to help you no matter what your query or desire. Lovely food all round breakfast can be taken anywhere and comprises local pastries fruit and conventional eggs. We didn't have lunch but the 3 course plat du jour looked fab the evening meals we had were beautifully cooked and extremely reasonable.  Clean rooms nicely proportioned bathrooms and the plethora of tasteful art deco adorning the hotel's interior make this a really special place to stay. I can't think that we would have been happier anywhere else and I certainly wouldn't go anywhere else in Marrakesh now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul T wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a small luxury Art Deco boutique style hotel / Riad with only 10 rooms. The rooms vary in design light source bath / shower option and size. Some rooms allow ample storage space. Each room is unique stylish and luxurious. Fouad the owner is passionate about his Art Deco collections and designs.    On arrival we were greeted by Noura who is warm welcoming and very approachable. Fouad then personally showed us around; again very personable as are all the staff from front reception (Noura Kaoutar and Ismael) to the waiters chefs and spa ladies. The Hammam spa treatment is a must.    Villa Makassar's recommended tour guide Nouredine (Nour) is great. Definitely worth travelling with him to see the primitive Berber Village and Atlas Mountains.    Special thanks to Rabi Mohamed and Youssef who go out of their way to cater for particular individual needs; they are truly missed. All the staff are accommodating including those behind the scene.    We enjoyed listening to Ismael who plays the guitar and sings during evening meals. Most of the meals were exquisite and varied. The dining area is comfortable and intimate although you can eat wherever you like and whatever time you like including breakfast! A real homely feel throughout.    Villa Makassar is an oasis of calm tucked away from the busy souks yet close enough to walk to most of the authentic attractions in the old town. Other attractions are just a short taxi ride away. Local shops for any essentials are also on the doorstep.    We would certainly recommend Villa Makassar to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superb hidden gem of a hotel
Review_Text: I stayed here for a couple of days for my wifes birthday treat. The hotel (only 10 rooms) is simply superb. A welcoming pot of Moroccan tea greeted us upon arrival. The staff are attentive and ever helpful and the decor is lovely. The hotel even presented my wife with a cake on her birthday - lovely touch. This is a peaceful retreat from the bustling streets of Morocco but only a 15 minute walk to the centre of the Madena. The restaurant is very nice the food delicious and staff helpful. The Spa is a real treat also and I highly recommend the body scrub and massage. Probably the best review I have ever written - and I have written a few bad ones over the years. This time a real pleasure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kathryn J wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: An Oasis in the crazy Medina
Review_Text: When our car arrived at the hotel I though I had mad a big mistake as the area is busy but on entering the Riad we were met with a calm relaxing atmosphere. We were ushered into the sitting room and given tea and pastries after filling in some paper work we were shown round by the owner who is obviously very proud of this place. The deco was superb everything came together. We were shown to our suite Villa Radchenko very well apointed  huge shower very spacious the only fault we had was the bedit was a little on the hard side which we are not used to but apart from that everything was very comfortabe.    The common areas are very well decorated and the music playing really sets the mood.    We ate the first night in the restaurant and the food was suberb very well presented and very tasty the waiter was very attentve and courtious and the local Morrocan wine was excellent. Breakfast the next morning was also very good beautiful pastries and eggs coffee was also very good fresh squeezed orange juice absolutely delicious.    Check out was easy and we were given a free transfer back to the airport.    We didn't use any of the spa facilities but it looked amazing.    Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff here they all made us feel very welcome we were given a pair of lovely slippers each which was a nice touch.    I would definitely recommend this place to anyone going to Marrakech and I would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A nice hotel in a quiet backwater of Marrakech
Review_Text: We hadn't been to Marrakech and had always wanted to go and recently booked a trip through Secret escapes to Villa Makassar. The hotel frontage was a door through a wall in Old Town which was perturbing to begin with but became one of its charms. In the centre of things this hotel is not but it's only a 15 minute walk to the main square and very close to the palaces and mosques for those more interested in the historic monuments. It is a bit of a trek to new town and the more modern hotels bars and clubs. this is not a hotel for anyone wanting to "party".    However as a quiet hotel this place is fantastic. The staff were amazing so friendly and welcoming. The Hammam was great and the prices for food and drink were more reasonable than some of the more renowned hotels. It is decorated in art deco style but with a Moroccan theme. It is a small and quiet hotel but with good sized rooms and interesting decor. Biggest downer for us was that our room didn't have a shower but the bath was spectacular.    This hotel would have been a 5 if it had been better located but was otherwise to be recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were there just before NY eve. Wonderful art-deco hotel located at 10 minutes easy walk from the main Marrakech place. Our suite was just amazing with a wonderful art-deco style. Our Christmas diner was not bad but not amazing but not the most important. I could also recommend you the SPA there and massage with black soap just perfect!  Roof terrace for the breakfasts very good too..  Don't hesitate if you want to discover the city here is a good place to begin...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment that we were picked up from the airport (arranged by Villa Makassar) to going home nothing was to much trouble. When we arrived at Villa Makassar we were met by the owner and shown around the hotel by him he explained where he had picked up the many beautiful pieces of furniture and accessories from he was so proud of his hotel and as well he should be it was a stunning place. The hotel also sorted out our trip to the Atlas Mountains which were spectactular and I was so glad I had packed trainers as it was a little hair raising in places but our wonderful guide helped me and told me where to place my feet! I had a hammam massage that evening in the spa and the lady that did it was lovely  I have never had one before so did not know what to expect but it was thoughly relaxing after our trek up the mountains!.  The breakfast was great and different every day.  I must say all the staff were wonderful and very helpful and if I ever did return to Marrakech I would definately stay at Villa Makassar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Oliver Southgate wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Excellent service on the whole. Lovely hotel. We didn't get a chance to try the spa facilities as we were on a packed sight seeing schedule but we were shown around by the hotel manager who was very helpful. The roof garden is a nice pace to relax n the sunshine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I have never been to Marrakech before to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary we decided after rave reviews from friends to go. I'm so pleased we choose Villa Makassar the Art Deco theme and laid back music is a compete contrast to the hustle and bustle of the city to come back to serene and opulent surroundings is amazing. The staff are very friendly however not in your face and seem to appear from know where when you want something. We were lucky enough to have excellent weather and spent time on the roof terrace sipping a glass of wine or two! The Valentines dinner like all the food we had was fabulous along with unexpected entertainment. I would recommend using the spa. we had a hour massage which after all the walking you do is most welcome. We would defiantly go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael H wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: On our first trip to Marrakech we were very lucky to choose Villa Makassar. Situated about 10-15 mins walk from the famous Jemaa el Fna at the south end of the Kasbah district near the old royal palace the riad is an Art Deco project fusing classic Moroccan opulence and the golden age of jazz. The surroundings are very attractive and the rooms comfortable but what really distinguishes the riad is the warmth and kindness of the staff. The restaurant is quite expensive for Marrakech but the quality of the food is excellent - we didn't eat better anywhere else in the city during our trip. Also worth noting is an attractive roof garden with loungers and a bar... a nice oasis to read or take a break from the bustling street life. Our trip was a celbration for a major birthday and we were very kindly upgraded. Our thanks to the owner and staff and definitely recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a lovely weekend in Marrakech where we stayed at the beautiful Villa Makassar. This gorgeous Riad is in a perfect location for exploring just 10 mins walk from "the big square" (you will hear this phrase a lot when you visit Marrakech!).  From the moment we arrived the staff were so friendly and attentive. Christian the amazing concierge will take all day long to welcome you and show you around the facilities. It really is a recurring feature of everyone you will meet in Marrakech - friendly warm helpful.  This Riad has everything - a beautiful spa downstairs (you MUST try the hammam so beautiful) you can eat anywhere anytime you like and the food is outstanding a gorgeous rooftop terrace for just relaxing in the sunshine.  The reception staff are more than happy to help you with excursions or tours. They organised a guided walking tour for us and it was so worth it because our guide showed us a really authentic side to Marrakech that we might not have otherwise discovered on our own.  Our room was spotless and the bed was super comfortable. each room is individually decorated with unique authentic 1920s décor. There are only 10 rooms in this Riad so it never feels crowded or busy. It is so peaceful and relaxing.  I cant wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan K wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Having just returned from a 5 night visit to Marrakesh I felt duty bound to log into Tripadvisor and write a review of Villa Makassar.    In short this was the finest hotel I have ever visited. The decor and opulence of the Hotel can be seen from the photographs but what really sets it apart is the staff and the understated discrete way in which the whole Hotel is operated. Service throughout was exemplary.    One small example being the offer of a suite on our day of leaving to shower before the evening flights this was unexpected and unnecessary but very welcome and an indication of the care and approach taken by the Hotel to guests.    A wonderful experience in a unique and brilliant Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the minute you enter the door off the street in the kasbah you are in a beautiful oasis of calm indulgent five star luxury. We couldn't have picked a more perfect place to stay - from the beautiful warm welcome with Moroccan tea and pastries the stunning Art Deco styling courtyard with spa music and fountain outdoor pool area and terrace rooftop bar and sun loungers 'anytime anywhere' breakfast fabulous hammam massage and jacuzzi romantic Moroccan meals with wonderful guitarist and singing five star suite with indulgent bedding and bathroom.... The experience was such that we felt we were on our honeymoon and could truly unwind relax and indulge yet just 15 mins walk from the main square! We can't recommend it highly enough and truly the hardest place and people to leave!! Thank you so much 😊 xx

Review_Date: neil h wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Booked at an adjacent hotel through BA Holidays all written confirmation received we were dismayed and cross to learn they had no record of our booking and were full for the night.  However they did find a room here at the Villa Makassar where the staff were absolutely brilliant and couldn't do enough for us. They gave us a huge suite.    Thank you so much for turning a disaster on our short break into something special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Geoff S wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: An excellent base to explore the city from
Review_Text: We stayed a total of three nights at Villa Makassar and found it to be very well placed to explore the city on foot - its about a 10-15 minute walk to the main square (Jemaa el Fna) and the souks.    The hammam in the spa in the basement of the Riad was fantastic - a completely new experience and to be recommended without question. The spa staff were fantastic - the massage I had fixed my long-time damaged shoulder completely. Coming back to the Riad after a long day walking around the city an hour in the massive Jacuzzi washed away sore feet and tired muscles.    We only ate dinner once in the Riad but the quality was great - you will be hard pressed to find alcohol anywhere in Marrakech in the variety and quantity we see in Western Europe but Villa Makassar had a good range of wine and beer.    The Riad is decorated in an art deco style and was very clean and well maintained - our room was spotless.    The staff in the Riad were very warm friendly and helpful - booking us a tour into the Atlas Mountains on our last day which was amazing.    Overall - highly recommended and I'd certainly stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When I was booking accommodation in Marrakech I was considering lots of different places: hotels roads everything. I very nearly booked the Sofitel as it was a safe choice however I was interested to see something more authentic for my experience in Morocco ( no disrespect to the Sofitel intended). I am SO glad that I did. Villa Marrakech is the perfect Moroccan experience for those who want to stay in Marrakech. Here's why:    Firstly the villa is located in the Kasbah area and as others have said is a short walk to the main sights in Marrakech (particularly the Badii Palace and Saadian Tombs which are very close by) but also for the main square and Koutoubia Mosque. It is a safe area and the streets are buzzing with life at all times of day. I was travelling with a female friend and neither of us felt unsafe at any time and trust me we did not blend in at all - she has bright red hair I have blonde hair.    Secondly the villa itself is a true oasis from the activity in the streets and as soon as you enter you feel a great sense of calm and relaxation. The villa is designed with original Art Deco furniture and this really sets it apart from many other villas. The villa is stylish and authentic and the orange blossom fragrance oil that burns is wonderful. The rooms are a good size and our bathroom was incredibly large! Again the rooms carry on the Art Deco style and are very tasteful.    Lastly the service is perfect - everyone that we met at the hotel was charming polite and would do anything they could to serve you. Breakfast is included and was delicious we particularly loved the freshly squeezed orange juice and the Moroccan pastries. We also ate lunch and dinner in the hotel at least once during our stay and again were thrilled with the quality of the food and the service. The terrace area was the perfect place to dine for lunch (we did this twice!) and relax.    Overall I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this hotel for people who want to experience authentic Moroccan service and accommodation. Give the bland four star chain hotels a miss and stay at the Villa Makassar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Me and my family stayed at Villa Makassar during the final part of our tour in Morocco. This Riad is located inside the medina and is within a walking distance from major attractions in Marrakech. From the moment that you arrive till the moment that you check out the staff will do anything that is possible to make your stay absolutely perfect. Every member of the staff seems to be ready to satisfy all your needs. This is the great thing about staying here: you will fell at home. Rates included breakfast which was delicious and options changed everyday. Rooms had very good size but were a little bit dark. It would be great if the lightning of the rooms were more powerful. Other downsize is that the wi-fi didn´t work properly in the room located on the first floor. There is also a spa which is wonderful with a beautiful hamman and offers many therapies and massages. Overall we had a great time and would consider staying there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We visited for 5 days over new year and had an amazing stay here.    Service was exceptional and really personal something I couldn't have predicted. The manager was great but all the waiting staff were first class especially the very kind chap that serves breakfast.    Our room was nice big and comfortable but a few points to note  1. Bath with a shower head and makes showering pretty hard and the bath is huge so takes a long time to fill.  2. The toilet seat in our bathroom was broken. We should have said something as it prob would have been fixed.  3. The air con smelt a bit funky  4. Due to the nature of the hotel building its not easy to lie in bed beyond 10am without being woken by noise. It wasn't terrible but you should be aware    Food was great too.    I'd definitely stay here again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here in October and my God is this place incredible! Every detail and piece of furniture has a story and the result is fantastic. Rooms are huge and absolutely beautiful.  Its a 15 minute walk to the main square and the ca El cafe is at the bottom of the street for great local artists and entertainment.  An oasis of tranquility in one of the maddest cities on earth.  Seriously.... Don't stay anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sally A wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: A Peaceful Sanctuary in The Chaotic Medina
Review_Text: The service is outstanding and intimate. We felt like guests at a home-nothing like a hotel. The manager greeted us at check in with Moroccan tea and pastries. He handed us maps and explained how we could explore the local attractions. All the receptionists went out of their way to be helpful like handing us umbrellas on our way out when it was raining. Kouter was especially helpful and it's thanks to her restaurant recommendation that we had the most unforgettable dinner on our trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you plan a stay in Marrakech you will not be disappointed with a stay at Villa Makassar.    From the moment of arrival - warm and personal - through every step across the 4 days my wife and I spent here we only have the highest praise.    Breakfast each day was localised and authentic. Dinner on 2 nights was delicious and the service was great. Drinks on the rooftop were enjoyable. Guides arranged through the staff for a half day walking tour a day trip to the Atlas Mountains and a hand day camel ride were all high quality.    I should also mention the wonderful stylings and location of the riad - this is a terrific base for a Marrakech visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sanaa M wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: This was by far the best raid I have ever stayed in. Not only is it beautifully decorated to first class standard but you receive first class service. Upon arrival both me and my mother received a great and warm welcome and instantly felt at home. We were greeted by Koather and Quentin who immediately gave us information about Marrakesh what to do best places to eat a map to get about. All questions that had been running through my mind. Later we met Quentin’s lovely wife who was equally as helpful and always there with a smile. I personally believe that all the staff made my holiday one to remember and i will defiantly be coming back. If i could give this more than five stars i would! I recommend this place to everyone. Simply fabulous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My first visit to Marrakech was made particularly memorable by the warm welcome and attentive staff throughout this hotel. The hotel has an Art Deco feel and the court yard is beautiful. Breakfast is served in a lovely dining room and the hotel are extremely flexible when you can eat. Fresh orange with home made breads and Moroccan delicacies are also superb. This is a place to unwind and kick back; where you are made to feel welcome and where nothing is a problem. Book a Hammam in the Spa with a full body massage and enjoy the jacuzzi with some mint tea served to you as you chill out from a days exploration around the city. I would definitely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was going to give 4 stars but ill give credit to perfect service and situations where personnel has no power to help:)  Hotel is very nicely decorated boutique style very quiet and peaceful. Manager and reception was always helpful and tried to accommodate all the time.  The only downside are those Marrocan style doors that need to be insulated in some way as soundproofing is really bad. Kitchen noise and plates banging since 8am are not most relaxing thing on holls. Also due to courtyard roof being covered due to adverse weather all the smell from kitchen went into the rooms since early. Bed mattresses are too hard for myself but maybe heathy option to others:) i felt broken every morning.  Reception is always helpful with bookings at restaurants and taxis. One big downfall that Visa cards were not accepted on departure and quite stressful when flight departing in couple hours.  Overall i wouldnt mind to come back or recommend as it is really nice place for Marroco .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place, great service and feeling of home
Review_Text: Great place great service and feeling of home!  I was welcomed by name by Kaoutar and Quentin and felt at ease straight away. The hotel layout was superb. The ambience electrifying and the location could not be matched as it was right in the medina in Marrakech. Food and service left nothing to be desired. Absolutely nothing was too much trouble. I thoroughly recommend this hotel and the city of Marrakech as a must see destination. Small boutique hotel but with amazing area and amenities such as spa and top roof deck that could hold a lot of people. Really enjoyed it and I will return with a touring party next time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Me and my boyfriend only stayed at this riad for one night but had a great time and would stay here again if revisiting Marrakesh. We booked one of the small rooms a couple of months ahead and got a nice price remembering that it is a fancy place.    While staying at Makassar we booked a treatement at the hammam and had a misunderstanding regarding the booking which were taken care of great by the hotel staff when we arrived. We can really recommend you to book a traditional hammam treatment. We also ate at the hotel and found the food excellent (you can for example have a tagine with seafood which we didn't find at any other restaurants during our Marrakesh-visit).    Generally we were impressed by the art deco-collections and the carefully prepared design of the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we booked VM for our second wedding anniversary which from reviews seemed to be a good choice. Upon arriving at Menara Airport we were faced by a wall of hotel drivers but we located ours and wove our way into what can only be described as a truly manic city; VM is located down a very narrow side street in the Kasbah; initial signs were a little disconcerting until we came through from the dusty street into the lobby which was beautiful. We were greeted warmly by Quentin the new manager and all things VM and Marrakech were calmly explained to us including a tour of the entire property top to bottom (while we were served with but of course mint tea and Moroccan pastries).    The hotel itself is small ( only 10 rooms) but has a v large roof terrace external plunge pool ( unheated) and internal pool ( heated) with spa facilities and a pretty good restaurant. Each day after the madness of the outside world the hotel and staff provided an excellent feeling of sanctuary.    We opted for the Grand Deluxe Suite Double which we could only describe as magnificent with its own terrace and windows into one of the central courtyards; fitted out with Art Deco furniture and art rescued from the La Mammounia refit auction years previous this worked very well; everything worked and fitted.    Breakfast each day was at whatever time suited you wherever you wanted it. Excellent service at all times: food was varied and of good quality ( breakfast was included). Oddly only once did we seem to be served orange juice from a carton ( all other days it was evidently freshly squeezed).    We regularly retired to the roof terrace in the late afternoons after hard days in the city; bar service was excellent. We were lucky in that being there in low season we largely had the place ( and staff) to ourselves - this was perfect for us - others may prefer lots of hustle and bustle but to be fair there's plenty once you venture outside.    We had supper in the dining room one evening which again was to a good standard: choice of European and Moroccan fare was good. We were treated to an impromptu performance by one of the reception staff who was an excellent musician - quite a performer. Wine list was fine though to be fair wine lists across restaurants in Marrakech were generally pretty limited which is probably one of those things.    Location after initially appearing odd in fact proved to be excellent ( walked around Gueliz and Hivernage; the more modern section of the city where the larger chain hotels are and were delighted that the Kasbah / Medina areas were so much more charming and lively.) hotel was probably only a 15 minute walk from Jemma al Fna Square; be warned the streets here are narrow and to the unwary treacherous but after a couple of trips up and down you get used to mopeds cars trucks bicycles and people all competing to use the same restricted space - this is a feature of Marrakech!).    Quentin and his staff ( all who generally had a good grasp of a combination of English and French so could always be understood) worked hard to please all guests and were extremely affable and welcoming: we booked a number of trips including medina guide and atlas mountain trip through reception: good recommendations and worth checking their contacts as a starting point ( and good value).    Overall we were extremely impressed with the hotel itself location services and lovely friendly staff. However a couple of very minor things were worthy of note which could be looked at improving ( none of which really affected our stay to be fair) (i) wifi needs to be more consistent ( while I accept this is probably a Morocco- wide issue it should be possible to sort I would have thought) (ii) in the suite's bathroom there was a huge square bath with handheld shower - we tried having a bath but after 2 hours of trying to fill it it was only perhaps 6 inches deep ( and couldn't retain heat) while the shower head was indeed fine with decent water pressure and temperature it really needs a bracket on the wall to be able to shower properly - not since being a student have I had to shower like this and (aesthetics aside) wouldn't have expected to do this in an otherwise well equipped and effective establishment of this nature (iii) if you're going to have a nespresso coffee machine in the room provide daily fresh milk (iv) while the tv wasn't terribly important if you're going to offer it with cable channels it's not really great to only have one english language channel ( CNN at that) - try to get a wider set of channels ( would have thought it wasn't too difficult to get BBC news for example?)    In summary a gem of an establishment. Would thoroughly recommend for a trip to Marrakech and would be keen to revisit in the future - well run and extremely friendly hotel all in all. Well done!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I adored this property.    Set in the south of the Medina it was well located for many sites and only a short walk away from the square and souks.    It was easy to find which is always a plus in Morocco and walking into the entrance hall was incredible. I felt like I'd stepped back in time.    The style of the property internally is gloriously Art Deco with the occasional nod to Morocco. You had the feeling Bertie Wooster would feel very much at home here.    I stayed in one of the larger suites full of antique furniture from the time - amazing wardrobes desks and bed. The bathroom just stunning with 1920's mosaic bath.    They had a great sized swimming pool which is rare for a riad and definitely a plus after a hot day in the Medina.    They also have an amazing roof top bar where I enjoyed breakfast (amazing Moroccan pancake with olives - I should have asked for the recipe) but I can imagine is the perfect for a cocktail in the evening.    The staff were lovely. The Managers were excellent hosts and the owner was a delight to meet and clearly very passionate about his beautiful property - just as he should be - I'd move in tomorrow if I could.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Leigh S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!
Review_Text: I had the privilege of staying at Villa Makassar for four nights. As a solo traveler safety was my biggest priority. The management went above and beyond in accommodating my requests and helped me organize and make travel arrangements around Marrakech. The riad is wonderful and absolutely beautiful! The architecture has so much unique characteristics and you can tell there was a lot of thought but into each detail in the design process. The food is amazing (I recommend the seafood risotto) and the roof-top terrace is a perfect way to unwind after a busy day in the city center. The staff is outstanding and always made you feel welcome. I would recommend this riad to anyone visiting Marrakech. I can't think of a better place to stay and I will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Charlotte E wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at Villa Makassar a few weeks go and loved the hotel it was unique stylish and the staff were so friendly and helpful nothing was any trouble. It was our first time in a Riad and we couldn't recommend it enough so nice to have the personnel touch that you would not get in a large hotel. We would definitely go back on day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You must stay at Villa Makassar
Review_Text: My wife and I have just returned from a wonderful trip to Marakesh. We stayed in the Villa Makassar and were treated to a wonderful experience from the staff who couldn't do enough for you and the most amazing Spa session which was truly incredible. The management led by Quentin and Bilyana was never overly demanding but were always there to help with directions or in our case a wonderful bar/restaurant for our last night where they organising a table overlooking the city. Being 15 minutes away from the main square it was just far enough away from the crowds but an easy walk in and out each day. With a small outside pool and a wonderful roof terrace with sunbeds laid out and most importantly a bar where we enjoy nice glasses of wine each afternoon when we came back after a mad day in the Souks we totally chilled. I wouldn't hesitate to go back and stay there again a little gem with people that make you feel welcom.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Katharina J wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Perfect escape in an unique Art Déco atmosphere
Review_Text: We were glad to stay two nights in the grand luxe suite "Ruhlmann" which was an awesome experience. But not only the rooms are very comfortable and stylich – it´s also a pleasure to wander around the riad to "explore" all the Art Déco details of the owner´s collection. The rooftop is huge lots of space to relax on the cozy day beds. There are extra showers to refresh yourself but you also have a big pool within the riad. We´ve enjoyed the delicious breakfast and light meals from the restaurant on the rooftop. The service is excellent very friendly and always helpul. We are happy to come back as soon as possible!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had my first time in Marrakech and it was a perfect decision of me to go to the Villa Makassar. Very nice and friendly staff. Rooms are all in Art Deco which makes it very special und unic. Clean and perfectly quite. But if you want to go out its not far. Can highly recomend that Riad. The Restaurant has also great local and western Cuisine. Thanks and I will come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Return visit even better than before!
Review_Text: We first stayed at Villa Makassar soon after it opened 4 years ago our recent 3 day trip was just what we remembered but more so. From the warm welcome everything was as we wished; the staff friendly but professional the riad cool spacious and beautifully finished with genuine Art Deco features the food a real wow! Meals can be served at any time and wherever you fancyeven on the secluded delightful roof terrace. The menu offers a choice of International and Moroccan dishes all those we tasted were cooked to perfection with many we had not experienced before but would certainly go back for. In fact so good that we did not feel the need to try anywhere outside. We also very much enjoyed our treatment in the Hammam followed by a relaxing massage in the modernised basement of this former palace. This is a place I would really recommend to "get away from it all."
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect style, awesome staff - unique experience
Review_Text: The owner its passionate with art deco. Every detail is authentic. Perfect hideaway in the medina.    Very nice personal who will fulfill every wish you have.    If you like the idea of a riad and want to stay close to the central place Dschemaa el Fna Villa Makassar is the perfect choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having recently stayed at Villa Makassar I can re-iterate some of the previous reviews these led partly to our booking a four day break. I would add to those as follows;    Anyone who has walked in Marrakesh knows the street scene and the entrance into calm as you step through the door. The Art Deco (mainly French1910-39 ish when I think they ruled this part of the world) design an overall design deserves praise in concept and in the main execution. Polished plaster window proportions detail of ceilings light fittings chairs animal and bird influence straight cuts and lines square steel dark colours light colours lack of colour sculpture and a celebration of things unashamedly made by machine tools and welding.    The welcome and staff are in the main delightful some detail is less so. Any star rating generally lists facilities however sometimes less can be more and vice versa. Our room Paul Jouve is quite cosy very dark reasonable in size but suffered drain smells (due to water being drawn from traps) at some times of the day (air admittance valves required somewhere). The toilet cistern needs setting up or a small replacement seal. Had 10% of light bulbs blown (as has the whole building). It also needed one or two other little handy-man fixing jobs including the safe box. Thankfully crime seems low in Marrakesh so does any chance of anything being completely finished. This is deemed character in some places here at the rates charged maintenance should be pro-active and if re-active at least timely. Note-paper no envelopes or pen?    At this point I nearly forgot the reason I have sat and wasted half an hour at this keyboard. It was because with respect to mattresses there can be hotel quality and hotel luxury. The one in Paul Jouve is the former being the most unforgiving (read uncomfortable) hard one my wife and I have encountered anywhere in the world at any price point burn it now. It alone means I would be unlikely to consider return or recommendation. The lovely linen on it deserves better.    Maid service spot-on.    The pool is lovely on hot day though and no I don't mind the morning chorus either.    Anyone who knows the size of me may think I would mention food. The restaurant service is excellent for breakfast and dinner and the drinks not overpriced for this sort of hotel white wine could do with being cooler though. It is a shame more people have not found it and made it is busier in the evenings here and on the lovely roof terrace. The choice of having the breakfast anywhere is a nice touch as are many others in the public areas listed here on TA.    You are in the top few in Marrakesh you could be so in the world. So to detail finish your lovely concept hotel off the owner who I have not met should perhaps travel to Corbie France take Ismail and Eve (excuse spelling if wrong please) stay for a couple of days at where I remember as the most relaxing stay we have ever made your namesake Le Macassar.    Regards Mark
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: Hotel is authentic in its styling to Marrakesh but delivered with a tasteful Art Deco twist. Being located in the traditional Medina allows for a short walk access to the real Marrakesh experience the market is only 15 minutes away. Hotel is darkly intriguing with very friendly staff who are attentive but not intrusive. Hotel Manager Eve looks to make your stay special and works hard to achieve this. We enjoyed a traditional Hamman in the tranquility of the spa and loved relaxing on the terrace which was quiet and relaxing. Room was beautifully designed and clean with everything we needed. Food was excellent and well presented throughout although I felt there might be more light lunchtime options to eat.  I'd really recommend this to anyone searching to experience the delights of Marrekesh in beautiful. boutique surroundings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is the perfect retreat if you want to get away from the hustle bustle and madness of Marrakech.
