Located only 15 minutes from the main square (Jemaa El Fnna) the hotel is only a short stroll to most things in the old town (or a very short and cheap taxi ride if you are disabled/old/lazy).    The staff are incredibly attentive; going above and beyond there duty. The rooms are individual and uniquely decorated. One tiny disadvantage of most Riads are the rooms are a little darker than your prosaic plain apartment block as they're located in the heart of the city. A price I would happily pay.    I would echo some of the other reviews by saying more could be done with the roof terrace which is great for sun lounging but could be given some life for the evening.    Thank you Villa Makassar!  J&A
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: TonyB B wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: We recently spent 4 nights in Marrakech and stayed at the Villa Makassar. We quite late and were collected as arranged by the taxi to transfer to hotel. The hotel is located in the old medina and we had to travel on narrow roads to get there. From the outside the hotel looks unassuming but after passing through the entrance the hotel opened up into a central courtyard and was quite spectacular - tastefully decorated and maintained to a very high standard.  On arrival we were greeted by Ismail. After our complimentary refreshments he showed us around the hotel and even though it was quite late and the restaurant was closed he arranged for us to have a light bite to eat. We had a Grand Luxe Suite which was truly spectacular and provided us with everything we needed for our stay.  The reception staff were always very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. Eve the hotel manager was extremely helpful and always gave up her time to assist in making our stay memorable.  The spa is well worth visiting and provides an extensive range of treatments. The food at the hotel was of a high standard and traditional but they will provide alternatives if requested.  We really enjoyed our visit to Marrakech whilst the weather was hot the hotel provided a wonderful tranquil sanctuary to escape the heat and just relax.  The hotel has a fantastic roof terrace which we feel is underused - maybe some parasols and/or evening entertainment or BBQ evenings would make it a more usable space?.  Thank you to all at Villa Makassar for providing us with such a memorable trip to Morocco. We really enjoyed ourselves and have recommended it highly to family and friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed for 4 nights in August. Booked based on some prior reviews. Service was good staff couldn't be more helpful or friendly - Eve was a great example. Food was good breakfast was better than expected. The room was OK but despite having 3 different wireless networks my one gripe was the lack of a stable wi-fi connection in the room....basically never worked - didn't complain too much because the idea was to switch off for the short break but still wanted the opportunity to connect! Also the in room safe is not worth mentioning - if you are concerned about valuables then be warned its small and can be carried away quite easily. The location is just OK. Its a little out of the way from the main square (20 min walk) and there really isn't too much around the Riad....meaning that you have a walk every time you go in/out anywhere....other than this would recommend for a quite spa base.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a wonderful hotel. The décor is mesmerising throughout and it is such a quiet and relaxing place and importantly very clean. Hard to realise you are in a capital city. A good location about a 15 -20 minute walk to the market square with lots to see on the way. The sun roof is a real treat. It has double sunbeds perfect for relaxing in the heat (and it is hot). the pool area is very nice to cool off when you need it. all the staff are very friendly and happy to help the Service was superb excellently managed by Eve . Will definitely be back in the future. Would highly recommend this to any one looking at Marrakech.

We arrived late and had no problems with check-in or the transfer the riad had arranged for us everything worked smoothly and we were swiftly settled in our comfortable room. Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandie O wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: If you only visit one riad in Marrakech, make it this one
Review_Text: If you love cool stylish and sophisticated surroundings with wonderful staff a spa and great restaurant then look no further. We have just spent four nights at the Villa Makassar in the Kasbah in Marrakech and believe me everything good that's been written about this hotel is absolutely true. We arrived after a very long day and walked into an oasis of calm and tranquility. Built around a stunning courtyard this is no ordinary riad. It has only ten rooms all individually furnished with genuine art deco furnishings statues and paintings which are truly wonderful. Every detail has been hand picked from the taps in the bathrooms to the stingray (yes really!) covered table in the lounge. The owner Fouad has spent a lifetime collecting wonderful pieces which are there for everyone to enjoy and he took great pleasure in taking us round when we arrived.    The staff can't do enough for you they were wonderful - never in your face but always around if you needed something from breakfast in the little courtyard to one of the best tagines I had during the whole holiday organising trips guides and taxis to restaurants and generally advising about the best places to go. The riad is really centrally located in the Kasbah just a short walk from the big square and the souk and the amazing thing is that however mad and noisy the streets outside are once you are through the front door you could be in another world it's so quiet and peaceful.    I can really recommend the hammam where you're massaged to within an inch of your life then covered in black soap - but you come out with skin as soft as a baby! The spa is beautifully cool and very stylish - they even cut my husband's hair for him. Now that's what I call service!    This was our first visit to Marrakech but I seriously hope it won't be our last - but we'll only come back if we can stay at Villa Makassar. Thank you Fouad and all your staff for making this a memorable introduction to a fascinating country.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful art-deco villa, nice facilities, good location/ but service& quality-price ratio need to be improved
Review_Text: Stayed at Villa Makassar for 2 nights in November 2013 out of 4 days in Marrakech.  This is a villa in a good location and the facilities are quite nice: I especially liked the terrace (nice benches and sun beds)-perfect for breakfast & chilling out-where you're surrounded also by a lot of art & nice decorations.  - On the "pros" side: the villa is beautiful quiet common spaces are large& spacious. Facilities are ok [although pool looked small] & it is impressive that there are a lot of art objects (chairs decorated windows statues fountains etc]. In all fairness this place is special & I think the owner put a lot of efforts in renovation.  - On the "cons" side: we had a twin room it was small a bit dark & bathroom quite small too. Not 5-star standards and it must be pointed out that the service was not a 5-star either. We had to wait for over 1 hr and 1/2 for check-in after we called twice to let the reception know about the arrival hour [allegedly the room was not ready]. I was invited to have a hammam while waiting for check-in [I though it's courtesy] but surprisingly I found it on the invoice at check out. In the end reception was helpful took note of this & finally took it out from the bill but it required 20 min of discussions.  Overall: a pleasant experience beautiful decorated villa - but in my view they still need to work on the price-quality ratio and improve the service for an advertised 5-star riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I just cannot stop raving about the riad it's serenity the service the food and most of all the decor.    Clearly a labour of love the place has been meticulously designed with an eye for detail and a lot of the pieces have a history if you're as lucky as we were to get a guided tour of the place. Having stayed in many luxury hotels all over the world what stood out for me were the hospitality the homely atmosphere and the little nooks and crannies hidden throughout; whether it's the outdoor pool area the lounges the terrace or the spa. There are plenty of places to hide and be transported to a different world. Just step outside the riad and the chaos of the medina envelops you. Okay so the bath in my room was not the most practical & the room was a tad on the dark side; the decor is aimed at decadence so it was a small price to pay.    The meals we ate there were delicious freshly prepared and far superior to those served in the restaurants at Jemaa el Fna.    Although the riad was fully occupied during our stay it did not feel busy. The staff have all the time in the world for you and mentioning something to one member means it is cascaded up or down to the other staff. I've found many a hotel where such communication is lacking. The riad is perfect for adults looking for tranquility and luxury not too far from the action in Marrakech. This was my second trip to Marrakech and the Villa Makassar for me was the highlight of my trip to Morocco.

Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights in April. Have mixed feelings about this hotel.    The hotel has been decorated beautifully the staff pleasant and friendly. It was clean. Location is good.    We enjoyed the escorted tours around the city which they arranged as well as a day trip into the valley (caveat you are taken to "tourist" stop offs on the valley trip but as long as you accept this is the way it works in morocco then it is worth seeing and doing).    We only ate breakfast at the hotel (too quiet for dinner). Each day we were served a variation on a morrocan breakfast which was ok.    Onto the spa which was nice. Whilst the front desk talked to us about their spa menu and encouraged us to book a treatment we only realised after checking out that part of the hotel rate included a free hamman per room which was not offered and we had forgotten about. A shame.    The rooms are quite dark which some people might prefer but it didn't help that there was no full length mirror - even in our "deluxe" junior suite! However to the hotel's credit they did eventually arrange for one to be fixed onto the wardrobe door. The children's room although classified as a suite was not much bigger than a normal double but our deluxe suite was a very good size. Be warned though there is no overhead shower in the deluxe suite but one of those huge stone bathtubs which I find impractical - it takes forever to fill and too uncomfortable to lie in.    However some faults have unfortunately let the villa makkassar down and I am only posting a negative comment because after our experience I don't feel it is suitable for families and they should be aware before deciding to stay there.    When I made the booking I explained we needed a room suitable for a family of 5 and gave the ages of our children (14 12 and 9). I was told that the most appropriate accommodation would be a deluxe suite plus a junior suite which I went ahead and booked on a pay in advance non refundable basis. I was therefore expecting the rooms to be interConnecting and/or suitable for families. However on arrival although the rooms were next door to each other they were not connected in any other way. Whilst we often have this arrangement on holiday it normally wouldn't pose a problem. However in this case we were only allowed 1 key for each room so this meant if the kids wanted their door locked at night then they would have to hold onto the key and lock it from the inside and if we wanted access then we would have to knock on the door and vice versa with our room (the only other alternative was keep both doors unlocked all night). Hardly a safe situation and one which we were very uncomfortable with.    We had arrived at midnight and so because we were all tired and it was too late for the front desk night cover to do anything we reluctantly accepted the arrangement. However there was a laissaz faire attitude when we complained to the manager the following morning. Given the chance we would have checked out there and then but we had paid for the duration of our stay in advance and there was not a lot we could do.    Also it was annoying to pay a supplement for a deluxe suite which was a more expensive option and which we thought was being allocated on some "interconnecting" basis suitable for families when in fact it didn't offer any benefit at all.    Nevertheless what was almost worse was the smell of drains in both rooms but especially the children's room which was foul and unbearable. We complained about it daily and were told it would be dealt with. The first day housekeeping lit a candle. The second day the manager promised to bring a special machine to deal with the problem but it didn't help in the slightest. We were then told that every riad has the same drain problem.....but somehow I find this hard to believe. They refused to take money off the room but as a concession offered a free treatment for the kids to have a Hena and hair braided in the spa. I wonder if some rooms are more susceptible to the drain smell and these rooms are allocated to guests that have paid in advance so that they have no option but to put up with it...?    We had booked the hotel partly because it advertises itself as having a heated swimming pool so our plan was to tour the city in the morning and come back to the hotel for an afternoon swim and lounge by the pool. In reality the outdoor pool was not heated and was freezing cold. It is very small with one narrow sofa for lounging and framed by high walls so that the whole area is shaded by the afternoon. There is a very large separate roof terrace but no swimming facilities on the roof and apart from 3 cabana type sitting areas there were no umbrellas and therefore there was no respite from the heat. Consequently it was too hot to lounge there.....although I am sure it is delightful in cooler weather.    Although a beautifully decorated hotel all in all the hotel's layout didn't work for us and it let us down on too many other levels as well
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family
Reviewer_Location: La Fortuna de San Carlos, Costa Rica

Review_Date: Israt A wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Villa Makassar was like one of those surprises in life-totally unexpected and thus all the more beautiful for it. The place has been lovingly and passionately decorated by its elegant and warm owner whom we had the good fortune of meeting and talking to about the villa. This place is clearly a labour of love. The Art deco inspired decor is so special and at every corner you discover a painting or sculpture that catches your eye. There are so many different nooks and corners on the property where you can go sit sun bathe or listen to the birds at -there is real sense of peace and privacy which perfectly complements the hustle bustle of Marrakesh. Brilliantly located within the red walls of the Kasbah and just 15 minutes away from the main square once you step in through the doors suddenly all the chaos and colours melt away and you are greeted by sheer tranquillity and luxury.    We stayed in the Rosseau suite which had an amazing space and wonderful light. The real treasure in this stunning Riad is the staff who are so professional attentive and courteous. They go out of their way to cater to your every need and with beautiful smiles that reach their eyes. They were able to advise on things to do and can also set you up on some tours in the city or further away which have been personally vetted by them so the quality is really high. The food at the villa restaurant is impeccable- all meals are freshly prepared and so sumptuous and flavourful.    What makes this place so special is that despite the luxury service and elegance of the edifice-it feels like home! Intimate it is a perfect haven for couples and also works for families (I stayed there for 3 nights with my sisters and mum and we loved it). A luxury and comfort that is not pretentious and that you can mould into so seamlessly while leaving all your everyday troubles behind. I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for a memorable stay with personal service. Villa Makassar is a vital part of the wonderful memories we will treasure of Marrakesh. We left it and missed it even as we checked into a 5* hotel in another city. I have never felt that way about any hotel/establishment before...the sense of actually missing the walls the space soothing shadows bird song and staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: i have never posted a review on tripadvisor but always used its services but upon returning from this stay in villa makassar i felt i must share my experience so others will hopefully stay at this place is so amazing    Having just returned from this riad /villa i can only say what a special place this is in marrakesh From the moment we arrived we were made to feel like royalty the service from all the staff and owner is second to none we were greeted with such genuine warmth and interest  Such a nice surprise after a early flight from gatwick  its was lovely to stay in a absolutely stunning property with such a attention to detail to the art deco era .  This place is massive its about three or four riads together so it feels like you have it to yourselfs i think its only has 10 rooms and suites  The owner Fruad (fred for short )was so passionate about the riad giving us a tour of every area  It was so nice to meet someone so passionate about his riad and making his guest's feel totally at home and explaining where he had sourced all the beautiful furniture from around the world was amazing everything had a story attached to it .  The spar was amazing with the hammam and massage being probably one of the best treatments ive ever had  the location is great 15min walk to the main square and souks . He recommended us a restaurant for saturday night his recommendation was spot on just what our group wanted .  i can honestly say that there is not many hotels i would go back to just for the fact that its good to try different hotels but i would definitely go back to villa makassar and hope to very soon such a amazing place and only 3.5 hours from london    Thanks Fouad for this special trip i will never forget your special riad in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Joanna F wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: I have just returned from a four day break in this beautiful villa. I researched the villa on the internet before I arrived and the place really is as stunning as the photographs. The owner Fouad has excellent taste and each area has been furnished to a very high standard. It is a truly peaceful haven to come back to after all the bustle of this very busy city. The staff really couldn't do enough for you and I must give special thanks to Ismael and Rabii. The food was excellent with lovely freshly cooked breakfasts. A cocktail on the roof terrace is also to be recommended!! I would certainly come back to this lovely villa. Thank you for making my stay so special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have just returned from a short break in Marrakesh and I normally do not write reviews but this time I can't help myself as I believe that everyone should know about this gem in the middle of a busy city!  Villa Makassar has every possible comfort beautiful and tastefully designed rooms and relaxing surroundings that made our return from the busy Medina like walking into a man-made paradise!  It was my pleasure to meet the owner Fouad who made our stay very special and his personal attention and care was very much appreciated.  His staff is carefully selected and I feel obliged to name Ismael and Rabii who were so nice helpful "VERY GOOD SINGERS" and genuinely lovely people and made our stay very special. Thank you guys!  There is no other place I would stay if I went back to the amazing Marrakesh! Highly recommended!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I went to the Villa Makassar with my 16 year old daughter and we had a fabulous time. The hotel and staff were second to none. They looked after us so well and made the holiday spectacular. They helped us with trips and maps and told us about places to explore. The hotel is beautifully furnished and really luxurious. A real treat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We don't usually go back to the same place let alone the same hotel but Villa Makassar in Marrakech has proved the exception and for very good reasons. Morocco is a relatively short flight to a warmer climate and our last visit in June 2013 to Villa Makassar was such a treat we decided to return this year in April. Once again we were not disappointed. The standards of service and accommodation met all our expectations and the overall atmosphere of the Riad was peaceful and relaxed despite being fully booked.    There was a change from last year but a change for the better. The new chef has introduced an extended menu adding international cuisine to the existing Moroccan dishes. We ate in the Riad's restaurant 4 times this visit and on each occasion the food was of the highest quality and beautifully presented.    As other recent reviews have stated the staff the owner and the setting are all perfect and its location in the old part of Marrakech means it is in easy walking distance of all the historic parts of the city that visitors would want to visit. For those that want to travel further afield then the staff will make all your arrangements for you with a minimum of fuss. We went on a day trip to the Atlas Mountains and that was very special with excellent guides and booked by the Riad at a really reasonable price.    We are already thinking about our next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic stay! The riad the decoration food and service! An oasis in the middle of the buzz from the Medina. The owner who is super nice is the cherry on top of the cake. Recommended 100%. It was our first stay with them and definitely not the last!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patricia K wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: My husband and I have just spent five nights at this lovely riad. An oasis of calm and cool ' art deco' elegance. Lovely room and a huge bathroom which could have come straight from a 1920's film set but with all mod. cons. The staff were very friendly and helpful nothing too much trouble.We ate there on three nights. The food and service in the restaurant was excellent.. We especially enjoyed the live guitar music from Ismail. Breakfast on the roof terrace is a treat but beware of the wasps.After a day in the souks this is the perfect place to relax.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing art nouveau décor, wonderful staff
Review_Text: We stayed in Villa Makassar for a week in March.  It is a riad in the Kasbah at the south west corner of the Medina. It is an island of luxury in a sea of relative squalor which seems to be the same as most of the riads in the Medina.  The villa is set around two courtyards with around 10 guest rooms a restaurant various sitting rooms a hammam (spa) an outdoor pool and a large roof terrace with plenty of room for sun bathing etc. The Jacuzzi was huge and wonderful.  They have spent a fortune on the art nouveau décor which is very well done throughout. Our suite was VAST and there were some nice touches like rose petals on the bed and even down the loo! The bath was also huge and inlaid with art nouveau mosaic.  The staff were wonderful throughout our stay. They all spoke good English and could not do enough to ensure that our needs were met.  I would like to give Villa Makassar 5 stars but there were too many “rough edges” to warrant this.  Although the décor is amazing our room was starting to look “tired” and it was expensive (at around £250 - £300 per night) compared to 5* hotels in other countries especially as most facilities had to be paid for.  On the first evening we ate in the restaurant. The food was good but there was not enough of it and it was quite pricey (like most decent restaurants in Marrakech). The following evening we took the complimentary meal that was part of our package. They “shot themselves in the foot” with this as the portions were small and the food “average”. So we did not eat there again. This may explain why the restaurant was virtually empty every night unlike many other riads and restaurants in the area where you often have to book a table.  Although we are not TV addicts we do like to watch the news occasionally if it is available in English. Although there were hundreds of satellite channels available most were either in Arabic or French. Apparently some other guests were able to receive Sky News in English but it was not available in our room and they were not able to fix this during our stay despite several attempts. As they have been open for 3 years I would have thought they would have sorted this out by now.  Because there was no double glazing it was quite noisy in our room especially first thing in the morning when we were often woken by the call for prayer (around 04:45) and then the birds (someone shoot that pigeon!).  So overall a beautiful place with delightful staff but with room for improvement.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A girlfriend and I stayed here on our first trip to Marrakech recently. The hotel itself was beautiful and the service we received from the young lady at the front desk (I can't remember her name but she studied in Spain and had a great sense of humor) was perfect….she called taxis for us made dinner reservations and answered all of our typical tourist questions. We really felt like we had someone to help us in a place where we did not really understand how everything works. I will definitely go back!    Side note: The souks were great for shopping especially as an interior designer but as Americans we definitely paid higher prices! be sure to start at 10% of the price they ask and be willing to walk away…..know what your max price is before you start talking to them!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Such nice people here; nothing is too much trouble. You could have breakfast at any time wherever you chose which summed up just how flexible & happy to help these people are. Room was nice although a little dark.    It was my husbands birthday whilst we were there & they made a delicious cake as a surprise. They didn't have to do that it was a really nice touch.    Great location only a short walk to main square.    Can highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We just loved this villa in Marrakech. Low lighting fragrant oil burners...welcome mint tea and pastries while you check in. All super relaxed. Excellent spa...the only time I've experienced a hamman - absolutely loved it. I personally prefer smaller hotels. The service was excellent....if you asked for drinks in the room they arrived instantly. The staff in the restaurant and spa were ace. We were there on Valentines night and had a special menu with some entertainment - really fun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Margaret M wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: I cannot rate Villa Makassar high enough. From the moment we walked through the door to now when we are about to leave the staff have been exceptional especially Rabi who's professional and friendly attitude should be recommended. If you are looking a hotel with home comforts eat when you want where you want then this is the place for you. Villa Makassar is not just a hotel its an experience with exceptional staff and customer service. Thank you everyone. You made our 4th anniversary very special x

Myself and a friend just got back from a long weekend in Marrakech. As with the previous reviewers we received a nice welcome with mint tea and pastries. We were given a tour of the riad and finally shown to our room. We had the twin room. I was initially worried as some reviewers reported a bad smell butour room smelled lovely the whole time we were there. They had orange scented oil burners in the room whcih was a nice touch. The room size was perfectly fine but some elements let it down. There is in-adequate space in the bathroom for toiletries. We were two girls so had lots of lotions and potions and nowhere to put it. Not even a shelf in the shower area. The shower also sprayed water all over the floor after every shower leaving a soggy mess. We also found the room incredibly dark which was lovely for a lie-in but not very practical for applying make up and getting ready.    Breakfast is at anytime you wish which was also a plus as you don't have to rush. We never received a menu or much of a choice. Breakfast generally consisted of a small bowl of fruit each with 2 or 3 sweet pastry type things. On one morning chocolate cake. I love cake but not really first thing in the morning! A wider selection would be nice.    We used the jacuzzi one afternoon- very nice and huge! You could practically swim in it. A good tip- they have a heated pool next door and for a small fee you can use it. We spend a lot of time next door as we felt villa Makassar lacked atmosphere in the evenings. They have two lounge areas with fireplaces but the fires were never lit and the riad was freezing. We never saw any other people in the evenings. Everything was very very quiet. We sat in one of the cold lounges on the Saturday night and apart from a man doing some painting there wasn't a soul in sight. No background music nothing. You could hear a pin drop. Obviously some people would appreciate the silence but as two 30-something girls we wanted a bit of life. Again I highly recommend next door for a glass of wine by the fire. And musicians most nights.    We liked the location of the villa as it's one of the few accessible by car/taxi which is great after a night out. The staff were all very nice and helpful on the occasions we needed anything. I would recommend Villa Makassar for a romantic weekend or if you like things very quiet. We enjoyed our time here but if I would to go back I'd try somewhere a bit more lively.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a fabulous 5 days at Villa Makassar over Valentine. Walking into the hotel was like walking into an oasis of calm from a lively bustling world outside. The staff were incredibly helpful and the Villa is beautiful. Their website certainly definitely understates how wonderful this place is. It's a great location for the souks and their Hammam is something to experience. All in all we had a thoroughly chilled and indulgent time - including a wonderful birthday cake provided by them
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Straw Berries and Cream  Roast Beef and Horseradish  Gin and Tonic    All of the above compliment each other perfectly as do Villa Makassar and Marrakech! The Noise Colour Splendour and Vibrancy of Marrakech is both exciting and exhausting a calm relaxing place to stay is a must. Look no further than Villa Makassar.    My Wife and I celebrated my 50th Birthday with a 3 Night Stay at the end of February.    The Driver collected us from the airport as arranged and transfer to Villa Makassar was around 15 minutes. Once we arrived it was hard to believe that we were in the right location as the area does not look as though any Hotels would be located there.    However nce you go through the Impressive door everything is transformed into a World of tranquillity and luxury. Our welcome was warm with a guided tour and refreshments.    The Room we booked was a Deluxe Suite but were pleasantly surprised to be upgraded to the Grand Lux Suite which was fantastic.    During our Stay we booked the Hammam which was a real experience not to be missed.    The Meals in the Hotel are Tasty and there is a choice of Authentic Local dishes or a more European Menu.    The Hotel Booked a table for us at a Top Restaurant which included Belly Dancers which we both enjoyed. Taxi was also booked through the Hotel which was good value. The Driver was also friendly and safe! Unlike many of the other Taxi Drivers in Marrakech!    The only slight issue was on one occasion there was a smell of sewage in our room but the Hotel dealt with this by providing incense Lamps. I don't blame the Hotel for this as at the end of the day we were in a City that does not have the same sanitary standards as we do in the UK. . They dealt with the problem in the best way that they could very quickly.    The whole experience was great for my Wife and I we both loved Marrakech and Villa Makassar. The Service and Style will stay in our memories for a long time.    Thanks very much to Fouad and his Team.    Ian and Annna
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Last night at Villa Makassar is tonight. Excellent position in the Medina great room superb service. And no rain. I want to move here. :)    Everyone who works here has been kind helpful and cheerful. We'll be back for sure. An excellent choice for couples (am here with my wife) and being just outside of the most hectic parts of towns is good. Leaving with a suntan and a bag full of spices we don't need and probably won't use :)

Review_Title: An oasis for a special celebration
Review_Text: Regretting we have to leave. Excellent service with low key but highly professional staff. The Art Deco is superb. And we enjoyed the services of the Hammam hugely. We arrived on my daughter's 21st birthday and our stay at this lovely Riad has made it a very special celebration. The excursion to 'Berber Land' organised by the staff was worth the extra for our own transport and guides. February is cool within while gloriously sunny so do take layers to wear inside and out - people here do wrap up rather than waste energy. We enjoyed our meals breakfast snacks and a couple of dinners. I hope we will visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed in Villa Makassar last week and had a completely exceptional experience from start to finish. We were collected by the airport by their representative who was charming and informative and dropped us at this elegant and delightful riad. Fouad met us and sat us down with a cup of Moroccan tea and pastries and talked us through the riads concept and construction and then showed us around all the parts before taking us to our room. A wonderful space open large massive comfortable bed two wardrobes bang and olufsen tv fabulous bathroom with a stand alone bath huge shower and fabulous touches the water snake skin head board the cups brought back from the Taj Mahal the chairs bought from La Mamounia just lovely. This really set us up for the rest of our trip where the whole concept of this riad is you do everything on your own time. Wake up when you like call down and say in 10 minutes I'd like breakfast on the terrace and hey presto breakfast! Which leads me nicely to food.    The food here is amazing breakfasts of fruit salads yogurts fresh baked cakes pastries and breads luxurious jams Moroccan tea which we loved and juices. Then if you want more eggs anyway you like whatever you want. We had dinner here too and the food was excellent at dinner in fact the apple desert was sublime and the best desert we had in Marrakech and we did eat in some fantastic restaurants. The lemon chicken tagine comes highly recommended too. I'll leave it to Fouad to tell you the story of the chefs pedigree!    House keeping was fantastic. I can not fault it in any way at all everyday everything was as clean and tidy as when we arrived and yet I only actually saw them in our room once! They seemed to know when you were on the terrace or out and worked around you whatever the time of day. The general cleanliness and neatness of the whole riad was without fault.    We used the spa too which again world class. If you book spa treatments you get the whole area to yourselves so that's the jacuzzi/small pool and all the small but perfectly formed treatment area. We had the hammam body scrub and massage package and I don't want to give too much away because it'd spoil your surprise but what an experience delivered by two of the friendliest most professional people I have encountered and both my husband and I have had treatments in some of the best places in the world and I would come back here for this treatment over all of them.    The riad is beautiful and you can tell the love and dedication that has gone into it's renovation it has a history too so you do feel that you are in an amazing building. We loved it's position at the end of Rue de la Kasbah it felt like being in the real Marrakech walking down after sightseeing and seeing the shops and sellers and children playing football around us. It was a fifteen/twenty minute amble to Jemaa el fna but you really get to see some sights just getting there. And you can get a cab up to the door which is unusual here and worth it when you have cases.    Finally almost! The staff are amazing. 10 rooms and 20 members of staff you don't get better looked after than that. All of them were friendly charming accommodating and professional happy to chat with you and share stories of their lives which we were so happy to hear and really added to our experience full of humour and kindness. They know we have a choice over where we stay and they really want to make sure you have a great time we genuinely believed that. Happy to make recommendations bookings and help when their silly guests loose their cameras phoning all over Marrakech! I find it hard to single out staff as they were all amazing but Jusef and Noelle were just brilliant.    And if you are considering Marrakech and another destination then I can tell you that Marrakech is vibrant busy chaotic so different an experience to other short breaks populated by some of the funniest and nicest people you could wish to meet. And Villa Makassar is the oasis of calm. Will we head back? Oh yes!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely place, but not without its problems
Review_Text: First off - this place is gorgeous. Certainly the best example of art deco design that I've come across. It is also as the other reviews state a calm quiet oasis in the middle of what is a frenetic crazy place. The moment you step in you leave the world outside behind. However while it is a truly lovely place to stay it did have a few issues.    Location: At the far south end of the old city in a relatively quiet street of the Kasbah. Everything in the old city is at walking distance - all the monuments and the markets. Great location for the old city.    Design: Absolutely brilliant example of art-deco combined with subtle touches of Morrocan design. The public areas are wonderful especially the two libraries/sitting rooms downstairs.    Rooms: This is where the problem lies. We had booked a deluxe suite but the room left us slightly shocked on arrival. For starters the room had a disgusting smell that hits you in the face the moment you walk in. Secondly the room itself was narrow stuffy overheated and extremely dark. We also noticed that there was a 5cm gap between the door of this room and the wall itself! This meant that when the kitchen that was located below the room closed at night our room was flooded with the greasy smell as they aired the kitchen out. On the contrary though this room had an amazing bathroom - beautiful art-deco touches full of light a big bathtub a rain shower and lots of space. The bathroom itself was almost as big as the room. We weren't happy with this room though so we requested to see if any others were available - they showed us the only other room available at the time which was even smaller - and surprise surprise this room stank as well. So we declined the offer and stayed in our suite - requesting them to do something about the horrendous smell - suggesting that they could perhaps use one of their incense oil burners in our room? They did but it surprised us that they did not think of it themselves before offering us the room! Then we discovered that the bathroom drain was dirty and clogged. They arranged a plumber to come look at it who cleaned it out with his hands and it was sorted. We also discovered that they had only supplied us with one hand towel between two people so we requested an extra towel which was delivered. However the receptionist (one of the two French women) decided to be condescending about it the next day and went on to explain how many towels hotels typically supply and how drains work (!). This one person was incredibly rude and patronising (contrary to the rest of the staff who were all polite charming and did their best in the face of any issues) and we were glad we did not see too much of her during our stay. Her attitude really annoyed us. We also thought that for a hotel that charges as much as it does they really should buy a new set of guest towels because the ones they supply have clearly been used a million times and are nearly threadbare!    We were however promised an upgrade to the Grand Suite as a gesture of goodwill on our last day and we gladly accepted. The Grand Suite was absolutely lovely - and we noticed that the service we received in this suite improved vastly as well. But here's the catch - while the room was gorgeous and one of the best we've ever stayed in (and we've stayed in a lot of gorgeous design hotels around the world!) the bathroom attached to this room was entirely another story. For one it did not have a shower. It had a hand shower attached to the bath which was impossible to use without sitting in the tub. It was also much smaller than the bathroom of the deluxe suite we were in earlier. And to our utter amazement while this bathroom was well-appointed in other respects - in a hotel that prides itself on its art-deco theme and does it rather well - this bathroom had Indian (Rajasthani) decor! Quite befuddling and completely out of place. Also little things in the suite itself - for example two large beautiful art-deco lamps frame the desk - and neither is plugged into a power source and there is no way they can be plugged in either. Why are they there then?! Still we had a lovely stay in this suite and we appreciated the gesture. Strongly recommend to give the lower suites a pass and book the Grand Suites right away. The deluxe suites are certainly not worth the price but the Grand Suites are even at the top rates they charge. Had we know this is what we would have booked.    Food: This was the highlight of our stay. The food here is simply the best we had on our trip and we ended up eating in most of the time. The service in the restaurant was also really good - and almost everything that we tried on the menu was delicious. Highly recommended!    Service: Most of the staff and management were excellent - they do their very best to please and nothing was too much trouble for them. In fact Juliette the manager met us personally to review and sort out the issues we had had early in our stay. That was a nice touch and we truly appreciated it. We just wish we hadn't come across this one lady (mentioned above) whose attitude was supercilious condescending and patronising. With that kind of attitude she really shouldn't be in that job.    Overall a great place to stay in despite all the (minor) issues. We felt that this hotel lacks attention to detail - a lot of little things are wrong which add up to a large number and end up impacting your stay. Still they do their best to sort things out and make your stay memorable. If we return to Marrakesh we will still stay here - and hope they would have sorted things out by then.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis of calm and art deco ambience
Review_Text: Had a lovely stay there and would go back will go back! Don't waste your time in the souks/markets because they are a waste of time there are plenty of other interesting places and things to do in and around Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A stylish tranquil haven in the middle of the bustling medina
Review_Text: Myself and my husband stayed at this riad for 4 nights last week and we both agree it is the most stylish and lavish place we have both stayed. It's nestled in an unassuming road in the heart of the medina and it's very easy to get to jamna el fna from the riad on foot. Behind the front door however is a totally different world. From the moment we arrived we experienced brilliant customer's service from all the staff and nothing was too much trouble for them. Service was always prompt and efficient. Their moroccan food was particularly good and we actually opted to eat in the riad on more occasions than we initially intended because of this. We had a really enjoyable cookery class there too. In terms of the riad itself we were blown away by every aspect. A stunning courtyard was surrounded by gorgeous living and dining rooms done up in art deco style. Every aspect of the interior design from paintings sculptures furniture and fitting and fixtures were original art deco pieces and it was such a visual treat for us. I think the biggest selling point for us however was our art deco bedroom suite the photos on the website don't do justice to this magical room...id come back to marrakech for this alone! Excellent value for money too we honestly don't have a bad word to say about villa makassar. Thanks to the entire team for an unforgettable week

Review_Date: JEAN FRANCOIS G wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: a great and elegant place in Marrakech entirely renovated
Review_Text: if you need some rest in an entirely renovated Art Deco Style Riad  you will fine calm and elegance in " la Villa Makassar" . We have spent there a very nice WE with a very welcoming staff.  Fouad Graidia and his wife have spent a lot of time and energy to achieve their project and the result is admirable . Despite some small imperfections we have highly appreciated our stay in this magic place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This villa is fabulously designed and the attention to detail is superb. The Art Deco detailing is consistant throughout the villa from the square bowls in the restaurant to the art deco handles on the bathroom handles.  The rooms are individually furnished. One of the rooms are dark but the others have great lighting. The rooms are very comfortable and the meals prepared by the chef there is out of this world. They even offer cookery courses if you wish.  Even though the villa was almost fully booked it still feels quiet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed for 3 nights in this beautiful Art Deco riad. The attention to detail is incredible. The staff are very friendly & helpful. Our dinner was delicious & breakfasts were plentiful with homemade yogurts breads & pastries plus eggs if you wish. The rooftop terrace is a wonderful space to soak up the sun or stargaze. The hammam & massage were lovely & most welcome after a day in the souks. It is a reasonable walk to the main square but worth it to stay in such a peaceful place. Only one minor hint - the twin room very compact & bit gloomy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom G wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Just returned from our visit to this amazing riad - it's impeccable and one of my favourite places I've ever stayed! Besides being spotless the rooms are beautiful and each so different (we were lucky enough to get an upgrade on our last night which was very kind).  You just feel so at home here - there are several rooms downstairs where you can just chill out as well as the pool and the rooftop terrace (we had breakfast up there one morning). The breakfasts are amazing as well!  The staff are all great especially the manager. One of our bowls we bought from the souk was damaged when moving rooms and he was so kind in replacing it. Thank you!  A great stay and we would definitely return - I urge you to go and have a relaxing stay (our massages were very good as well).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mehdi T wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Its the first time I went to Villa Makassar with my wife. A friend of us told us a lot about this riad.    Indeed everything was perfect from our arrival till the end.    I loved the tasty food served anywhere and anytime you like.  The riad is very well located closed to the center and very calm area  I will definitely be back !

Villa Makassar is truly one of the best places we have ever stayed. Absolutely Impeccable!  This Riad has been beautifully restored with gorgeous Art Deco items in every room. The staff are superb being helpful and charming and nothing is too much trouble at any time of the day.  The calm of the Riad was wonderful after the dust and noise of the City.  We were made to feel like one of the family and a very happy family at that.  Thank you all at Villa Makassar for a wonderful five days. We hope to return to you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here on our first trip to Marrakech and what a find.  When you arrive from the airport and climb out of the cab it's a little like entering a parallel universe. This Riad is simply stunning decorated in original Art Deco pieces and immaculately clean it really is a pleasure to stay here.  Our host Souheil and his staff were extremely helpful and polite without being overbearing and the service given was impeccable.  We ate here on 2 nights and the food was delicious as was the breakfast each morning.  We were actually upgraded for no additional cost to one of the suites we thought the normal rooms were nice but the suites really are decadent.  Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Brilliant stay with fantastic staff and beautiful Riad
Review_Text: I organised a hen do for 14 girls to Marrakech in March 2013 and we stayed in Villa Makassar. We found a great package which included accommodation transfers and some food.    Villa Makassar was like a hidden oasis - the rooms and the Riad were beautiful. The rooms were all individually decorated and were stunning.    The location was great if you wanted to be in the old town and the Riad organised taxis/minibuses for us to take us to the new town - mainly for the evenings.    The food was delicious; we had dinner one night at the Riad and then we had our breakfast on the roof top terrace each morning. All the food was freshly prepared.    The staff were amazing - and very attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We also used the spa facilities which were great too.    And Juliette who helped me organise the hen do was a super star. She gave me advice answered hundreds of my questions made me feel confident and comfortable about everything I organised for the hen do and ensured the bride-to-be and all the hen's had an unforgettable weekend.    I couldn't recommend Hotel Makassar more = PERFECT!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Went with my wife in May of this year and this hotel is amazing! The hotel itself is beautiful and peaceful and the rooms fantastic. Our room was big and well equiped and located close to all the local attractions.    The staff are so helpful and friendly and made us feel at home. They went out to change money for us with minimum fuss and greeted us with some traditional mint tea and delicious cakes and pastries. There was complimentary wifi which was invaluable when looking online for places to visit and the breakfasts were excellent. As well as being a top class hotel the staff were so helpful and that makes the difference between a very good hotel and an excellent one.    We also used the spa facilities getting a back massage which was relaxing. We also used the pool area which was very nice.    If we ever go back and visit Marrakech then we will definitely be staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Literally just returned from a stay at Villa Makassar and was so overwhelmed by Souheil the Director and his wonderful team that although its close to midnight I wanted to right this straightaway . The villa itself exceeded all of my expectations. It is a truly unique and beautiful building furnished impeccably . But that isn't at the heart of the Villa..Souheil is. He is supported by an amazing group of people for whom nothing is too much trouble. Once they know you prefer tea to coffee at breakfast .. It magically appears . Want to eat outside. No problem. All way above anything I've experienced anywhere else in the world . However what makes this do special is that Souheil really does care about his guests who are encouraged to think of the Villa as home. This philosophy was certainly evident by the care I have received over the last 5 days in particular. Unfortunately I was taken ill the day before I was due to come home and had to have surgery; a scary prospect when not on home territory. Souheil just took everything in hand as if I really was a family member ! He called the Doctor ensured my partner could get to and from the hospital. Liaised with the hospital when translation was needed  visited me in hospital with beautiful flowers... His care was endless. I could just go on and on singing the praises of this kind man and his staff who all helped me and my partner at every opportunity. Souheil ... We will be back and I would encourage anyone wishing to visit Marrakech to make it a priority to experience this truly amazing rhiad.

Review_Date: Melissa M wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful and relaxing riad, made our holiday!
Review_Text: I can't really praise both the staff and setting of Villa Makassar enough. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 5 nights and have just come back today.    We'd never experienced staying in a riad before and weren't sure what to expect. Upon arrival we pulled up into a small busy street within the medina walls of Marrakech. The unassuming doorway led into a gorgeous tranquil space with high ceilings and two beautiful courtyards. The decor is Art Deco and very tasteful; a nice twist on the traditional Moroccan riad architecture.    We were greeted warmly and served traditional mint tea. We were told to treat the riad as our home during our stay - breakfast would be served whenever and wherever we liked (huge bonus!).    The hotel is spacious and quiet as there are only 10 rooms so perfect for an adult relaxation break. There is a huge roof terrace and a nice pool area. Staff are very attentive and there are little touches that enhance the experience of staying there such as sun hats on each of the sunbeds and the fact that staff bring you towels when you're by the pool or on the terrace sunbathing.    The breakfast was a wide selection of Moroccan pastries / pancakes which was lovely. We had 60 minute massages in the spa which were excellent - the spa area has a jacuzzi and hammam which all guests were free to use.    Our room was the S. Delauney junior suite and we were delighted to have a jacuzzi bath robes and slippers provided.    Upon check out we were very kindly provided with a room (which was actually an upgrade from our suite) to use free of charge until our flight which was late in the evening. I've seen from other reviews that they have offered this to many other guests which just shows the consistency of the excellent service they provide.    The location was spot on close enough to walk to all the main attractions within the medina walls.    Lastly we had a day trip to the Ourika Valley included in the deal we had purchased with the hotel that was a great experience particularly the visit to a Berber house and the hike to the beautiful waterfalls.    All in all I'd say this is the best hotel experience I have ever had which is why I was so keen to leave my review.    I will be highly recommending Villa Makassar to friends and family and hopefully returning some time soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Taslima Y wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: The hotel is situated in the old part of town (Medina area) literally 10 mins walk to Jemaa el Fna. You have to go through a few small roads to get to the hotel but after a day or two you will easily find your bearings. The hotel itself is immaculate. The owner really took care in designing this place and the little details really made it unique. The staff were great really friendly and provided the best service we could have ever asked for. We ate at the hotel restaurant a few times and the food was great. I took advantage of the Spa facilities which were fantastic and the girls down there were so lovely. The managers are great anything we needed they would arrange and also get us the best prices. The area which it is located in is quite busy at night but you cannot hear a single thing behind the Hotel walls. It was an incredibly calm and relaxing retreat. Only tiny negative was that our room had an odd smell but I can't complain because soon as we mentioned this to the manager he provided scented candles everyday without fail.    Overall it was an amazing hotel with such fantastic service and ambience on top of that the staff were incredible and treated us like family. We are already planning to go back and visit and would definitely book again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It has really all been said by other reviewers.    We had a lovely 4 night stay at Villa Makassar. All of the staff were really helpful and gave us good advice and recommendations booking taxis restaurants etc and made us feel very welcome. We decided we would like to use a guide for the first day for a few hours to get to know our surroundings and he promptly arrived and whisked us off to see the sights. He was very good.    Once inside the Riad you forget the hustle and bustle of the outside world. The rooms bed linens décor spa relaxing areas were all fabulous.    We had the best scrub ever in the hamman never had anything like it before and our skin felt wonderful and still does.    Thank you to everyone at Villa Makassar in making our stay so wonderful. We really did feel at home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a beautifully tranquil riad in an excellent location in Marrakech. It is beautifully appointed with care in the Art Deco style obviously a passion for the owners. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and the rooftop is a quiet spot for lounging and breakfast. The staff were extremely attentive. The hammam was one of the best that I have been to- relaxing invigorating and served by a professional staff.  The only problem I had was a bad odor in the room as it had just rained and apparently that can be a problem with sewage - fortunately I was able to move to another room that was smaller but it was so lovely I didn't mind downsizing. I would not hesitate to recommend this riad as it is a welcomed break from the sights sounds and smells of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Stephanie M wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: Fantastic stay in stunning Art Deco surroundings
Review_Text: I recently spent four wonderful nights at Villa Makassar. It was my third visit Marrakech but the first time I had stayed in a riad and I can honestly say that it was an amazing experience. As a fan of Art Deco I was in awe of the beautiful collection that villa possesses particularly the pieces from La Mamounia. The staff were so kind and helpful and assisted with recommending and booking places to visit and ensuring that we were comfortable at all times during our stay. The relaxing atmosphere in the villa certainly made it feel like home. The rooms are stunning and very comfortable with individual décor. Quality of food served is of a high standard and my mother would definitely recommend the pastilla as it is the best she has ever tasted. Spa staff also provide excellent treatments particularly the hammam experience. We were also able to keep our room until check out so that we could enjoy our last day without rushing to pack. Very few places would offer this facility and was a very kind gesture. My mother was also offered another room on the first night to make her stay more comfortable which was very kind of the staff. Many thanks to Souheil and his wonderful team for looking after us during our stay. I am looking forward to my next trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The owner and staff really make you feel welcome! It is quite evident that the owners have invested a great deal of money in the Riad and each room is wonderfully unique. I would highly recommend Villa Makassar to anyone visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alice T wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: I spent 4 days in Villa Makassar with my boyfriend. When we arrived the manager offered us some tea and upgraded our room: they let us choose the room that we liked more! they offered us an amazing breakfast - this was only the beginning. Rooms are luxury rooms with high end technology everywhere. The staff is always smily: they support you in every situation from booking restaurants till contracting the price for a cab. The SPA experience was a rebirth. When we had to check out they checked us in into another available room to have a last shower in the afternoon to feel better without anything additional to pay. It's not just that I would recommend it I will certainly come back. That was perfect.

This is a long review but I have so much to say and I promised it is worth the read!    Arriving at the huge beautiful door outside the alleys of Marrakech gave away little to what paradise I would find inside. My husband and I travelled from Toronto (via Paris) with our 3 boys ages 3 6 and 8. After combing tripadvisor for the perfect Riad four our family we decided on Villa Makassar. And oh my what a decision. My words cannot express the feeling of tranquility as they opened the door. The candle lit hallway and perfumed aroma set the mood for Marrakech. We were immediately greeted by Souheil the manager who we had been corresponding with from Toronto. As we proceeded through the villa we came to an open courtyard and two beautifully appointed 1920 styled lounges. Further into the villa was a dinning room second courtyard and kitchen. Souheil kindly showed my bouncing boys the pool area. To my delight the pool was nicely shaded and protected from the Morocco Sun and relief from the 45 degree heat. The area around the pool was quite narrow and seating was limited but enough for the children to play. Once we finished the ground floor tour we headed back to one of the lounges where Souheil had arranged for fresh fruit cold water and 3 bowls of ice cream! We learned quickly what “Marrakech time” was as we leisurely had a chit chat and then were leisurely shown to our rooms.    ROOMS:  The Parental suite was a large room with a king size bed and an adjoining room with two single beds and a rollaway for the toddler that they had pushed together as per my request. The décor stayed with 1920 theme with dark woods a curved chest of drawers and writing table in the boys rooms. Both rooms had flat screen tv’s and built in closets not a lot of drawer or table space for longer stays. The master bath had a huge almond shape tub and the children’s room had a stand up shower both very clean and modern.    I must say that this Riad and the unbelievable service made Marrakech for us. Never have I found a more hospitable establishment. The riad felt like a home away from home. My boys roamed freely around no safety issues. They even started breakfast alone under the watchful eye of our waiter and cook who greeted them every morning with hugs and kisses! One afternoon my husband and I booked a hamaam treatment that Souheil insisted that we tried while he looked after the boys. Souheil gave us the feeling of ease and comfort. After our 2 hr treatment we found the kids playing with him with smiles on their faces. Souheil honestly felt like family just half way through our stay. Our hamaam experience was also like no other. I highly recommend it.  Lastly we also took tours a city tour and the Atlas mountain tour. Souheil had arranged our driver Noorideen who spoke very good English and was very informative. I also recommend booking this through the hotel for less hassle.    I will finish by saying that this Riad and especially Souheil made our trip. Coming from the west I am a service oriented person especially travelling with young kids. I am so happy that we choose the Riad experience rather than a 5-star American style hotel that I could get anywhere. Staying in a Riad ensures you that personal service where the staff anticipate your ever move to make your stay more comfortable without being annoying. Souheil arranged for our tours negotiated our taxi’s made reservations in the best restaurants and loaned us a Marrakech cell phone to arrange for our pick ups from the restaurants when we were done. I highly recommend this Riad. Thank you to all the staff of Villa Makassar    A few tips:  -laundry was no extra for the kids a complete BONUS  -elevator for the stroller  -extremely safe environment and child friendly  -free wifi
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Andy R wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: We visited this beautiful hotel for three nights in July.    I booked a Junior Suite but we were upgraded to a larger room with an amazing open-air walk in shower and a separate bath.    Lovely cosy pool on the ground floor nice comfy loungers on the terrace (sadly no plunge pool). Dining room is and common areas are beautiful.    Food is great service is perfect.    Pre-book your spar-access though as sadly we couldn’t get in.  I would recommend this hotel to couples looking for a romantic getaway.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We arrived and we were greeted by Souheil the Manager of Villa Makassar from this moment on until we left we were truly in Paradise. We arrived late evening and Souheil had arranged a beautiful romantic Moroccan Meal on the terrace lit with Moroccan candle lit lanterns it was out of this world. The following morning the same little table was dressed on the terrace for our breakfast and laden with freshly squeezed orange juice pancakes French toast and other wonderful nibbles followed by omelettes and toast. We had a tour around this beautiful riad with suprises in each area. A lovely refreshing Pool to cool off in on what was a scourcher of a day a beautiful sun terrace (straw hats included to keep the heat off yr head) and an amazing Spa area with Jacuzzi pool and treatment rooms. The Art Deco design of this hotel is of outstanding beauty and really mixes well with the oldy worldy riad and the fresh plants and greenery make it truly exotic. The Villa is very central and only a ten minute walk away from the main square we had fun along the way buying a magic carpet as a souvenir of our stay. We had paid for a junior suite beautifully designed in art deco but were upgraded to the most amazing luxury Asian Art Deco Theme Suite across the way which made our stay even more amazing. The staff were absolutely fantastic so kind caring and on hand at all times. We had a Hamamm scrub in the Spa and the experience was out of his world our skin was like a babies when we left and you felt comfortable in the company of the beautician at all times .. a real must at villa Makassar. The food we experienced during our stay was amazing the cook was on hand and so friendly. From club sandwiches to the amazin Moroccan soup everything was cooked from scratch with fresh ingredients. Souheil and his lovely lady in reception helped us to find wonderful entertainment for both the day and evening and we visited some wonderful places during our five night stay. We really have to thank you Souheil and all your staff for making our holiday one in Paradise .. we will most definitely be back x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my wife recently spent 9 days at the Villa Makassar. From day 1 the staff couldn't do enough for us! Whatever we wanted (and I am not an easy resident!) they did their best to make sure we got it. What more can I ask? The position is good for all main attractions and of course it is quiet unobtrusive and select. I'm going to stay there again - why don't you?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Totally relaxing weekend at Villa Makassar
Review_Text: This was our first time in Morocco and we didn't know what to expect . We were very pleasantly surprised by the high standard of accommodation and excellent personal service offered by the staff especially the General Manager who went "above and beyond " to ensure our every need was catered for. The Villa Makassar itself is a delightful elegantly decorated peaceful and tranquil building in the heart of the Kasbah. The contrasts between the inside of the Hotel with its tasteful Art Nouveau decor cool and calm environment and the busy streets outside couldn't be more extreme but we loved it. A quick foray into the busy Souk to pick up a few hand made goods and then return to the hotel far from the madding crowd was a welcome relief . In fact we really didn't leave the hotel that much - just relaxed in this perfect place.  .  Thank you Souheil and the staff - we will definitely see you again !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights for our anniversaryloved the original Art Deco furnishings they were so beautiful and coming back after an afternoon in the medina it felt like a different world it is easy to forget you are in the middle of a city! The staff couldn't be more helpful and we didn't want to leave! Hoping to return again with my mother and sister I would highly recommend it. (Also relax in the courtyard and read through some of the stunning books from the reading room) Needless to say breakfast was amazing and huge- you won't need lunch!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A real find in Marrakech - home from home
Review_Text: Our first trip to Morocco and Marrakech was made entirely memorable by the superb reception and service provided by Villa Makassar. A Riad in the Medina with 10 rooms all of which are presented in genuine art deco style as is the whole Riad. Everywhere you look you see pieces and furniture from that period. We stayed in the Leleu room (a great upgrade) with the furniture all from the designs of Jules Leleu. The room was a picture as we arrived and Juliette who showed us round the whole Riad made clear that this was to be treated as our home for the next 6 nights. And that is the beauty of this hotel - you feel like you are at home with staff whilst there when you need them not pressing you always smiling and polite but also friendly.    The freedom to come and go as you please around the Riad making use of all the wonderful facilities such as the peaceful roof terrace or the cooling pool. The Spa facilities were excellent and the massages that we both enjoyed were of the highest standard.    We ate dinner twice during our stay and on both occasions were treated to home cooked traditional Moroccan food which was delicious.    Never having been to Marrakech we found the advice of the staff and the manager really helpful when planning our days and our situation in the Medina meant that we were never far from the sites of interest and the hustle and bustle that typifies Marrakech.    We travel frequently and like to vary our destinations but we have promised ourselves that we shall be returning to Marrakech next year and Villa Makassar. Perfect Riad perfect staff and perfect situation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: WE DID NOT ENJOY OUR STAY
Review_Text: The hotel is noisy the tv in our suite did not work the air-conditioning did not work the plugs in the bathroom did not work and at 10pm we had to ask the hotel staff to turn down the music played for the 1 or 2 dinner guests. The hotel appears to pay little attention to detail and it is not up to the standard we were expecting after reading the good reviews. Although there were some redeeming factors (we were upgraded to a very pretty suite and the manager organised us a salad after hours even though we did not book dinner) I would look elsewhere even if I had to pay marginally more. The location of the hotel is also not ideally located in the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: In a class of it's own
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful week long stay at Villa Makassar. Having spent a while reading the previous reviews on trip advisor before we went we arrived with high expectations.    The Riad surpassed all our expectations. As soon as you walk through the door it is like walking into an oasis of calm and tranquility. We were greated by the owner and Souheil the general manager paperwork was kept to a minimum and we were shown to a lovely cool lounge area with mint tea and pastries before being offered a tour of the riad.    The Riad itself is about 15 mins walk from the main square and only about 5/10 mins walk from the square for the jewish quarter with shops and restaurants as well as palais badi and the saadian tombs.    Facilities:    The Riad itself is just beautiful the courtyards lounges and seating areas are maintained to a high standard the roof terrace was one of the highlights of our stay. Perfect for a relaxed breakfast chill with a book on one of the daybed sun loungers - lovely padded cushions with towels and lovely big straw hats so you can stay nice and cool or a sun downer drink watching the walls glow orange in the sunset - just gorgeous and so peaceful it is easy to forget you are in the middle of a city!!    We also used the pool area - the pool isn't heated but is warmed by the sun during the course of the day - it is rather chilly but lovely to cool off in! I only ever managed a paddle but my husband swam and assured me it warmed up over time.    One of the great things about the Riad is the peace and quiet you don't have waiters hovering over you every minute making you feel you should be buying drinks etc. Instead there are buttons around all the public areas that you press should you need assistance like towels or drinks. I loved this aspect of the Riad as it meant you could really enjoy time together and as there are only 10 bedrooms and plenty of different areas to relax often we didn't see any other guests despite the Riad being pretty much full the whole time we were there.    Spa    As the weather was so good whilst we were staying and we did so much sightseeing we didn't have much opportunity to use the spa but did have a 1 hour massage each. The spa area itself looked lovely with a jacuzzi pool the hammam and treatment rooms. My massage was excellent - very relaxing and well done    Food    We ate at the Riad 3 nights out of the 7 we were there. One was a complimentary meal we received as part of our booking. On one of the evenings we chose to have a cookery lesson with Fatima the chef where we learnt to make moroccan salads and tagine - a great experience and the Riad arranged for Abdul to translate for us as our French is a little rusty!! On our final night we tried the couscous and a lamb tagine. Every meal was equally as good - the food is freshly cooked - you need to let the Riad know in advance if you plan to eat that evening as Fatima goes to the market and buys the products and herbs and spices fresh for each meal. Fatima is an extremely talented chef who seems to put her heart and soul into her cooking!    Breakfast was a great experience. We ate on the roof a few mornings and sometimes down in the restaurant - it is really up to you. Breakfast again is freshly made - we usually had homemade yoghurt or fresh fruit followed by a selection of baked goods - varying from moroccan pancakes cakes french toast and rolls. Different every day - served with Fatimas homemade jams and then the opportunity to have eggs as well. - we only managed lunch one day as the breakfast was so substantial! The orange juice served at breakfast tastes amazing!!    Service:    What sets this Riad apart from others is the staff who work there. Having spent time in Asia last year we didn't think we would find the kind of service experienced there again ... how wrong we were!! The staff go above and beyond to ensure your holiday is as special as possible! Nothing is too much trouble everyone in the Riad smiles at you and over time it really felt like a home from home.    During our stay it was our first wedding anniversary and Souheil and the rest of the team did so much to ensure we had a special stay. We were given a cake had our room covered in rose petals and as a suprise after spending the day out of the Riad visiting Essaouria we returned to find out that our room had been packed up and we had been upgraded to a suite for our last two nights - they had even moved everything for us!    One of the nicest things about the way the Riad is run is the fact your happiness and enjoyment of your stay is at the centre of everything. Throughout our time at Villa Makassar the whole team provided excellent service recommending restaurants - including booking for us and arranging the taxis directing us to points of interest arranging guides making sure we had a drink after we checked out before we set off for the airport giving us our room until we need to leave for the airport late afternoon.    They are so determined to improve and be the best they can - we were asked by a number of the staff how our stay was if there was anything that we thought could be improved on.    We have never been so sad to leave a holiday and would recommend Villa Makassar to anyone who wants to experience "Real Morocco" have a unique experience and have the relaxation and flexibility that comes from being in a small riad compared to a large hotel.    We will definitely be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Always good!!!!!! Even for the second time
Review_Text: We had a fantastic time at Villa Makassar. The decoration the staff the SPA the food the rooms the details...  We arrived very tired and we left very relax.
