Thank you to Souheil the Director to Fatima the fantastic cook to Zineb for the massage and Youssef for the service.  We miss you and we will come back as soon as possible.

Review_Date: Andrew S wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: Excellent service, good location, beautiful building
Review_Text: What a beautiful place; the Riad was absolutely stunning the finish was excellent and the whole place is very well maintained.    Location: The Riad is located about 10-15 minutes walk from the main square and the souks; it's not very far away and it's a nice walk. The location itself is near the old city wall and quiet.    Service: The service here was excellent I mean really above and beyond what you would expect. The manager spent some time with us coming up with places to go drawing where they were for us on the map and talking us through how to get there and what to expect. Additionally all those working here were very helpful and courteous. When we had dinner the waiter took the tables outside as it was a nice evening.    Rooms: The room we had was the most basic room and I have to say it was a little small BUT having said that it was n't tiny and it was very well appointed and maintained. I really like it.    Spa / Pool / rest of the hotel: The pool of the hotel is it ground level and is generally shaded also somehow the water is freezing (as it's meant to be) which is a refreshing it's a nice area. The hotel also has a Hammam which also contains a jacuzzi which is more the size of a swimming pool. It's really refreshing and a great place to relax after going out for the day.    All-in-all this is a great place to stay I know people have a tendency to rate place more highly that already have a high rating but this really was an excellent place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stunned by the beauty of this Ryad
Review_Text: We had 3 nights at this beautiful restored art deco themed Riad.Our room was exceptionally large a suite. The bed very comfortable with soft linens.Staff were always ready to help without being asked.No one was intrusive.Breakfast offered everything we wanted. The location was within the Kasbah where got the sensation of "this is Morocco". One small thing there are very few toiletries offered ie shower cap.We did make this suggestion to the management.  We recommend Villa Makassar if you want to experience staying in the Kasbah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sasipa K wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: What a relief when we arrived at La Villa Makassar.The beauty of the place  the kindness of all the staff and the impeccable service..Coming from Thailand we get used to a 5 stars treatment and we got the same feeling in this somptuous Riad .Decorated with an excellent tasteall the confort in the room.The spa and the hammam are a must .Wonderful breakfast that you can take any time and any where in the Riad.It was so peaceful that we did not want to go out .  It was my first experience in Morocco and I did definitely the right choice for our stay .  Will recommend this gem to anyone who want to see the real Moroccan hospitality .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Katy F wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: On entering Villa Makassar it is immediately obvious that you have chosen well. It is an oasis of calm and tranquillity. The bedrooms are stylish and the bed and bed-linen is luxurious and comfortable.    As with the majority of reviews for this property I would agree the service is excellent - not obtrusive in any way but every need is carefully catered for. Breakfast is served wherever you would like it and at whatever time you would like it - how often is that the case? Usually breakfast is served at the convenience of the hotel not the guest..    I have no doubt that Villa Makassar will quickly become one of the in places to know and visit a lovely experience and one I would not have any hesitation in recommending.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 3 nights of our 7 night trip to Morocco here.    Above and beyond any other praise I can give was the service we received. I travel a great deal to some very exclusive hotels/resorts and never have I experienced such outstanding service. The manager Souheil Hmittou is exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble.    From start to finish. His advice was superb on all aspects of our stay from shopping bargaining places to avoid things to see. His recommendations were accurate. He went above any beyond even organising all our restaurant bookings for the remainder of our trip after our departure from the Riad. He organised the same taxi driver to stay with us all week and negotiated the cost. When the jacuzzi didn't work in out room we were given complementary hammam and scrubs. Honestly I have never seen service like it. Always with a heart warming smile and such efficiency. He is an asset to Villa Makkassar and makes your the maze that is Marrakech that little bit easier.    The Riad itself is in an easy to find street in the Kasbah area and felt very safe. Only a 10/15 min walk to the main square. The decor is lovely and it's a tranquil calm space within the chaotic Medina. They even have a small outdoor pool as well as a wonderful roof terrace to soak up the sun.    Our scrub in the Hammam was truly amazing and I would recommend to anyone staying there.    Overall a great place to stay with service that you rarely find these days. Thank you Villa Makkasar. We look forward to returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed for a long weekend with some friends what a beautiful villa rooms were lovely and had all amenities. Staff were friendly and helpful I could not have asked for more. Would recommend anyone to stay here it can't be faulted.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: angie S wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: My first short break in Marrakech with my daughter and we found Villa Makassar to be the perfect Riad to stay with. Located just within the medina walls close to all the exciting hustle and bustle of Morrocan life and famous sights. The Riad was tranquil peaceful and welcoming. The mint tea we were given on our arrival was delicious as was all the food that was prepared for us.  I would certainly stay there again and recommend it to everyone I know.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Impeccable Art Deco architecture, excellent staff
Review_Text: This hotel is surely for you if you like Art Deco. The owner is a collector and "displays" his collection in the hotel and in the rooms. The hotel has just got professional management and soon could be THE place to stay in Marrakech as for the moment it slightly lacks liveliness. It is in the medina but not too close the bustle. It's staff is fantastic. The only downsides are the pool: which you should use in the morning if you want sun too and the price - try to negotiate. There is also a spa but we have not used it...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Villa Makassar is a beatiful calm Art Deco-type hotel that really takes your breath away. It's a secret little hideaway from the busy streets of Marrakech. The rooms are iconic the service is excellent and the staff is very generous friendly and service minded. Make sure you ask them for recommendations on restaurants and bars because they really know the top spots of the city. They sent me and my girlfriend to La Salama by horse(!) and we had the best meal we probably ever had. Go go go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nikki B wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: My Amazing weekend at Villa Makassar
Review_Text: This boutique hotel (Raid) is absolutely one of the best accommodation I have ever stayed in. The service is 1st class and no amount of money could buy how well we were looked after.  Throughout our stay every little detail had been taken care of by the staff at Villa Makassar.  We stayed from Friday 22nd March to Monday 25th March for my hen weekend and when deciding where to go we were looking for something reasonably priced but a place that was special and we could feel spoilt.  We were definitely spoilt from the moment we arrived until the moment we left. Everything we needed or requested help with was taken care of. The rooms and every area of the hotel decor is stunning. When you arrived all you could see was a wall with a wooden door but when the door opened you felt like you had just walked in to the secret garden a magical place that nobody knew was there.  We had breakfasts and two evening meals at the hotel the food was gorgeous and the service outstanding.  The Villa Makassar and all the staff made my hen weekend very special happy memories that will last forever.  I would highly recommend this Raid to anyone wanting to stay in Marrakech.  Thanks to everyone at Villa Makassar
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I was very suprised to find this Art Deco hotel in Marrakech it was like stepping into another world unique rooms with all details designed to perfection. Very helpful staff who even advised me to a fantastic restaurant thank you Juliette!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Wow..Villa Makassar was above and beyond our expectations!!  The service provided by Souheil and his team is just excellentits precise and custom made.They helped us with organizingtours with private guidesamazing choose of restaurantsshopping and everything was so "right on the spot of what we like".  Souheil and his team treated us like they known us for several years and knew exactly how to make hour stay in Marrakesh an outstanding experience!  I have to highlight that you can have your breakfastlunch and dinner when and where you want at Villa Makassar...the crepes for breakfast is just the best I have ever tasted.  We are already planning the next visit.    F & F
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Fran H wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: A true gem in the heart of the city
Review_Text: Villa Makassar exceeds expectations from the moment you walk through the door from the busy narrow Morrocan street. We were greeted with mint tea while the manager provided information on our location and local attractions followed by a tour of the Riad our home for the next three days. The property is exquisitly decorated each room uniquely furnished. The staff and service were second to none nothing was too much trouble. I would also recommend the Spa services.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a lovely hotel with an Art Deco theme. Each room is different. I had a standard room and found it very palacial. Souheil and his team couldn't do enough for my group. Everyone was so helpful and kind. The hotel is situated within a 20 minute walk to the main square. I hope to revisit it again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This Riad with it's warm friendly welcome should not be missed. We were given a very friendly welcome to our "home" for 3 nights by the Manager Souheil. This was my first trip to Morocco and I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the high standard of comfort and furnishings all very art deco. My room was amazing and the hotel was calm and the staff were very attentive. A big thank you to Souheil and his team; I had the very best time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Weyinmi O wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: I stayed at Villa Makassar on my very first trip (of undoubtedly many more) to Marrakech. If there is one word to describe this hotel it would be have to be cool. Great deco no two rooms could have been the same. I had the feeling like I was staying in a really cool friend's house. Staff is fabulous and friendly. Had a great a tour of the city with Nuhudeen (sorry if I misspelt) who knows the city inside out and taught me the secrets of an authentic tangine and a wonderful hammam scrub in the spa where the lady even washed my little chemise without any prompting which was incredibly touching. At the end of my stay the owner Fouad even gave me a bigger basket for my hand luggage so that Ryanair would not charge me 20 euros per kilo of excess luggage - I did not pay a penny more! Finally being from Nigeria I was really reminded of how hospitable Africans are here - everyone makes you feel so welcome and valued. Thanks for the great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: The Villa Makassar was the perfect venue for a recent short break where a number of friends and I stayed. Just a short journey from the aiprort and located in a quiet road off the main busy routesbut still a pleasant walk to all the main sites. On arrival we were made to feel very welcome and "at home" - nothing was too much trouble. My room was beautifulvery comfortable and the bathroom exceptional just a little more light and it would have been perfect.Breakfast was a real treat and varied each morning. Souheil the Manager and all off his staff made our visit memorableso friendlyalways had a smile for you and very professional. This Riad is definately worth a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A beautiful peaceful place to be.
Review_Text: I recently stayed in Villa Makassar with a group of girlfriends as soon as we walked into the Riad we were impressed. It was our first time to Morocco and we couldn’t have stayed in a more perfect place.    We were met by the Manager Souheil with mint tea and Moroccan pastries. The staff are welcoming and friendly. Throughout our stay the level of service was excellent all went out of their way to ensure our stay was as comfortable as possible.    We had dinner on the first night in the hotel and the food was delicious.    Souheil organised a day tour to the High Atlas mountains and our guide Noureddine was extremely knowledgeable and an excellent guide.    Whilst at the hotel we had a traditional Hamman in the hotel spa – not to be missed.    The Villa Makassar was a beautiful peaceful place to be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This was a surprise trip from my girlfriend and what can I say....this Riad is amazing.  The staff are very attentive - but not overly so that its annoying. The rooms were great and the décor is incredible. On arrival they talk to you about the owner and the décor - and its a great story. This was great for both of us and at times it really felt like our own home - as we would sit in the court yard and not see any other guests for ages......very relaxing. The pool was great the rooms great service great.....no wonder everyone else has given it 5 stars!  We went for 4 days - and we plan to go again but for longer. If you want to go and relax - but enjoy the hustle and bustle of the square in the evening - this is your place.    P.S Try the Hammam Spa too.......amazing!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We enjoyed the most wonderful holiday in your stunning Villa. It was our first time to Morocco and we couldn’t have stayed in a more perfect place. Everything about your hotel was perfect and it felt such a privilege to be surrounded by so much beauty. The staff are all so wonderfully helpful and special thanks goes to Souheil the manager who went out of his way to ensure our stay was as comfortable as possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vicky M M wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: It was like walking into a palace off of the crazy streets of Marrakech! The staff were extremely friendly as soon as we arrived at VM. I stayed with my sister for 3 nights & we had a lovely time. The place was just amazing and we were treated very well. The rooms were immaculate everywhere was kept extremely clean and the food was amazing! Would definitly visit again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful haven in a bustling city
Review_Text: My mother and I recently stayed in Villa Makassar and were thoroughly impressed by the Riad as soon as we walked through the door. You would never expect such a beautiful place to be there when you're on the manic but amazing streets in the Medina.  We were met by extremely friendly and welcoming staff and the level of help and service we received throughout our stay never wavered. The riad itself is stunning the furnishings and layout are amazing and the fact that the owner spent five years travelling the world to find them gives it a lovely touch. It is so calm and peaceful you could easily never see another guest if you wanted to and we certainly were never disturbed by anyone despite there being a large group of women staying there at the same time!  We ate in the hotel for dinner and lunch on two separate occasions and the food was delicious we certainly would have eaten there more were there not so much else to explore in the city!  On our fist full day Juliette organised a tour guide for us for the morning he was a very friendly chatty man who took us to all of the main attractions gave us some great advice on haggling eating and where to go and what to see. He also took us for a proper Moroccan meal which was fantastic.  We also experienced a traditional Moroccan Hammam in the hotel spa where we were scrubbed to within an inch of our lives and left with glowing soft skin. Certainly worth a try if you stay just don’t expect it to be relaxing.  In summary we would recommend this to any traveller I am 28 and would return with a group of friends or a boyfriend and likewise my mother would happily go back with my father or even a group of her own girlfriends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Wonderful charming and discreet luxury. The beautiful owner Juliette and all the staff will do everything to ensure that you are comfortable and happy and we certainly felt like privileged guests. Make full use of the facilities.The hamman/ jacuzzi is state of the art relaxation at its best. We' didn't want to leave and we're planning our next stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul E wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: A tranquil, luxurious oasis amidst a busy city
Review_Text: We stayed at Villa Makassar after seeing an offer for the hotel on Travelzoo.    Villa Makassar is a tranquil luxurious oasis amidst a busy city run by a passionate owner and helpful staff. Stepping in off the street through a large heavy door you’re instantly met with the scent of orange blossom and the gentle sound of a babbling fountain in the interior courtyard. After a traditional complimentary minty tea in the comfortable lounge we were given a tour of the building by the owner Fouad. It was fascinating hearing about his five year long quest to renovate the Riad in an art deco style picking pieces from around the world and bringing them together to produce a striking visual.    Our stay felt luxurious and relaxed the highlight being a breakfast of the freshest sweetest local orange juice Moroccan pastries and minty tea which we took daily on the roof terrace in full view of the Atlas mountains. We also took advantage of the traditional spa (the ‘Hammam’) for a steamy full body scrub massage and pedicure. The staff looked after us very well recommending and booking excellent restaurants and trips at our request. Any problems we had were swiftly taken care of.    If we ever re-visit Marrakech we will definitely think of staying at Villa Makassar again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Veronica W wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: The best kept secret in Marrakesh!
Review_Text: Thank you everyone at Villa Makassar for making our trip so special – we have fallen in love with Marrakesh! Fouad and his team have created a unique and luxurious palace where anything is possible and nothing is too much trouble. The hospitality is outstanding – it was like staying at a very good friend’s house because the staff made us feel at home straight away and couldn't do enough for us. They were generous discreet and attentive and the service was impeccable.    My boyfriend took me to Villa Makassar for my birthday and the staff made it unforgettable – from the flowers in my bedroom and bathroom the night before to an amazing breakfast on the roof terrace in the sun. They even went to the trouble of recording my favourite songs on a CD and putting a flower decoration of Irises on the table (my middle name)!    There are only 10 bedrooms but the riad is enormous so it feels very private and you could easily spend a whole day there without bumping into anyone else. Every room has a different personality and a different story with pieces of art collected from all over the world. They have thought of everything and the passion that has gone into creating the riad is obvious from the moment you step inside from the open log fire in our room to the goldfish in the ceiling of the spa to the chairs that match the mosaic fountain in the middle of the riad. We’ve already told our friends and family and we’re going to be coming back again soon before everyone else finds out about it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beuatiful elegant art deco riad in the corner of the Medina
Review_Text: This Riad is spacious and stylish with large rooms decorated with authentic art deco furnishings gathered from around the world. The rooms are beautiful it has a roof top terrace small open air pool and indoor jacuzzi.  Food was quite nice but not particularly special.  It is in the Kasbah district at the very edge of the Medina. The advantage of this is that you get the good feeling of being in the Medina and it is quite. The disadvantage is that you have a 20-30 minute walk to some of the main places in the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband & I had the extreme pleasure of visiting Marrakech and stayed at the Villa Makassar via Living Social deal in September 2012. Even before arrival to Villa Makassar I was in contact w/ the owner Mr. Fouad Graidia. He was extremely gracious and assured us that we would have a great time staying at the Villa & Marrakech. The trip did not disappoint! As a lover of Art Deco I absolutely loved the decor vibe and style of the Villa. The staff were extremely welcoming & gracious and made us feel nothing short of family during our entire stay. My husband got to experience first hand the joys (not) of having your luggage lost for 4 of the 7 days we were there. The staff made daily calls to the airport trying to track his lost luggage and laundered what he had on daily without request to do so. The fantastic experience extended to the guide that works wi the hotel Noureddine. Nour was knowledgeable and beyond fun. The outings exposed us to the many sides of Marrakech which was extremely rewarding. We would do it all over again in a heartbeat and if we ever get back to Marrakech - Villa Makassar would be our choice. My only regret is that it took so long to finally write the review - life in the U.S. is unfortunately back to normal. We need another vacation!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We got a great deal for 4 nights at Villa Makassar via Travelzoo. To be honest reading the reviews on here I did wonder if they were too good to be true.... but they are all true! This is a beautiful Riad lovingly restored and refurbished to an amazing level by the owner Fouad 2 years ago. The art deco style in all the rooms is sumptuous and there is attention to detail everywhere from the B&O TVs to the wonderful 'rain' shower in the bathroom. The staff were lovely and couldn't do enough to help us. The spa was beautiful and very relaxing (great massage). Its a 10minute walk from the riad to the souks or the staff will call a taxi to take you anywhere you want to go. As another reviewer noted the riad truly is like a oasis; as you step in from a visit to the dusty noisy (but not to be missed) souks you find yourself in a beautiful tranquil space that is perfect for relaxing. Not to be missed! Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Albert P wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: WOW!!! This hotel is excellentthe staff couldn't do enough for usthe decor fantaticwe felt that we were guests in a private beautiful house..a wonderful experience..I would highly recommend staying here ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Albert J wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my stay at Villa Makassar.  Well located in the heart of Marrakesh. This is a calm and relaxing hotel.  It is decorated with taste in an art deco style.  If you have to go in Marrakesh either for business or tourism I highly recommend this place !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Amy K wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: My friend and I have been dreaming of a trip to Marrakech for years and Villa Makassar exceeded our expectations. From the moment we were met at the airport we felt in solid welcoming hands. The staff were extremely professional kind and so hospitable. They helped us quickly find our bearings in the Medina and devise a plan for our stay. The meals were lovely and the hammam is a hidden gem. The staff there is also fantastic. It quickly felt like a home away from home and we were sad to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: caroline d wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: We just stayed for 4 nights at the Villa Makassar over New Year. Beautiful rooms and spa but the best things were the lovely roof terrace (very quiet very peaceful) and the immensely helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble. We ate breakfast on the roof terrace every day highly recommended. We booked a Junior Suite and were a little disappointed by the room but otherwise the hotel was truly outstanding and would very happily recommend it to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: liora c wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: Thank you to all the team of Villa Makassar! I had the best time! The service was amazing the kindness of everybody was incredible. The place is so beautiful so high standard  everything was perfect. I will definitely be back this time with friends or family because when it's that good you must share it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: If you plan to visit Marrakechthis is the place to stay...The service from the pick up at the airport to your check out is fantatstic.The riad Villa Makassar is located in La Medinain the heart of Marrakech and respect the pure tradition of a Palais d'Hotes with the authentic moroccan hospitality.The place is stunning in a pure Art Deco style mixed with excellent taste to  an authentic palace mauresque:Vintage furniturepaintingbronzecarpets and lighting are somptuous.The service is discreet but perfect.The breakfast is delicious with generous portion and you can take it any time and any where in the riad.I recommend the breakfast on the roof terrace with an incredible view on the Atlas .You don't feel any pressure and it is so calm and peaceful compare the life in La Medina.The service in the spa and the hamam are very affordable for a 5 stars.The atmosphere and the beauty of the place are so great that you don't feel to go out anymore.  I had the chance to visit all the rooms and they are all different very confortable with a huge B&O TVwith satellitea Dvd and a fantastic choice of movies at your disposition.I stayed in the Clement Rousseau suite and it was really amazing...  I can't wait to go back again in this hidden gem
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We had the most fantastic long weekend at Villa Makassar; from the moment we arrived to the moment we left was wonderful.  Our room was beautiful with everything you could want. On our first evening we had dinner in the restaurant and the food was incredible as was breakfast on the roof terrace. Whilst there we had a hammam and a massage and both left us feeling with an incredible sense of well being and calm.  All the staff are warm friendly and go out of their way to ensure that you have the best possible stay and that your every need is met. We also met the owner Fouadwho made us feel so welcome but it was fascinating to get a little history of the beautiful Art Deco furniture and furnishings all around the riad.  Highly recommended and we are already planning our next visit...!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my first visit to Marrakech and I had forgotten that I had come to see the city!. The accommodation and the staff were outstanding. From the time I arrived to the day I left I felt so welcome and safe. The art deco design is fabulous and there is so much attention to detail - it seemed weird having a bang and olufsen tv in the room - but it also added to the quality. I came in the quiet season - but i think that meant i appreciated it more - it's a secret you do want to share - but not with too many people. The food was good and the portions were huge...but i still managed to eat it all. I cant express enough how much the entire team made me feel welcome - everyone was very friendly and genuine. it was a great relief from the madness outside - i mean that in a nice way. but it was very calm and serene in contrast to city life outside.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Our first stay in a moroccan Riad was a very nice experience. The staff were friendly and helpful and tried very hard to please. The waiter even brought me crepes when I asked if the breakfast (served on the roof top)was a traditional Moroccan breakfast because he thought that I was unhappy with what we had!  They arranged a tour (a little pricey) for us with a very knowledgable guide that spoke english and looked after everything we needed. The room was clean and pleasant although a bit small as rooms in riads tend to be.  The Riad is centrally located close to the Kasbah the madina the souks and the King's palace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: MY boyfriend and I visited for a 7 night stay in October and this being my first time buying a living social deal I did not know what to expect -- however the hotel service and accommodations far exceeded my expectations! I enjoyed the fact that the hotel is on the smaller side and therefore the service is more personalized;Fouad the owner greeted us upon arrival and helped with the arrangements pertaining to our Living Social deal as well as making us feel instantly right at home. He also had arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport (and take us back) and everything went seamlessly. The entire staff was so lovely and accommodating and had wonderful recommendations. We could call each morning and request where to have breakfast but I must say my favorite spot was on the beautiful roof where I also enjoyed laying in the sun and relishing in the quiet as there was only ever 1 other couple at most while we were there. I would highly recommend the spa Hammam package - this was amazing and a highlight of the trip!!! The location of the hotel is also excellent - located within walking distance to the center and gardens. We also had an incredible guide that the hotel arranged for us - we had one day trip included in our package and some of the sites I wanted to see were outside the city so we decided to do a few trips. I had no idea it would be just us and the guide (Noor) and he was so knowledgeable speaks excellent English was so entertaining and just a lovely person. We felt so taken care of during our stay I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. As well as Marrakesh in general - I would definitely love to go back and see more and recommend others travel here as well!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Couldn't fault the service, beautiful rooms
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I came here for 5 days in September. When we first arrived we were in awe of the place it was one of the most beautiful hotels I'd ever seen. The room was spacious and I loved that is came with a jacuzzi! We made a good use of the pool each day it wasn't a huge space but luckily we were the only ones that seemed to go down there so was nice to have it to ourselves the whole time! One of our only criticisms would be that where the pool was built it was beside a wall and so the whole pool was usually in darkness by 3/4pm and so if you wanted more time in the sun you would have to go up to the roof. The staff were second to none and couldn't do enough for you there was always someone around you could ask for help/information/food/directions and they were so friendly you sometimes ended up in half hour long conversations with them. The highlight of the place is by far being able to have breakfast on the roof. I couldn't think of a better way to start the day and the food was amazing with something new everyday! The Villa Makassar and Morocco was an amazing experience and I would certainly recommend to all my friends and family to stay there if they ever went to Morocco. You wont be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Such refinement !    As soon as we arrived at the airport everything was taken care of: Our driver picked us up and drove us to the Riad; Never in our dreams could we have imagined the treasures that laid behind the discreet entrance door of Villa Makassar!    We were fortunate to be personally greeted by the owner whose passion for Art Déco was evident. He showed us around and spoke about the many artefacts and art displayed around the Riad which he gathered during his travels around the world.    Our room was simply luxurious the breakfast generous and the staff discrete and very welcoming.  We opted for a half-board stay and over the next 4 days we were spoilt and enjoyed delicious meals.    Special thanks to Raouia head the SPA a miracle-worker who spoke perfect English.  We will definitely come back to Villa Makassar not in August however as the weather is just too hot.

Everything was perfect. Fouad & his team are excellent hosts. Pack 1 hammam and massage is nearly 2 hours of pampering! And all for about £ 43 .....  Remember to bring your camera as the Art Deco attention to detail is stunning. The bedrooms are individually styled and make staying here very memorable

Review_Date: Deborah S wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: An amazing oasis in a truly wonderful country
Review_Text: My husband surprised me with a trip to Marrakech. I couldn't have been more delighted with the villa he chose. It is a true diachotomy of serene accommodation and exciting chaos of the city. What a beautiful place to return to after a day of climbing the Atlas Mountains or shopping in the medina.    When we first arrived at the villa on a flight from Spain it was nearing midnight in Marrakech. The evening clerk greeted us with such warmth and said "Come in you are home now. It is late and we will take care of the paperwork tomorrow. You must rest now." At first glance we were in love with this special place.    Foud and the staff are amazing and most accommodating. From the attention to detail in the decor to the amazing meals (thanks to the fabulous chef) to the special spa - hammam treatment and the roof-top deck...it is spectacular. In the mornings you wake to the enchanting sounds of call to prayer. I cannot say enough...    We will be back again to visit our friends at Villa Makkasar. There was only one problem. It ruined us for other hotels.    Deb & Brad - BC Canada
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Villa Makassar is surely one of the most prestigious and original Riads in the Medina. The luxury of the art-deco Mamounia combined with the intimacy and charm of a real Riad. Each room is an original creation draped in luxury and the Spa is really something to see. Also very conveniently located for the Medina; there is always a taxi outside. A perfect Marrakech retreat!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bruno T wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: Great location, amazing service and food
Review_Text: Great location in the Kasbah in the centre of it all but with easy car access to the rest of the city andthe souks. The staff at the riad is extremely helpful and the food amazing. It is done to order and picked up daily so give the kitchen a few hours warning to get meals ready. We had many delicious dinners at sunset on the terrace. Every suite has a different design and the common area mixes Moroccan and art deco design. That made for a relaxing vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great time staying at this villa it was so peaceful and beautiful plus the attention to detail against it's '20s design was amazing - even the teapots were art deco!  The thing that stood out for us the most though was the helpfulness and the friendliness of the staff there. They couldn't do enough to help us and nothing was too much trouble. Thank you so much for making our stay so enjoyable and would definitely recommend to anyone coming to Marrakech!

Review_Title: Perfect escape in luxurious and tranquility
Review_Text: I do not know where to begin as we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Villa Makassar. My first experience was with Fouad the owner who responded to every email request quickly and thoroughly. When we arrived the staff was very welcoming and the atmosphere was serene. We had the good fortune to have a chance to meet Fouad on our first night - it was a pleasure to speak to someone who loves what they do and takes pride in their business. The attention to details in the riad were incredible with absolutely everything thought of to make it the perfectly 'Art Deco' themed escape. Our food was delicious and massages were divine. I have been to Marrakech 6 times and would definitely return for a stay with Fouad and his staff. It was very well located to anywhere we wanted to go and we could not have asked for more attentive service. We went to Marrakech this time for a special occasion - my partner's birthday. Fouad had the kindness and generosity to upgrade us to one of their nicer rooms. Do not miss a chance for an unforgettable escape at Villa Makassar !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lisa N wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: My friend and I were after a short but unique break and that is indeed what we got! Stepping inside the unassuming front door you are transformed in to the 1920's and thats where you stay. Every detail is thought of and lovingly put together by the owner. The staff are funny and attentive and so helpful. The food was the best we tasted in Marrakech! The delights of the basement spa ensured we came back to the uk feeling like new people so relaxed after such a short time! Every last detail is taken care of the mirrors the cabinets the silver tea pots the deco cutlery the beautiful lamps and artwork. This all leads to the amazing ambience created. I would most certainly go back and would most definitely recommend this riad to anyone looking for a unique place to stay. With only a small number of rooms it ensures you feel valued and welcomed and nothing is too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Thank you to everyone at Villa Makassar for such a wonderful stay. Our every need was catered for to the very best of your ability. Very impressive art deco design each piece skillfully placed and sourced with careful consideration from around the world even down to the stone flagging on the floor.  The Riad is cool and tranquil and the Spa is excellent it is one of the highlights of our holiday the Masseuse is the hidden jewel in the Riad's crown! The food is excellent and the best we had in Morocco! Although there isn't a gym we could have a personal trainer come to the Riad if we had wished to. We loved sunbathing on the roof and had everything we needed delivered to us!  We have come home feeling relaxed and refreshed with lovely Moroccan memories  Thank you once again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I have to admit that Villa Makassar is one of a kind. It is by far the best ryad I have seen. The design and decor was made with a great unique taste which I have seen nowhere so far. You feel you are in a totally homy facility. The staff was extremely friendly and hospitable and so is the owner. They made our stay very enjoyable and unique. I had the best time in Marrakech thanks to Villa Makassar. I would definitely recommend to everyone I know. Good job and Thank you!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Philip F wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: A Place for calm, quality and excellence
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Villa Makassar made all the better by the caring attitude of all the staff and the fantastic decor that is found within this riad. It is plainly evident that much work has gone into the redesign of the Villa and sure enough it has taken 5 years of very hard work to achieve the standard that is very self evident.  It is also very clear that the quality found within Villa Makassar is not just in the building and decor it is also found within the staff attitudes and their approasch to their work. We enjoyed dinner on the first evening having arrived late due to delays at immigration and as with everything at Villa Makassar the meal was delicious from start to finish and nothing was to much trouble.  The Villa is situated in old Marrakech near the Kasbah region and not to far from the Royal Palace. Although only just in old Marrakech he Medina is within walking distance taking approx 15 - 20 mins at a pace to suit the weather. Taxis into the Medina area cost for the 4 of us approx 50 dirham if this was preferred to walking particularly if returning to the Villa after a days sightseeing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Richie H wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: My partner and I enjoyed our stay at Villa Makassar immensely.    The quality of the riad is excellent and we were immediately impressed with the design décor and ambience. All members of the team were fantastic and very helpful ensuring that our stay in Marrakech was everything we hoped it would be. We loved our hammam and spa experience!    I would happily recommend Villa Makassar to all our friends and family should they wish to visit Marrakech. We hope to visit again in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: sue c wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Marrakech has a wealth of wonderful hotels making it hard to choose. We found Villa Makassar a very special place and a choice we are very happy we made. Monsieur Graidia and his wonderful team are kind and authentic. The Villa is beautiful renovated with care and decorated with deep expertise. We enjoyed dinner on the roof a wonderful massage and the ambience of the salons and dining room. We appreciated the care of the team.The atmosphere is restful and refined but not intimidating. We found it was relaxing to take in the atmosphere over a drink in many internal and external rooms of the Villa.The location is the Kasbah is great the outside road takes a car and a people carrier. It was wonderful that the team accommodated our different ages - our young adults appreciated the Villa as much as their slight older companions!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: When i got out of the taxi i couldn`t even imagine what will wait me inside. Simple walls of the building like through all Marrakech. But after the doorman opened the door i was getting inside gorgeous dark hall with stella statue in the end of it. Very nice first impresion. Villa itself is a redisigned riad and it was made in a great way. Owner have a great taste. He mixed gorgeous objects made of precious materials to creat a special and unique athmosphere for each room. I got a room after Jacques-Emile Ruhlmann with a great mix of real old Mamounia pieces of furniture wich was bought on the auction with beautiful modern details like a great python skin covered head of the bed or pink slope skin jewelry box. Bathroom was really big as well with a nice roof window so u can have natural sunlight in the shower in the morning. There are 2 pools - indoor in the spa and open one. Water in the open one is a lil bit cold but ok. From the spa u can use elevatore to get to the roof top terrace with the bar ( it was clothed when i was there) where u can tan all day long. At the sitting room there are a lot of albums about art and decoration so i was spending part of my eve lying on Corbusier`s chaise lounge watching throuh them. As i was there during non season time ( Ramadan) i was all alone there so service was all up 2 me (regarding breakfast dinner and so on). Hotel have its own really strong character and spirit. Should be visited in Marakesh.And in contrast to bustle Medina area i was really feel i want not to get out of this beautiful place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: If you're looking to stay in the Kasbah area this is a nice hotel. Quite modern lots of dark wood and furnishings in the rooms.    Our aircon didn't work in our first room so they kindly moved us to another room. Then the TV stopped working so they opened up the adjoining room for us to use the TV in there.    Its a shame that there were not more guests I think we were the only people for most of our 4 night stay but it was low season start of Ramadan and 45-48 degrees everyday!    The food / breakfast was very good - no complaints there. The hammam was also nice with the scrub and massage.    This place is about a 20 min walk from the main square though so if you're looking to be closer to the action you've got to get taxis or walk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Jonathan H wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: We went for 3 nights and really enjoyed our time there. From the second the front door closes behind you you forget all about the noise and bustle of Marrakech.We found it very peaceful with great and friendly service.Would definitely go back again some day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Linda L wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: A nice way to treat yourself :)
Review_Text: Everything one would expect and more from a 5 star accommodation can be found in Villa Makassar.  We checked in late in the evening as we had just came back from the desert… but straight away we were very impressed with the décor and the details of every corner of this villa.  In the morning we were greeted by very kind and professional staff. The very delicious continental breakfast was served very generous portions and breakfast is served at anytime at last someone understands that when you are on holiday you don’t necessarily want to set your alarm to make it on time for breakfast!!  After breakfast we were shown around the beautiful villa we had the opportunity to have a peek at the other rooms and immediately you realise that every room was unique and done up to the highest standard. We were very impressed by one of the rooms and the management team offered to upgrade us to this room as it was available (great customer service)  The Villa has a beautiful terrace which is very well maintained and clean towels were available at all times  The swimming pool was very nice and clean.  The sauna hammam and beauty spa downstairs are very nice and have a very nice ambiance. Again the finish was of very high standard and little details that you can’t help but appreciate like aquariums above you whilst relaxing in the spa room.  I would def. recommend the massage. The lady was very professional smiley and lovely.    We had dinner and couple of lunches. The dinner was very good and the dessert was exceptionally tasty.    I very much doubt that you will be disappointed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I came to Marrakech with my sister. Being two women traveling alone we were nervous at first. However we immediately came to realize how safe the city was. Our riad was beautiful! The art deco theme was gorgeous the service staff was fast and were warm and friendly. As soon as we got there the manager met us took us on a tour and let us pick our room. We were allowed to stay in a senior villa even though our living social promotion said junior suite which was nice! We stayed in the Victor Sassoon room. It was spacious clean and decorated beautifully. We had a tv and a dvd player which was great because we brought a lot of movies. The bathroom was extremely modern and also clean. We also had a table with two chairs and a leather couch. Perfect room for two people. The daily breakfast was very good and the lunch menu was delicious. The terrace is absolutely beautiful and the perfect place to lay out in the sun. The manager Soufiane is amazing and made us feel like we were at home. He's hysterical! The office staff organized every single excursion for us. We didn't have to do anything! They even hailed our cabs for us. Everything was taken care of. If you only speak English ask for Nour as your driver. He took us everywhere we went stayed with us all day when we went out and was almost like our bodyguard. He has great experience even working with royalty from England who come here. He would take us for our excursions during the day and then take us out to Marrakech at night and made sure we were okay all night. This vacation was simply the best and staying at Villa Makassar made it even better. Next year we plan on going on a Eurotrip with our parents and we are planning to bring them to Morocco and of course staying at Villa Makassar!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Like the other reviewer - this hotel was booked via a promotion.    First impressions - excellent. We arrived at the Villa around 11.30am was welcomed paperwork was kept to a minimum and we were escorted to a reception room where we were served green tea and pastries excellent. Then we had a small tour of the Villa - again excellent. We were then informed that our room was not ready fair enough and we elected to then go to the roof terrace to relax. At 13.45 over 2 hours later - still no room. Nobody came to inform us how long the room was going to be - whether we wanted to have something or perhaps go somewhere nothing. It wasn't until I went downstairs and asked - I was asked whether I had my room yet was then escorted to the room - which still wasn't ready.    We then decided to explore a little - so we came back to the Villa later in the afternoon. Firstly the satellite box wasn't working. I tried one of the members of staff tried another member of staff tried and finally the manager (owner?) tried. Still nothing.    When I had alerted the staff to the TV issue I also had to ask about the time of the dinner as well as the breakfast because there simply just isn't the info in the room nor is it communicated. I additionally requested a bottle opener and one of the members of staff said that she would speak to the boss. No corkscrew was received. 30 minutes later I went on the search for the elusive corkscrew and found out why I hadn't received it. The manager (owner?) was at reception and when I asked for a bottle opener he dispatched a member of staff for one. But then he had a few words with me.    He asked me where I had bought the wine and that normally they don't allow outside alcohol to be brought in from outside. FIne - but my view is that unless I'm told then how can I abide by these 'rules' but I apologised and said that I wasn't aware - which I wasn't . But the second part of the conversation was more troubling. He then told me that because we had such a great deal on the room then basically he needs to make his money somehow so..... Question: so if I had paid top price would I be able to bring in alcohol - the indication was that I would. It would have been nice if somebody had come to tell me that's why I had received no corkscrew rather than me again asking for it.  End result: the member of staff came to my room - I gave him the bottle of wine he opened it and then took the corkscrew away. All very very strange....    The 'piece de la resistance' was when I reviewed my bill when I got home. I had been overcharged!!! Not for one item - but for 2 items. It was well 'hidden' but the calculation on the bill was wrong. Am I being paranoid if I think that it's another way to recoup the difference between what we paid and what the list price is? I emailed the owner. I was promised a refund. 4 weeks later - nothing. I emailed again. Finally I got a refund!!!!    My advice to the owner/management - treat every customer the same. You have set the price for the rooms whether it's direct a promotion etc. If you don't want the business don't do the promotions but this guest segmentation/categorisation/racism will not win you many votes of approval. Nor will you create an empathy that makes guests spend on those additional items - in fact quite the opposite - they will try their best to make sure they don't.    The WIFI coverage is patchy at best - unreliable - and also very very slow.    Despite what one reviewer wrote we found the breakfast on the roof excellent. Lot's of choice ample quantity - really really good. The same goes for the included dinner Really really good.    BTW - the description of the Villa states that the outside swimming pool is heated. It isn't.    My advice - if you have the money to pay full list price stay at the La Sultana just up the road.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: As two ladies travelling alone to Marrakech we were keen to stay somewhere that felt safe as well as indulgent and we couldn't have picked a better riad than Villa Makassar for our adventure.  The staff were so friendly and welcoming we felt very special. The twin room we stayed in was spacious clean and attractively decorated. The bathroom was nice with a good shower although drainage was a little slow. The breakfast was plentiful and especially lovely on the rooftop terrace. The dinner was equally good. We had a brilliant fun hammam and body scrub experience followed by a very relaxing massage. The jacuzzi was a little cool on the first day but the current machine is a good idea for a small pool.  Villa Makassar is about a 15 min walk to the main square but it is a straight road and in a good area so we didn't mind doing it even late at night. The door has a security camera and the staff will look out for you when you return.  I really don't think I could fault the place and would jump at the chance to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Constance R wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: The Villa Makassar riad is just as beautiful as in the pictures. Everything is new and spotless. The floors are cool and the marbled bathrooms a pleasure. There are many nooks and crannies throughout the hotel where we sat and enjoyed the art the singing if birds and a cool drink. The staff is very friendly and professional able to advise and willing to help. The manager Fouad is a warm and cosmopolitan man. The day trip they arranged for us to Atlas Mountain villages and nature walks was a highlight. We were 2 single women but this is also a hreat place for a romantic getaway.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sue B wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Villa Makassar is a wonderful riad with its beautiful 'Art Deco' interior with every attention to the finest details. It is located in the hustle and bustle of the Kasbar where real Moroccon life goes on but as soon as you enter the front door its tranquility awaits. We found the owner of the villa very hospitable and his staff attentive and polite. They were wonderful helping me with phone calls to the airport to retrieve my lost luggage which arrived two days later. Our room was both comfortable and chic and the food we had a chicken and lemon tajine as well as the breakfasts were very good. I would recommend the villa also for its location only about a ten minute gentle stroll to the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Villa Makassar for a few days at the beginning of April. We couldn't praise the accommodation more highly. The attention to detail was outstanding and the owner Fouad was charming. He has sought and found the most exquisite artefacts from the Art Deco period and furnished his Riad with his prized possessions and made the villa quite beautiful. It is a privilege to be able to view the art and furniture whilst also enjoying the calm and serenity of this oasis in the middle of the busy narrow streets of the kasbah. The staff are all most attentive and pleasant. The manager Sofitane went way beyond the call of duty when a taxi we had ordered failed to arrive and he drove us to the restaurant himself.. A gem of a place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for four nights at the Villa Makassar within the walls of the Medina and only a ten minute walk from the lively square Jamma al Fna. The hotel has been completely refurbished in an Art Deco style with original furniture and original art including 19th Century posters adorning the walls of the rooms and the public areas. We were there last week at the beginning of the tourist season but the weather was against us with average unseasonable temperatures of around 16C if we were lucky. The staff are superb and very attentive. The Spa offers a Hamman (steam room) and massage facilities with a jacuzzi. The walled outdoor pool looked fabulous but due to the weather we decided to give it a miss. The owner Fouad Graida is perfect as "mine host" and will make sure you have a good time. Will we go back - certainly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I have just returned from a memorable 3 night stay at Villa Makassar. We can't speak highly enough of the accommodation levels of service friendly and helpful staff and the great location in the Medina. In particular the manager Sofiane is efficient friendly and welcoming. He arranged excellent guides for us for a walking tour of the Medina/Souk and a trip to the Ourika mountains and recommended a beautiful Italian restaurant where we dined. Our room (Jules Leleu) was stylish spacious and comfortable and breakfast on the roof terrace each morning was a particular highlight. The Riad was an oasis of tranquility away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina. We both had relaxing massages in the Spa at the Riad and there are small indoor and outdoor swimming pools. I would recommend the Riad for a relaxing stay in wonderful Marrakech and wouldn't hesitate to return for another stay in the future.

My mother & I had a memorable stay at the Villa Makassar in December 2011. We used a travelzoo voucher to treat ourselves to a trip to Marrakesh with a stay at a luxury riad :) Villa Makassar is situated down a slightly noisy street in the Medina but you would never know it as its a quiet zen of a place once you walk inside.    The voucher was a fantastic offer as it is a very beautiful art deco riad beautifully laid out with its own indoor pool and hammam. The deal included dinner as well as a hammam. Dinner was delicious; canapes chicken tagine and a delightful pastry dessert called Ktefa. Our waiter was particularly attentive and very friendly and helped teach us some arabic words to get us by during the stay :)    We had a lovely twin room. We had a problem with the shower as it didnt have hot water but as soon as we reported it someone came to look into it immediately and when he couldnt help the charming owner came round to investigate. We were promptly given a key to another room we could use for the duration of our stay to use the shower there (even though our shower was fixed the next day).    Our hammam at the riad was a fantastic experience. Do not leave without having one!    On the whole a delightful stay in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Marion G wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: An amazing Art Deco riad made of two riads joined together so you have plenty of communal areas and it does not feel clostrophobic like some smaller riads do. I have NEVER seen such attention to detail and luxury in a riad (and I have visited many). No wonder this hotel has been featured in top interior design magazines! The owner is delightful and the staff very attentive. After the Mamounia was re decorated in a less art-deco way Marrakech needed a beautiful art deco place and this is it! Easy access by car all the way to the riad's entrance great central area.  And it has a pool and a state of the art spa. Note that the pool is separated from the rooms so even if kids play in it you won't be disturbed by the noise.  The riad is very quiet you won't get woken up by the call for prayer at 5am!  Could not recommend it more to anyone looking for elegance luxury and style in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Craig M wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Living Social / Groupon? Beautiful Riad - Treatments & Food Sub-standard
Review_Text: This place itself is stunning however to sum it up there are two very different levels to this place and what they offer. If you stay here paying full 'rack rate' I imagine it is perfect. I had a peek at the other rooms and they look amazing. Myself and my partner stayed here on a Groupon / Living Social Deal still at 130 quid a night and as we were on the 'deal' you could not help but notice you were offered sub-standard service. The room we had was 'okay' nowhere near as nice as the others. Shower pressure is rubbish and there was a leak from the roof the ceiling into the bathroom which was left to drip onto a towel.  We were looking forward to our inclusive meal which turned out to be a joke. Soup for starter was awful one chicken leg for our mains course accompanied with nothing was actually quite tasty and dessert consisted of 3 slices of oranges & 2 Slices of Kiwi Fruit & a dusting of cinnamon. Soup & Dessert was sent back to the kitchen with not even a question to ask how our meal was. Wine was paid for and very poor taste along with the poor tasting coffee throughout the stay. Breakfast is not even worth typing about.    Do not pay for a massage as it turns out to be a back rub by one of the kitchen staff. Very annoyed we did not bring this to the owners attention.    Having said that as a whole the Riad is beautiful and if you were paying full price and if the food on offer is as suggested in their website then fully recommend it. If you are going on a 'deal' well put it this way we certainly won't be going back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We've just stayed in this fabulous hotel situated right in the old part of the town in the medina.It was absolutely fantastic.We want to go back as soon as we can. The service from Soufiane the manager and his attentive team was superb. From when we arrivedto the mint tea provided before our free transfer to the airport was faultless. The Art Deco interior is amazing we've never stayed in a hotel as beautiful or luxurious before. Our room was so comfortableI wish I had a bedroom like it at home.We've not slept so well for ages.Very quiet.The bed-linen and pillows felt lovely to the touch.  The food was excellenta real slice of authentic Morrocco cuisineand we could even have an alcoholic drink which is hard to come by outside.The breakfast was up on the sunny roof-terracea great start to the day.There was even a lift provided for elderly/disabled residents.  The bathroom was plush and lavish. The shower was incredibleit even had music.Largethick dressing-gowns and slippers were provided. There was plenty of storage spacea large digital tv and air-conditioning/heater.  We'd certainly reccommend this hotel to anyonewe hope to go back very soon.A big thank you to the team for such a wonderful stay.All the very best !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had the pleasure of staying in Villa Makassar for 5 nights recently and cannot praise it highly enough. We arrived by taxi arranged by the hotel and were slightly anxious when it drew up in a narrow street in the heart of the Kasbah where nothing appeared to have changed in hundreds of years - but what a surprise as we entered the hotel through a dimly lit corridor into a beautiful courtyard where all was calm and tranquility! We were warmly greeted by very gracious staff and from then on we were treated to nothing but first class service and attention. Villa Makassar is a stunning bistro hotel restored in traditional riad style but exquisitely furnished with original Art Deco furniture and accessories - the whole building is a work of art. We were very fortunate to be upgraded to the grande executive room which was fabulous however we were able to see some of the other rooms which are all stunning each with a different theme but with the Art Deco style running throughout. During our stay we treated ourselves to a hammam in the lovely spa which we can highly recommend. The charming owner Fouad Graidia can be justifiably proud of what he has created at Villa Makassar and his wonderful staff make it very hard to leave when it is time to go!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was the highlight of our stay. It is location is perfect being walking distance to the main attractions in the old town. The hotel is themost beautiful tranquil snd elegant establishment you could ask for. The rooms are spacious and immaculately clean. Food was delicious. However the best thing about the hotel was the warmth and helpfulness of the staff. They would go out of their way to accomodate all our needs.

Art Deco meets Marrakech....who would imagine! Exquisite architecture design service and food. Villa Makassar is located in the center of Marrakech providing a perfect balance of real Marrakech and superb luxury. My husband and I enjoyed every detail and can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jorge P wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: I insisted on going to Marrakesh - it was my 3rd time always trying to find what attracts so many people.  The crowd the heat the noise the smell are the same and have not changed much in 30 years. Well it's different from what we are used to in Europe and pardon my expression that con be considered snobbish being different is not always enough. Nowadays instead of handcrafts from Morocco whose authenticity was already arguable in the 80ies when have now fake Vuittons fake Cartiers and fake Polos mixed with some plastic and a very few shops with medium quality crafts.  Modern city is disappointing - an ostentatious nouveau-riche style based on cheap "main d'oeuvre" where you may have a first class dinner at Le Grand Comptoir for instance for a third of price you are used to pay.  "Harassment" by sellers is tooooo much!  For me that's not enough and is not the definition of an "exotic" destination!  Villa Makassar was my fortress in this "hostile" environment.  Quiet beautifully decorated elegant and delicious dinners and above all a warmly and intelligent reception by the owners and employees. made my stay in Marrakesh become positive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Calm luxury inside the Medina- a real "find"
Review_Text: We were whisked from the airport by Jaguar in just 10 minutes; outside we left the bustle of the Kasbah to enter a really special haven which was quite unexpected. The warm welcome took us through the stunning courtyard with a sunken fountain surrounded by comfortable sitting rooms furnished in Art Deco style as are all 10 individually designed bedrooms with period pieces collected from around the world. Our room was superb very comfortable with nice extra touches and incredibly quiet (no children allowed). The staff treated us like royalty nothing too much trouble and no fixed times for dining. The meals were a highlight of our 3 day stay. The Moroccan chef prepares a wide range of local dishes beautifully; we left the choice to her and enjoyed one excellent meal after another much more varied than we would have expected. The spacious courtyards outdoor pool and rooftop terrace with bar and tables to dine on if you wish with the stunning Atlas mountains as a backdrop add to its splendour. There is also an indoor pool luxurious hammam and spa where every beauty treatment and massage is available. Altogether a truly amazing experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A little gem in the Kasbah
Review_Text: My husband and I chose Marrakech as a weekend destination from the UK as it's only around 3 hours away from London. We were looking to stay somewhere special for 4 nights and were told about this new 'Art Deco' hotel in the Kasbah so we decided to give it a try.    We were picked up from the airport by Jaguar limo and the drive to the Riad took about 10 minutes. From the moment we walked in we knew this place would be special: we walked down this cool elegant corridor at the end of which stood an elegant Art Deco statue which seemed to greet us ! The place then 'opened' up onto a bright courtyard. We were greeted by a smartly dressed friendly (and multilingual!) gentleman who turned out to be the owner who showed us around. Every room (10 of them) looked amazing and different in style.    We slept in the Africa-inspired Clement Rousseau room which was very large and comfortable with flatscreen TV complimentary (non-alcoholic) minibar ensuite bathroom and even a large marble fireplace which they lit up for us. Meals consisted of delicious Moroccan dishes and our waiter Mohammed was excellent. We loved the Winston Churchill bar - very cosy with comfy leather seats. The hotel isn't far from Djemma-El-Fna square and souks etc so it is a great location for sightseeing as well.    This hotel was nothing like we had ever seen before so different and full of beautiful works of art. It was a lovely break from cold grey London and we are looking forward to going back !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
